1.sl: V začetku je Bog ustvaril  nebo in zemljo.
1.en: In the beginning God  created the heavens and the earth.

2.sl: Zemlja pa je bila pusta in prazna, tema se je razprostirala nad globinami in duh Božji  je vel nad vodami.
2.en: Now the earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep. God’s Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.

3.sl: Bog je rekel: »Bodi svetloba!« In nastala je svetloba.
3.en: God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.

4.sl: Bog je videl, da je svetloba dobra. In Bog je ločil svetlobo od teme.
4.en: God saw the light, and saw that it was good. God divided the light from the darkness.

5.sl: In Bog je svetlobo imenoval dan, temo pa je imenoval noč. In bil je večer in bilo je jutro, prvi dan.
5.en: God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. There was evening and there was morning, one day.

6.sl: Bog je rekel: »Bodi obok sredi vodá in naj loči vode od vodá!«
6.en: God said, “Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.”

7.sl: In Bog je naredil obok in ločil vode, ki so bile pod obokom, od vodá nad obokom. Zgodilo se je tako.
7.en: God made the expanse, and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse, and it was so.

8.sl: Bog je obok imenoval nebo.  In bil je večer in bilo je jutro, drugi dan.
8.en: God called the expanse sky. There was evening and there was morning, a second day.

9.sl: Bog je rekel: »Vode pod nebom naj se zberejo na en kraj in prikaže naj se kopno!« Zgodilo se je tako.
9.en: God said, “Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear,” and it was so.

10.sl: Bog je kopno imenoval zemljo, zbrane vode pa je imenoval morje. Bog je videl, da je dobro.
10.en: God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters he called Seas. God saw that it was good.

11.sl: Nato je Bog rekel: »Zemlja naj požene zelenje, rastlinje, ki daje seme, in drevje, ki na zemlji rodi sadje s semenom po svoji vrsti!« Zgodilo se je tako.
11.en: God said, “Let the earth put forth grass, herbs yielding seed, and fruit trees bearing fruit after their kind, with its seed in it, on the earth,” and it was so.

12.sl: Zemlja je pognala zelenje, rastlinje, ki daje seme, in drevje, ki rodi na zemlji sadje s semenom po svoji vrsti. Bog je videl, da je dobro.
12.en: The earth brought forth grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, with its seed in it, after their kind: and God saw that it was good.

13.sl: In bil je večer in bilo je jutro, tretji dan.
13.en: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.

14.sl: Bog je rekel: »Naj bodo luči na nebesnem oboku! Ločujejo naj dan od noči in naj bodo znamenja za čase, dneve in leta!
14.en: God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;

15.sl: Naj svetijo na nebesnem oboku in razsvetljujejo zemljo!« Zgodilo se je tako.
15.en: and let them be for lights in the expanse of sky to give light on the earth,” and it was so.

16.sl: Bog je naredil dve veliki luči: večjo luč, ki naj gospoduje dnevu, in manjšo luč, ki naj gospoduje noči, ter zvezde.
16.en: God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He also made the stars.

17.sl: Bog jih je postavil na nebesni obok, da bi razsvetljevale zemljo.
17.en: God set them in the expanse of sky to give light to the earth,

18.sl: Gospodovale naj bi dnevu in noči in ločevale svetlobo od teme. Bog je videl, da je dobro.
18.en: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.

19.sl: In bil je večer in bilo je jutro, četrti dan.
19.en: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.

20.sl: Bog je rekel: »Živa bitja naj mrgolijo v vodah in ptice naj letajo nad zemljo pod nebesnim obokom!«
20.en: God said, “Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of sky.”

21.sl: Bog je ustvaril velike morske živali in vsa živa bitja, ki se gibljejo in mrgolijo v vodah, po njihovih vrstah in vse krilate ptice po njihovih vrstah. Bog je videl, da je dobro.
21.en: God created the large sea creatures, and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.

22.sl: In Bog jih je blagoslovil in rekel: »Plodite se in množite, napolnite vse morsko vodovje! In ptice naj se množijo na zemlji!«
22.en: God blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.”

23.sl: In bil je večer in bilo je jutro, peti dan.
23.en: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.

24.sl: Bog je rekel: »Zemlja naj rodi živa bitja po njihovih vrstah: živino, laznino in zveri zemlje po njihovih vrstah!« Zgodilo se je tako.
24.en: God said, “Let the earth bring forth living creatures after their kind, cattle, creeping things, and animals of the earth after their kind,” and it was so.

25.sl: Bog je naredil zveri zemlje po njihovih vrstah, živino po njenih vrstah in vso laznino na zemlji po njenih vrstah. Bog je videl, da je dobro.
25.en: God made the animals of the earth after their kind, and the cattle after their kind, and everything that creeps on the ground after its kind. God saw that it was good.

26.sl: Bog je rekel: »Naredimo človeka po svoji podobi, kot svojo podobnost! Gospoduje naj ribam morja in pticam neba, živini in vsej zemlji ter vsej laznini, ki se plazi po zemlji!«
26.en: God said, “Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the sky, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.”

27.sl: Bog je ustvaril človeka po svoji podobi, po Božji podobi ga je ustvaril, moškega in žensko je ustvaril.
27.en: God created man in his own image. In God’s image he created him; male and female he created them.

28.sl: Bog ju je blagoslovil in Bog jima je rekel: »Bodita rodovitna in množita se, napolnita zemljo in si jo podvrzita; gospodujta ribam v morju in pticam na nebu ter vsem živalim, ki se gibljejo po zemlji!«
28.en: God blessed them. God said to them, “Be fruitful, multiply, fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth.”

29.sl: Bog je rekel: »Glejta, dajem vama vse zelenje s semenom, ki raste po vsej zemlji, in vse sadno drevje, katerega sadje nosi seme. Naj vama bo v hrano.
29.en: God said, “Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is on the surface of all the earth, and every tree, which bears fruit yielding seed. It will be your food.

30.sl: Vsem živalim na zemlji, vsem pticam na nebu, vsemu, kar se giblje po zemlji in ima v sebi življenje, dajem  v živež vse zelene rastline.« Zgodilo se je tako.
30.en: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food.” And it was so.

31.sl: Bog je videl vse, kar je naredil, in glej, bilo je zelo dobro. In bil je večer in bilo je jutro, šesti dan.
31.en: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.

1.sl: Tako sta bila narejena nebo in zemlja in vsa njuna vojska.
1.en: The heavens and the earth were finished, and all their guardians.

2.sl: Sedmi  dan je Bog dokončal delo, ki ga je naredil, in počival je sedmi dan od vsega dela, ki ga je storil.
2.en: On the seventh day God finished his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

3.sl: In Bog je blagoslovil sedmi dan in ga posvetil, kajti ta dan je počival od vsega svojega dela, ki ga je storil, ko je ustvarjal.
3.en: God blessed the seventh day, and made it holy, because he rested in it from all his work which he had created and made.

4.sl:
To je nastanek  neba in zemlje, ko sta bila ustvarjena.
 Na dan, ko je Gospod Bog naredil zemljo in nebo,
4.en: This is the history of the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made earth and the heavens.

5.sl: še ni bilo nobenega poljskega grmičja na zemlji in trava še ni rastla na polju, kajti Gospod Bog še ni pošiljal dežja na zemljo in ni še bilo človeka, da bi polje obdeloval.
5.en: No plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for Yahweh God had not caused it to rain on the earth. There was not a man to till the ground,

6.sl: Iz zemlje pa se je vzdigovala vlaga  in namakala vso površino polja.
6.en: but a mist went up from the earth, and watered the whole surface of the ground.

7.sl: Gospod Bog je iz zemeljskega prahu  izoblikoval človeka,  v njegove nosnice je dahnil življenjski dih in tako je človek postal živa duša.
7.en: Yahweh God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

8.sl: Gospod Bog je zasadil vrt proti vzhodu v Edenu in je tja postavil človeka, katerega je bil izoblikoval.
8.en: Yahweh God planted a garden eastward, in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.

9.sl: Gospod Bog je dal, da je iz zemlje pognalo vsakovrstno drevje, prijetno za pogled in dobro za jed, tudi drevo življenja v sredi vrta in drevo spoznanja dobrega in hudega.
9.en: Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

10.sl: V Edenu je izvirala reka, da je namakala vrt; od tam pa se je delila v štiri glavne reke.
10.en: A river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from there it was parted, and became four heads.

11.sl: Ena od njih se imenuje Pišón. Ta teče okoli vse dežele Havíla, v kateri je zlato –
11.en: The name of the first is Pishon: this is the one which flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

12.sl: in zlato te dežele je dobro; tam je tudi bdelij in kamen oniks.
12.en: and the gold of that land is good. There is aromatic resin and the onyx stone.

13.sl: Drugi reki je ime Gihon. Ta teče okoli vse dežele Kuš.
13.en: The name of the second river is Gihon: the same river that flows through the whole land of Cush.

14.sl: Tretji reki je ime Tigris. Ta teče vzhodno od Asúrja. Četrta reka pa je Evfrat.
14.en: The name of the third river is Hiddekel: this is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

15.sl: Gospod Bog je vzel človeka in ga postavil v edenski vrt, da bi ga obdeloval in varoval.
15.en: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

16.sl: Gospod Bog je človeku zapovedal in rekel: »Z vseh dreves v vrtu smeš jesti,
16.en: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, “Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat:

17.sl: le z drevesa spoznanja dobrega in hudega nikar ne jej! Kajti na dan, ko bi jedel z njega, boš gotovo umrl.«
17.en: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, you shall not eat of it: for in the day that you eat of it you will surely die.”

18.sl: Gospod Bog je rekel: »Ni dobro za človeka, da je sam; naredil mu bom pomoč, ki mu bo primerna.«
18.en: Yahweh God said, “It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper suitable for him.”

19.sl: Gospod Bog je izoblikoval iz zemlje vse živali na polju in vse ptice pod nebom ter jih pripeljal k človeku, da bi videl, kakšna imena jim bo dal, in da bi vsako živo bitje imelo tisto ime, ki bi mu ga dal človek.
19.en: Out of the ground Yahweh God formed every animal of the field, and every bird of the sky, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called every living creature, that was its name.

20.sl: Tako je človek dal imena vsej živini in vsem pticam na nebu in vsem živalim na polju, za človeka  pa se ni našla pomoč, ki bi bila njemu primerna.
20.en: The man gave names to all cattle, and to the birds of the sky, and to every animal of the field; but for man there was not found a helper suitable for him.

21.sl: Gospod Bog je tedaj storil, da je na človeka leglo trdno spanje in je zaspal. Vzel je eno njegovih reber in tisto mesto napolnil z mesom.
21.en: Yahweh God caused a deep sleep to fall on the man, and he slept; and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in its place.

22.sl: Gospod Bog je iz rebra, ki ga je vzel človeku, naredil  ženo in jo pripeljal k človeku.
22.en: He made the rib, which Yahweh God had taken from the man, into a woman, and brought her to the man.

23.sl:
Tedaj je človek rekel:
 »To je končno kost iz mojih kosti
 in meso iz mojega mesa;
 ta se bo imenovala móžinja, 
 kajti ta je vzeta iz moža.«
23.en: The man said, “This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.”

24.sl: Zaradi tega bo mož zapustil očeta in mater in se pridružil svoji ženi in bosta eno meso.
24.en: Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and will join with his wife, and they will be one flesh.

25.sl: Bila pa sta oba naga, človek in njegova žena, a ju ni bilo sram.
25.en: They were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

1.sl: Kača pa je bila bolj prekanjena kakor vse živali na polju, ki jih je naredil Gospod Bog. Rekla je ženi: »Ali je Bog res rekel, da ne smeta jesti z nobenega drevesa v vrtu?«
1.en: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, “Yes, has God said, ‘You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?’”

2.sl: In žena je rekla kači: »Od sadu drevja v vrtu jeva,
2.en: The woman said to the serpent, “Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat,

3.sl: ›le z drevesa sredi vrta,‹ je rekel Bog, ›ne jejta sadu, tudi dotikajta se ga ne, sicer bosta umrla!‹«
3.en: but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God has said, ‘You shall not eat of it, neither shall you touch it, lest you die.’”

4.sl: Kača pa je rekla ženi: »Nikakor ne bosta umrla!
4.en: The serpent said to the woman, “You won’t surely die,

5.sl: V resnici Bog ve, da bi se vama tisti dan, ko bi jedla z njega, odprle oči in bi postala kakor Bog,  poznala bi dobro in húdo.«
5.en: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”

6.sl: Žena je videla, da je drevo dobro za jed, mikavno za oči in vredno poželenja, ker daje spoznanje. Vzela je torej od njegovega sadu in jedla, dala pa je tudi možu, ki je bil z njo, in je jedel.
6.en: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit of it, and ate; and she gave some to her husband with her, and he ate.

7.sl: Tedaj so se obema odprle oči in spoznala sta, da sta naga. Sešila sta si predpasnika iz smokvinih listov.
7.en: Both of their eyes were opened, and they knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

8.sl: Zaslišala sta glas Gospoda Boga, ki je ob dnevnem vetriču hodil po vrtu. Človek in njegova žena sta se skrila pred Gospodom Bogom sredi drevja v vrtu.
8.en: They heard the voice of Yahweh God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.

9.sl: Gospod Bog je poklical človeka in mu rekel: »Kje si?«
9.en: Yahweh God called to the man, and said to him, “Where are you?”

10.sl: Rekel je: »Slišal sem tvoj glas v vrtu, pa sem se zbal, ker sem nag, in se skril.«
10.en: The man said, “I heard your voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.”

11.sl: Pa je rekel: »Kdo ti je povedal, da si nag? Si mar jedel z drevesa, s katerega sem ti prepovedal jesti?«
11.en: God said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”

12.sl: Človek je rekel: »Žena, ki si mi jo dal, mi je dala z drevesa in sem jedel.«
12.en: The man said, “The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I ate.”

13.sl: Gospod Bog je rekel ženi: »Kaj si to storila?« Žena je odgovorila: »Kača me je zapeljala in sem jedla.«
13.en:
Yahweh God said to the woman, “What is this you have done?”
 The woman said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”

14.sl:
Gospod Bog je rekel kači:
 »Ker si to storila,
 bodi prekleta med vso živino
 in vsemi poljskimi živalmi.
 Po trebuhu se boš plazila
 in prah jedla
 vse dni življenja.
14.en: Yahweh God said to the serpent, “Because you have done this, cursed are you above all cattle, and above every animal of the field. On your belly shall you go, and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.

15.sl:
Sovraštvo bom naredil med teboj in ženo
 ter med tvojim zarodom in njenim zarodom.
 On bo prežal na tvojo glavo,
 ti pa boš prežala na njegovo peto.«
15.en: I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel.”

16.sl:
Ženi pa je rekel:
 »Zares, mnogo boš trpela v svoji nosečnosti
 in v bolečinah boš rojevala otroke.
 Po možu boš hrepenela,
 on pa bo gospodoval nad teboj.«
16.en: To the woman he said, “I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bring forth children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.”

17.sl:
In človeku  je rekel:
 »Ker si poslušal glas svoje žene
 in jedel z drevesa,
 o katerem sem ti zapovedal in rekel: ›Nikar ne jej z njega!‹
 naj bo zaradi tebe prekleta zemlja;
 s trudom boš jedel od nje vse dni svojega življenja.
17.en: To Adam he said, “Because you have listened to your wife’s voice, and have eaten of the tree, of which I commanded you, saying, ‘You shall not eat of it,’ cursed is the ground for your sake. In toil you will eat of it all the days of your life.

18.sl:
Trnje in osat ti bo rodila
 in jedel boš poljsko rastlinje.
18.en: Thorns also and thistles will it bring forth to you; and you will eat the herb of the field.

19.sl:
V potu svojega obraza
 boš jedel kruh,
 dokler se ne povrneš v zemljo,
 kajti iz nje si bil vzet.
 Zares, prah si
 in v prah se povrneš.«
19.en: By the sweat of your face will you eat bread until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken. For you are dust, and to dust you shall return.”

20.sl: Človek je imenoval svojo ženo Eva,  ker je postala mati vseh živih.
20.en: The man called his wife Eve, because she was the mother of all living.

21.sl: Gospod Bog je naredil človeku  in njegovi ženi suknji iz kože in ju oblekel.
21.en: Yahweh God made coats of skins for Adam and for his wife, and clothed them.

22.sl: Tedaj je Gospod Bog rekel: »Glejte, človek je postal kakor eden izmed nas, saj pozna dobro in húdo. Da ne bo zdaj iztegnil roke in vzel še z drevesa življenja ter jedel in živel na veke!«
22.en: Yahweh God said, “Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he put forth his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever...”

23.sl: In Gospod Bog je odpravil človeka iz edenskega vrta obdelovat zemljo, iz katere je bil vzet.
23.en: Therefore Yahweh God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.

24.sl: Izgnal je človeka in postavil vzhodno od edenskega vrta kerube in meč, iz katerega je švigal ogenj,  da bi stražili pot do drevesa življenja.
24.en: So he drove out the man; and he placed Cherubs at the east of the garden of Eden, and the flame of a sword which turned every way, to guard the way to the tree of life.

1.sl: Človek je spoznal svojo ženo Evo. Spočela je in rodila Kajna. Rekla je: »Dobila sem  moža od Gospoda.«
1.en: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, “I have gotten a man with Yahweh’s help.”

2.sl: Nato je rodila njegovega brata Abela. In Abel je pasel drobnico, Kajn pa je obdeloval zemljo.
2.en: Again she gave birth, to Cain’s brother Abel. Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

3.sl: Ko je preteklo nekaj časa, je Kajn daroval Gospodu daritev od sadov zemlje.
3.en: As time passed, it happened that Cain brought an offering to Yahweh from the fruit of the ground.

4.sl: Tudi Abel je daroval od prvencev svoje drobnice in njihove tolšče. Gospod se je ozrl na Abela in njegovo daritev,
4.en: Abel also brought some of the firstborn of his flock and of the fat of it. Yahweh respected Abel and his offering,

5.sl: na Kajna in njegovo daritev pa se ni ozrl. Zato se je Kajn zelo ujezil in obraz mu je upadel.
5.en: but he didn’t respect Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry, and the expression on his face fell.

6.sl: Gospod je rekel Kajnu: »Zakaj se jeziš in zakaj ti je upadel obraz?
6.en: Yahweh said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?

7.sl: Ali ga ne boš vzdignil, če delaš dobro? Če pa ne delaš dobro, greh preži nate pri vratih, njegovo poželenje se obrača proti tebi, a ti mu gospoduj!«
7.en: If you do well, will it not be lifted up? If you don’t do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it.”

8.sl: Tedaj je Kajn rekel svojemu bratu Abelu: »Pojdiva ven!«  Ko pa sta bila na polju, se je Kajn vzdignil proti svojemu bratu Abelu in ga ubil.
8.en: Cain said to Abel, his brother, “Let’s go into the field.” It happened, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel, his brother, and killed him.

9.sl: Gospod je rekel Kajnu: »Kje je tvoj brat Abel?« Odvrnil je: »Ne vem. Sem mar jaz varuh svojega brata?«
9.en:
Yahweh said to Cain, “Where is Abel, your brother?”
 He said, “I don’t know. Am I my brother’s keeper?”

10.sl: In Gospod  je rekel: »Kaj si storil? Glas krvi tvojega brata vpije iz zemlje k meni.
10.en: Yahweh said, “What have you done? The voice of your brother’s blood cries to me from the ground.

11.sl: Bodi torej preklet z zemlje, ki je odprla svoja usta in iz tvojih rok sprejela kri tvojega brata!
11.en: Now you are cursed because of the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.

12.sl: Ko boš obdeloval zemljo, naj ti ne daje več svoje moči, blodil in begal boš po svetu.«
12.en: From now on, when you till the ground, it won’t yield its strength to you. You shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth.”

13.sl: Kajn je rekel Gospodu: »Moja krivda  je prevelika, da bi jo mogel nositi.
13.en: Cain said to Yahweh, “My punishment is greater than I can bear.

14.sl: Glej, danes me izganjaš iz dežele in moral se bom skrivati pred tvojim obličjem. Blodil in begal bom po zemlji. Kdor koli me bo našel, me bo ubil.«
14.en: Behold, you have driven me out this day from the surface of the ground. I will be hidden from your face, and I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth. It will happen that whoever finds me will kill me.”

15.sl: Gospod pa mu je odgovoril: »Ne tako;  kdor koli ubije Kajna, bo sedemkrat maščevan.« In Gospod je dal Kajnu znamenje, da ga nihče, ki bi ga našel, ne bi ubil.
15.en: Yahweh said to him, “Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold.” Yahweh appointed a sign for Cain, lest any finding him should strike him.

16.sl: Kajn je odšel izpred Gospodovega obličja in se naselil v deželi Nod,  vzhodno od Edena.
16.en: Cain went out from Yahweh’s presence, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

17.sl: Kajn je spoznal svojo ženo, spočela je in rodila Henoha. Potem je sezidal mesto in ga imenoval po imenu svojega sina Henoha.
17.en: Cain knew his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Enoch. He built a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

18.sl: Henohu se je rodil Irád, Irád je dobil sina Mehujaéla, Mehujaél je dobil sina Metušaéla in Metušaél je dobil sina Lameha.
18.en: To Enoch was born Irad. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.

19.sl: Lameh si je vzel dve ženi; eni je bilo ime Ada, drugi pa Cila.
19.en: Lamech took two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

20.sl: Ada je rodila Jabála, ki je postal oče prebivalcev šotorov in živinorejcev.
20.en: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have cattle.

21.sl: Njegovemu bratu je bilo ime Jubál in postal je oče vseh godcev na citre in flavto.
21.en: His brother’s name was Jubal, who was the father of all who handle the harp and pipe.

22.sl: Tudi Cila je rodila Tubál Kajina, ki je koval vsakovrstno orodje iz brona in železa. Tubál Kajinova sestra pa je bila Naáma.
22.en: Zillah also gave birth to Tubal Cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron. Tubal Cain’s sister was Naamah.

23.sl:
Lameh je rekel svojima ženama:
 »Ada in Cila, poslušajta moj glas,
 Lamehovi ženi, prisluhnita mojim besedam:
 Moža ubijem, ki me rani,
 in dečka, ki mi prizadene prasko.
23.en:
Lamech said to his wives,
 “Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice,
 You wives of Lamech, listen to my speech,
 For I have slain a man for wounding me,
 A young man for bruising me.

24.sl:
Kajti Kajn bo sedemkrat maščevan,
 Lameh pa sedeminsedemdesetkrat.«
24.en:
If Cain will be avenged seven times,
 Truly Lamech seventy-seven times.”

25.sl: Adam je spet spoznal svojo ženo in rodila je sina, kateremu je dala ime Set. Rekla je namreč: »Bog mi je dal drugega potomca namesto Abela, ki ga je ubil Kajn.«
25.en: Adam knew his wife again. She gave birth to a son, and named him Seth. For, she said, “God has appointed me another child instead of Abel, for Cain killed him.”

26.sl: Tudi Set je dobil sina in mu dal ime Enóš. Takrat so začeli klicati Gospodovo ime.
26.en: There was also born a son to Seth, and he named him Enosh. Then men began to call on Yahweh’s name.

1.sl: To je knjiga Adamovega rodovnika. Na dan, ko je Bog ustvaril človeka, ga je naredil sebi podobnega.
1.en: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God’s likeness.

2.sl: Ustvaril ju je moškega in žensko, ju blagoslovil in ju imenoval človeka, na dan, ko ju je ustvaril.
2.en: He created them male and female, and blessed them, and called their name Adam,  in the day when they were created.

3.sl: Adam je živel sto trideset let in rodil se mu je sin po njegovi podobnosti, kot njegova podoba. Imenoval ga je Set.
3.en: Adam lived one hundred thirty years, and became the father of a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.

4.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Set, je bilo Adamovih dni še osemsto let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
4.en: The days of Adam after he became the father of Seth were eight hundred years, and he became the father of sons and daughters.

5.sl: In vseh Adamovih dni, ki jih je preživel, je bilo devetsto trideset let. Potem je umrl.
5.en: All the days that Adam lived were nine hundred thirty years, then he died.

6.sl: Set je živel sto pet let in rodil se mu je Enóš.
6.en: Seth lived one hundred five years, and became the father of Enosh.

7.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Enóš, je Set živel še osemsto sedem let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
7.en: Seth lived after he became the father of Enosh eight hundred seven years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

8.sl: In vseh Setovih dni je bilo devetsto dvanajst let. Potem je umrl.
8.en: All the days of Seth were nine hundred twelve years, then he died.

9.sl: Enóš je živel devetdeset let in rodil se mu je Kenán.
9.en: Enosh lived ninety years, and became the father of Kenan.

10.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Kenán, je Enóš živel še osemsto petnajst let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
10.en: Enosh lived after he became the father of Kenan, eight hundred fifteen years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

11.sl: In vseh Enóševih dni je bilo devetsto pet let. Potem je umrl.
11.en: All the days of Enosh were nine hundred five years, then he died.

12.sl: Kenán je živel sedemdeset let in rodil se mu je Mahalalél.
12.en: Kenan lived seventy years, and became the father of Mahalalel.

13.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Mahalalél, je Kenán živel še osemsto štirideset let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
13.en: Kenan lived after he became the father of Mahalalel eight hundred forty years, and became the father of sons and daughters

14.sl: In vseh Kenánovih dni je bilo devetsto deset let. Potem je umrl.
14.en: and all the days of Kenan were nine hundred ten years, then he died.

15.sl: Mahalalél je živel petinšestdeset let in rodil se mu je Jered.
15.en: Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Jared.

16.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Jered, je Mahalalél živel še osemsto trideset let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
16.en: Mahalalel lived after he became the father of Jared eight hundred thirty years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

17.sl: In vseh Mahalalélovih dni je bilo osemsto petindevetdeset let. Potem je umrl.
17.en: All the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety-five years, then he died.

18.sl: Jered je živel sto dvainšestdeset let in rodil se mu je Henoh.
18.en: Jared lived one hundred sixty-two years, and became the father of Enoch.

19.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Henoh, je Jered živel še osemsto let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
19.en: Jared lived after he became the father of Enoch eight hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

20.sl: In vseh Jeredovih dni je bilo devetsto dvainšestdeset let. Potem je umrl.
20.en: All the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty-two years, then he died.

21.sl: Henoh je živel petinšestdeset let in rodil se mu je Matuzalem.
21.en: Enoch lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Methuselah.

22.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Matuzalem, je Henoh hodil z Bogom še tristo let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
22.en: Enoch walked with God after he became the father of Methuselah three hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

23.sl: In vseh Henohovih dni je bilo tristo petinšestdeset let.
23.en: all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty-five years.

24.sl: Hodil je z Bogom, potem ga ni bilo več, kajti Bog ga je vzel.
24.en: Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him.

25.sl: Matuzalem je živel sto sedeminosemdeset let in rodil se mu je Lameh.
25.en: Methuselah lived one hundred eighty-seven years, and became the father of Lamech.

26.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Lameh, je Matuzalem živel še sedemsto dvainosemdeset let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
26.en: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

27.sl: In vseh Matuzalemovih dni je bilo devetsto devetinšestdeset let. Potem je umrl.
27.en: All the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty-nine years, then he died.

28.sl: Lameh je živel sto dvainosemdeset let in rodil se mu je sin.
28.en: Lamech lived one hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of a son,

29.sl: Imenoval ga je Noe in rekel: »Ta nas bo tolažil pri našem delu in trudu naših rok z zemljo, ki jo je Gospod preklel.«
29.en: and he named him Noah, saying, “This same will comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, because of the ground which Yahweh has cursed.”

30.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Noe, je Lameh živel še petsto petindevetdeset let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
30.en: Lamech lived after he became the father of Noah five hundred ninety-five years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

31.sl: In vseh Lamehovih dni je bilo sedemsto sedeminsedemdeset let. Potem je umrl.
31.en: All the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy-seven years, then he died.

32.sl: Ko je bil Noe star petsto let, so se Noetu rodili Sem, Ham in Jafet.
32.en: Noah was five hundred years old, and Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

1.sl: Ko so se ljudje začeli množiti po zemlji, so se jim rojevale tudi hčere
1.en: It happened, when men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them,

2.sl: in Božji sinovi  so videli, da so človeške hčere lepe. Jemali so si jih za žene, katere koli so izbrali.
2.en: that God’s sons saw that men’s daughters were beautiful, and they took for themselves wives of all that they chose.

3.sl: Gospod je rekel: »Moj dih ne bo ostal v človeku  za vedno, ker je meso.  Njegovih dni bo sto dvajset let.«
3.en: Yahweh said, “My Spirit will not strive with man forever, because he also is flesh; yet will his days be one hundred twenty years.”

4.sl: Tiste dni in tudi pozneje – ko so hodili Božji sinovi  k človeškim hčeram, ki so jim rodile otroke – so bili na zemlji velikani. To so bili junaki, sloveči možje iz davnine.
4.en: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when God’s sons came to men’s daughters. They bore children to them: the same were the mighty men who were of old, men of renown.

5.sl: Gospod pa je videl, da na zemlji narašča človekova hudobija in da je vse mišljenje in hotenje njegovega srca ves dan le hudobno.
5.en: Yahweh saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

6.sl: Gospodu je bilo žal, da je naredil človeka na zemlji, in bil je žalosten v svojem srcu.
6.en: Yahweh was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart.

7.sl: Rekel je torej Gospod: »Izbrisal bom človeka, ki sem ga ustvaril, s površja zemlje, ljudi in živino, laznino in ptice neba, kajti žal mi je, da sem jih naredil.«
7.en: Yahweh said, “I will destroy man whom I have created from the surface of the ground; man, along with animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky; for I am sorry that I have made them.”

8.sl: Noe pa je našel milost v Gospodovih očeh.
8.en: But Noah found favor in Yahweh’s eyes.

9.sl: To je Noetov rodovnik. Noe je bil pravičen mož, popoln  sredi svojega rodu. Noe je hodil z Bogom.
9.en: This is the history of the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.

10.sl: Noetu so se rodili trije sinovi: Sem, Ham in Jafet.
10.en: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

11.sl: Zemlja pa je bila vedno bolj sprijena pred Bogom in polna nasilja.
11.en: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

12.sl: Bog je pogledal na zemljo in glej, bila je pokvarjena; vse meso  je spridilo svojo pot na zemlji.
12.en: God saw the earth, and saw that it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.

13.sl: Bog je rekel Noetu: »Sklenil sem, da je prišel konec vsega mesa, kajti napolnili so zemljo z nasiljem, zato, glej, jih bom uničil z zemljo vred.«
13.en: God said to Noah, “The end of all flesh has come before me, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

14.sl: »Ti pa si izdelaj ladjo iz cipresovega  lesa. Narêdi jo z več prostori in jo od znotraj in od zunaj premaži z zemeljsko smolo.
14.en: Make an ark of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ark, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.

15.sl: Takole jo narêdi: ladja naj bo dolga tristo komolcev, široka petdeset in visoka trideset komolcev.
15.en: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ark will be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

16.sl: Zgoraj naredi ladji streho,  en komolec nad njo jo postavi, in ob strani napravi vhod v ladjo. Narêdi jo tako, da bo imela spodnji, srednji in zgornji oddelek.
16.en: You shall make a roof in the ark, and to a cubit shall you finish it upward. You shall set the door of the ark in the side of it. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.

17.sl: Glej, zlil bom vode potopa na zemljo, da uničim vse meso pod nebom, v katerem je dih življenja. Vse, kar je na zemlji, bo preminilo.
17.en: I, even, I do bring the flood of waters on this earth, to destroy all flesh having the breath of life from under the sky. Everything that is in the earth will die.

18.sl: S teboj pa sklepam zavezo. Pojdi torej v ladjo ti in s teboj tvoji sinovi, tvoja žena in žene tvojih sinov!
18.en: But I will establish my covenant with you. You shall come into the ark, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives with you.

19.sl: In od vseh živali, od vsega mesa, spravi po dvoje v ladjo, da bodo skupaj s teboj ostale pri življenju! Naj bodo samci in samice!
19.en: Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ark, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.

20.sl: Od ptic po njihovih vrstah, od živine po njenih vrstah in od vse laznine na zemlji po njenih vrstah, od vsake vrste naj po dve živali prideta k tebi, da bodo ostale pri življenju.
20.en: Of the birds after their kind, of the cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort shall come to you, to keep them alive.

21.sl: Ti pa si vzemi vsakršnega živeža, kar boš potreboval za hrano, in ga spravi pri sebi, da se boste mogli hraniti ti in oni.«
21.en: Take with you of all food that is eaten, and gather it to you; and it will be for food for you, and for them.”

22.sl: Noe je to storil; prav tako, kakor mu je Bog zapovedal, tako je storil.
22.en: Thus Noah did. According to all that God commanded him, so he did.

1.sl: Gospod je rekel Noetu: »Pojdi v ladjo ti in vsa tvoja družina, kajti vidim, da si sredi tega rodu pravičen pred menoj.
1.en: Yahweh said to Noah, “Come with all of your household into the ark, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.

2.sl: Od vseh čistih živali vzemi s seboj po sedem parov, samce in samice, od živali pa, ki niso čiste, vzemi po dvoje, samca in samico.
2.en: You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female.

3.sl: Tudi od ptic neba vzemi od vsake vrste po sedem parov, samce in samice, da ohraniš pri življenju zarod po vsej zemlji.
3.en: Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth.

4.sl: Kajti še sedem dni in storil bom, da bo deževalo na zemljo štirideset dni in štirideset noči in iztrebil bom s površja zemlje vsa bitja, ki sem jih naredil.«
4.en: In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. Every living thing that I have made, I will destroy from the surface of the ground.”

5.sl: Noe je storil vse tako, kakor mu je zapovedal Gospod.
5.en: Noah did everything that Yahweh commanded him.

6.sl: Noe je bil star šeststo let, ko so nastopile vode potopa na zemlji.
6.en: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.

7.sl: Noe in z njim njegovi sinovi, njegova žena in žene njegovih sinov so šli v ladjo, da bi se rešili pred vodami potopa.
7.en: Noah went into the ark with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, because of the waters of the flood.

8.sl: Od čistih živali in od živali, ki niso čiste, od ptic in od vsega, kar lazi po zemlji,
8.en: Clean animals, animals that are not clean, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground

9.sl: so prišli po dva in dva k Noetu v ladjo, samci in samice, kakor je Bog zapovedal Noetu.
9.en: went by pairs to Noah into the ark, male and female, as God commanded Noah.

10.sl: Po sedmih dneh so vode potopa prišle na zemljo.
10.en: It happened after the seven days, that the waters of the flood came on the earth.

11.sl: V šeststotem letu Noetovega življenja, na sedemnajsti dan drugega meseca, so začeli bruhati vsi studenci velikih globin in odprle so se nebesne zapornice.
11.en: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day all the fountains of the great deep were burst open, and the sky’s windows were opened.

12.sl: Štirideset dni in štirideset noči je deževalo na zemljo.
12.en: The rain was on the earth forty days and forty nights.

13.sl: Prav ta dan so šli Noe, njegovi sinovi Sem, Ham in Jafet in z njimi Noetova žena ter tri žene njegovih sinov v ladjo.
13.en: In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ark;

14.sl: Ti, vse zveri po njihovih vrstah, vsa živina po njenih vrstah in vsa laznina, ki se plazi po zemlji, po njenih vrstah in vse ptice po njihovih vrstah, vse, kar ima perje in peruti,
14.en: they, and every animal after its kind, all the cattle after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.

15.sl: vse to je prišlo k Noetu v ladjo, po dva in dva od vsega mesa, v katerem je dih življenja.
15.en: They went to Noah into the ark, by pairs of all flesh with the breath of life in them.

16.sl: Prišli in vstopili so torej samci in samice od vsega mesa, kakor mu je Bog zapovedal. Gospod pa je zaprl vrata za njim.
16.en: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; and Yahweh shut him in.

17.sl: In potop je bil na zemlji štirideset dni. Vode so narasle in vzdignile ladjo, tako da je splavala nad zemljo.
17.en: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ark, and it was lifted up above the earth.

18.sl: Vode so se dvignile in zelo narasle na zemlji, ladja pa je plavala na vodi.
18.en: The waters prevailed, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ark floated on the surface of the waters.

19.sl: Vode so čedalje huje naraščale na zemlji in pokrile vse visoke gore, kar jih je pod vsem nebom.
19.en: The waters prevailed exceedingly on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered.

20.sl: Vzdignile so se za petnajst komolcev nad vrhove in pokrile gore.
20.en: The waters prevailed fifteen cubits upward, and the mountains were covered.

21.sl: Tako je preminilo vse meso, ki se je gibalo po zemlji: ptice, živina, zveri in vsa drobna bitja, ki mrgolijo po zemlji, in vsi ljudje.
21.en: All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, cattle, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man.

22.sl: Pomrlo je vse, kar je imelo v nosnicah dih  življenja in je živelo na kopnem.
22.en: All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, of all that was on the dry land, died.

23.sl: Iztrebil je s površja zemlje vse, kar živi: ljudi in živino, laznino in ptice neba; iztrebljeni so bili z zemlje. Ostali so samo Noe in tisti, ki so bili z njim v ladji.
23.en: Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, cattle, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ark.

24.sl: Vode so naraščale na zemlji sto petdeset dni.
24.en: The waters prevailed on the earth one hundred fifty days.

1.sl: Bog pa se je spomnil Noeta, vseh zveri in živine, ki je bila z njim v ladji. Storil je, da je zapihal veter prek zemlje, in vode so začele upadati.
1.en: God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the cattle that were with him in the ark; and God made a wind to pass over the earth. The waters subsided.

2.sl: Zaprli so se studenci globin in nebesne zapornice in ponehal je dež z neba.
2.en: The deep’s fountains and the sky’s windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained.

3.sl: Polagoma so vode odtekale z zemlje, po sto petdesetih dneh so začele upadati.
3.en: The waters receded from off the earth continually. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters decreased.

4.sl: Sedemnajsti dan sedmega meseca je ladja obstala na ararátskih gorah.
4.en: The ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat’s mountains.

5.sl: Vode so še naprej upadale vse do desetega meseca; prvi dan desetega meseca so se prikazali vrhovi gora.
5.en: The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were seen.

6.sl: Preteklo je še štirideset dni in Noe je odprl lino, ki jo je naredil na ladji,
6.en: It happened at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made,

7.sl: in izpustil krokarja. Ta je odletel, a se je vračal in spet vzletaval, dokler vode na zemlji niso usahnile.
7.en: and he sent forth a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.

8.sl: Nato je Noe spustil golobico, da bi ugotovil, ali so vode odtekle s površja zemlje.
8.en: He sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the surface of the ground,

9.sl: Toda golobica ni našla počivališča, kamor bi stopila, in vrnila se je k njemu v ladjo, kajti voda je še vedno prekrivala zemljo. Iztegnil je roko, jo prijel in spravil k sebi v ladjo.
9.en: but the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned to him into the ark; for the waters were on the surface of the whole earth. He put forth his hand, and took her, and brought her to him into the ark.

10.sl: Počakal je še sedem dni in nato je spet poslal golobico iz ladje.
10.en: He stayed yet another seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark.

11.sl: Proti večeru se je golobica vrnila in glej, v kljunu je imela zeleno oljčno vejico. Zdaj je Noe vedel, da so vode na zemlji upadle.
11.en: The dove came back to him at evening, and, behold, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.

12.sl: Počakal je še sedem dni. Spet je spustil golobico, a se ni več vrnila.
12.en: He stayed yet another seven days, and sent forth the dove; and she didn’t return to him any more.

13.sl: Prvi dan prvega meseca v šeststoprvem letu so vode izginile z zemlje. Noe je odkril streho na ladji, pogledal in glej, površina zemlje se je začela sušiti.
13.en: It happened in the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dried.

14.sl: Sedemnajsti dan drugega meseca je bila zemlja suha.
14.en: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.

15.sl: Bog je spregovoril Noetu in rekel:
15.en: God spoke to Noah, saying,

16.sl: »Pojdi iz ladje ti in tvoja žena, tvoji sinovi in žene tvojih sinov!
16.en: “Go forth from the ark, you, and your wife, and your sons, and your sons’ wives with you.

17.sl: S teboj naj odidejo vse živali, ki so pri tebi, od vsega mesa: ptice, živina in vsa laznina, ki se plazi po zemlji. Razkropijo naj se po zemlji, naj se plodijo in množijo na njej!«
17.en: Bring forth with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh, including birds, cattle, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply on the earth.”

18.sl: Noe je torej stopil ven, prav tako njegovi sinovi, njegova žena in žene njegovih sinov.
18.en: Noah went forth, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives with him.

19.sl: Vse živali, vsa laznina in vse ptice, vse, kar se giblje na zemlji, je šlo iz ladje po svojih rodovih.
19.en: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went forth out of the ark.

20.sl: Noe je postavil Gospodu oltar in vzel od vse čiste živine in od vseh čistih ptic ter daroval žgalne daritve na oltarju.
20.en: Noah built an altar to Yahweh, and took of every clean animal, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

21.sl: Gospod je zaduhal prijetni vonj in Gospod je rekel v svojem srcu: »Ne bom več preklel zemlje zaradi človeka, kajti mišljenje človekovega srca je hudobno od njegove mladosti. Ne bom več udaril vsega živega, kakor sem storil.
21.en: Yahweh smelled the sweet savor. Yahweh said in his heart, “I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake, because the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth; neither will I ever again strike everything living, as I have done.

22.sl:
Dokler bo trajala zemlja –
 ne setev ne žetev, ne mraz ne vročina,
 ne poletje ne zima, ne dan ne noč
 ne bodo prenehali.«
22.en: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.”

1.sl: Bog je blagoslovil Noeta in njegove sinove in jim rekel: »Bodite rodovitni in se množite ter napolnite zemljo!
1.en: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

2.sl: Vse živali zemlje in vse ptice neba naj se vas bojijo in trepetajo pred vami. Tudi vse, kar se giblje po zemlji, in vse ribe morja, vse to bodi v vaši oblasti.
2.en: The fear of you and the dread of you will be on every animal of the earth, and on every bird of the sky. Everything that the ground teems with, and all the fish of the sea are delivered into your hand.

3.sl: Vse, kar se giblje in živi, naj vam bo za živež, tudi vse zelene rastline vam dajem.
3.en: Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As the green herb, I have given everything to you.

4.sl: Le mesa skupaj z življenjem,  to je s krvjo, ne smete jesti.
4.en: But flesh with the life of it, the blood of it, you shall not eat.

5.sl: Tudi za vašo kri, ki je vaše življenje, bom terjal račun od vsake živali. Terjal ga bom tudi od človeka; od vsakogar bom terjal račun o življenju njegovega brata.
5.en: I will surely require your blood of your lives. At the hand of every animal I will require it. At the hand of man, even at the hand of every man’s brother, I will require the life of man.

6.sl:
Če kdo prelije človeško kri,
 bo človek prelil njegovo kri.
 Zakaj po svoji podobi
 je Bog naredil človeka.
6.en: Whoever sheds man’s blood, by man will his blood be shed, for in the image of God made he man.

7.sl: Vi pa bodite rodovitni in se množite, bodite številni na zemlji in namnožite se na njej!«
7.en: Be fruitful, and multiply. Bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it.”

8.sl: Potem je Bog rekel Noetu in njegovim sinovom:
8.en: God spoke to Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,

9.sl: »Glejte, zavezo sklepam z vami in vašim potomstvom, ki pride za vami,
9.en: “As for me, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your offspring after you,

10.sl: pa tudi z vsemi živimi bitji, ki so pri vas: s pticami, z živino in z vsemi zvermi zemlje, ki so pri vas, z vsemi, ki so prišle iz ladje.
10.en: and with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the cattle, and every animal of the earth with you. Of all that go out of the ark, even every animal of the earth.

11.sl: Tako sklepam zavezo z vami in ne bom več iztrebil vsega mesa z vodami potopa. Ne bo več potopa, ki bi opustošil zemljo.«
11.en: I will establish my covenant with you; neither will all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of the flood; neither will there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.”

12.sl: Bog je rekel: »To je znamenje zaveze, ki jo sklepam med seboj in vami in med vsemi živimi bitji, ki so pri vas, za vse prihodnje rodove.
12.en: God said, “This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:

13.sl: Svojo mavrico postavljam v oblake in bo v znamenje zaveze med menoj in zemljo.
13.en: I set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be for a sign of a covenant between me and the earth.

14.sl: In kadar bom zbral oblake nad zemljo in se bo v oblakih prikazala mavrica,
14.en: It will happen, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud,

15.sl: tedaj se bom spomnil svoje zaveze, ki je med menoj in vami in vsemi živimi bitji in vsem mesom; vode ne bodo nikoli več narasle v potop, da bi iztrebile vse meso.
15.en: and I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

16.sl: Kadar bo v oblakih, jo bom pogledal in se spomnil večne zaveze med Bogom in vsemi živimi bitji in vsem mesom, ki je na zemlji.«
16.en: The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth.”

17.sl: Bog je rekel Noetu: »To je znamenje zaveze, ki sem jo sklenil med seboj in vsem mesom, ki je na zemlji.«
17.en: God said to Noah, “This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth.”

18.sl: Noetovi sinovi, ki so odšli iz ladje, so bili Sem, Ham in Jafet. Ham je Kánaanov oče.
18.en: The sons of Noah who went forth from the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the father of Canaan.

19.sl: Trije so bili Noetovi sinovi in ti so obljudili vso zemljo.
19.en: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these, the whole earth was populated.

20.sl: Tedaj je Noe, mož zemlje, začel saditi vinograd.
20.en: Noah began to be a farmer, and planted a vineyard.

21.sl: Ko pa je pil vino, se je napil in nag obležal sredi svojega šotora.
21.en: He drank of the wine, and got drunk. He was uncovered within his tent.

22.sl: Ham, Kánaanov oče, je videl nagoto svojega očeta in je šel to pravit obema bratoma, ki sta bila zunaj.
22.en: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside.

23.sl: Sem in Jafet pa sta vzela plašč, si ga dala na ramena, šla zadenjsko in pokrila nagoto svojega očeta. Obrnjena sta bila torej proč, tako da nista videla njegove nagote.
23.en: Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it on both their shoulders, went in backwards, and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were backwards, and they didn’t see their father’s nakedness.

24.sl: Ko se je Noe prebudil iz vinske omame in izvedel, kaj mu je storil njegov mlajši sin,
24.en: Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done to him.

27.sl:
Naj Bog razširi Jafetov  prostor,
 naj ga naseli v Semovih šotorih
 in Kánaan mu bodi za hlapca!«

28.sl: Noe je po potopu živel še tristo petdeset let.
28.en: Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood.

29.sl: Vseh Noetovih dni je bilo torej devetsto petdeset let. Potem je umrl.
29.en: All the days of Noah were nine hundred fifty years, then he died.

1.sl: To je rodovnik Noetovih sinov: Sema, Hama in Jafeta. Tem so se po potopu rodili sinovi.
1.en: Now this is the history of the generations of the sons of Noah and of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.

2.sl: Jafetovi sinovi so Gomer, Magóg, Madáj, Javán, Tubál, Mešeh in Tirás.
2.en: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

3.sl: Gomerjevi sinovi pa so Aškenáz, Rifát in Togarmá.
3.en: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

4.sl: Javánovi sinovi so Elišá, Taršíš, Kitéjci in Rodošáni.
4.en: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

5.sl: Njihovi potomci so se razdelili kot narodi po otokih in deželah, vsak s svojim jezikom, po svojih rodbinah in narodih.
5.en: Of these were the islands of the nations divided in their lands, everyone after his language, after their families, in their nations.

6.sl: Hamovi sinovi so Kuš, Micrájim,  Put in Kánaan.
6.en: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

7.sl: Kuševi sinovi so Sebá, Havilá, Sabtá, Ramá in Sabtehá. Ramájeva sinova sta Šebá in Dedán.
7.en: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

8.sl: Kušu se je rodil Nimród,  ta je prvi postal junak  na zemlji.
8.en: Cush became the father of Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

9.sl: Bil je velik lovec pred Gospodom; zato pravijo: Velik lovec pred Gospodom kakor Nimród.
9.en: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh.”

10.sl: Prvenci njegovega kraljestva so bili Babilon, Ereh, Akád in Kalne v šinárski deželi.
10.en: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

11.sl: Iz te dežele je odšel v Asirijo. Pozidal je Ninive, Rehobót Ir, Kelah
11.en: Out of that land he went forth into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,

12.sl: in Resen med Ninivami in Kelahom; to je veliko mesto.
12.en: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the same is the great city).

13.sl: Micrájimu  so se rodili Ludéjci, Anaméjci, Lehabéjci, Naftuhéjci,
13.en: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

14.sl: Patroséjci, Kasluhéjci, od katerih so izšli Filistejci, in Kaftoréjci.
14.en: Pathrusim, Casluhim (which the Philistines descended from), and Caphtorim.

15.sl: Kánaanu so se rodili Sidón, njegov prvorojenec, Het,
15.en: Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,

16.sl: Jebusejec, Amoréjec, Girgašéjec,
16.en: the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,

17.sl: Hivéjec, Arkéjec, Sinéjec,
17.en: the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,

18.sl: Arvadéjec, Cemaréjec in Hamatéjec. Potem so se kánaanski rodovi razkropili.
18.en: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad.

19.sl: Kánaanovo ozemlje je segalo od Sidóna proti Gerárju in do Gaze, proti Sódomi, Gomóri, Adámi, Cebojímu do Leše.
19.en: The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as you go toward Gerar, to Gaza; as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, to Lasha.

20.sl: To so Hamovi sinovi po svojih rodovih, jezikih, deželah in narodih.
20.en: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, in their nations.

21.sl: Semu, Jafetovemu starejšemu bratu, se je rodil tudi oče vseh Eberjevih sinov.
21.en: To Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, to him also were children born.

22.sl: Semovi sinovi so Elám, Asúr, Arpahšád, Lud in Arám.
22.en: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.

23.sl: Arámovi sinovi pa so Uc, Hul, Geter in Maš.
23.en: The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

24.sl: Arpahšádu se je rodil Šelah, Šelahu se je rodil Eber.
24.en: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah. Shelah became the father of Eber.

25.sl: Eberju sta se rodila dva sina; enemu je bilo ime Peleg,  ker se je v njegovih dneh razdelila zemlja, njegovemu bratu pa je bilo ime Joktán.
25.en: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days was the earth divided. His brother’s name was Joktan.

26.sl: Joktánu so se rodili Almodád, Šelef, Hacarmávet, Jerah,
26.en: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

27.sl: Hadorám, Uzál, Diklá,
27.en: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

28.sl: Obál, Abimaél, Šebá,
28.en: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

29.sl: Ofír, Havilá in Jobáb. Vsi ti so Joktánovi sinovi.
29.en: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

30.sl: Njihovo ozemlje je segalo od Meše proti Sefárju do vzhodnega gorovja.
30.en: Their dwelling was from Mesha, as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.

31.sl: To so Semovi sinovi po svojih rodovih, jezikih, deželah in narodih.
31.en: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, after their nations.

32.sl: To so rodovi Noetovih sinov po njihovih rodbinah in narodih. In iz njih so se po potopu razdelili narodi po zemlji.
32.en: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations. Of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.

1.sl: Vsa zemlja je imela en sam jezik in isto govorico.
1.en: The whole earth was of one language and of one speech.

2.sl: Ko so se ljudje odpravili od vzhoda,  so našli ravnino v šinárski deželi in se tam naselili.
2.en: It happened, as they traveled east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they lived there.

3.sl: Rekli so drug drugemu: »Dajmo, delajmo opeko in jo žgimo v ognju!« Opeko so uporabljali namesto kamna in zemeljsko smolo namesto malte.
3.en: They said one to another, “Come, let’s make brick, and burn them thoroughly.” They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar.

4.sl: Rekli so: »Dajmo, sezidajmo si mesto in stolp, katerega vrh naj sega do neba, in naredimo si ime, da se ne bomo razkropili po vsej zemlji!«
4.en: They said, “Come, let’s build us a city, and a tower, whose top reaches to the sky, and let’s make us a name; lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth.”

5.sl: Gospod je stopil dol, da bi si ogledal mesto in stolp, ki so ga postavili človeški otroci.
5.en: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.

6.sl: In Gospod je rekel: »Glej, eno ljudstvo so in vsi imajo en jezik, in to je šele začetek njihovega dela. Zdaj jih ne bo nič več zadržalo; kar koli bodo hoteli, bodo naredili.
6.en: Yahweh said, “Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language; and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do.

7.sl: Dajmo, stopimo dol in tam zmešajmo njihov jezik, da ne bodo več razumeli govorice drug drugega!«
7.en: Come, let’s go down, and there confuse their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.”

8.sl: In Gospod jih je razkropil od tam po vsej zemlji in nehali so zidati mesto.
8.en: So Yahweh scattered them abroad from there on the surface of all the earth. They stopped building the city.

9.sl: Zato se je imenovalo Babél, ker je tam Gospod zmešal  jezik vse zemlje in od tam jih je Gospod razkropil po vsej zemlji.
9.en: Therefore the name of it was called Babel, because Yahweh confused the language of all the earth, there. From there, Yahweh scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.

10.sl: To je Semov rodovnik. Sem je bil star sto let, ko se mu je rodil Arpahšád, dve leti po potopu.
10.en: This is the history of the generations of Shem. Shem was one hundred years old, and became the father of Arpachshad two years after the flood.

11.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Arpahšád, je Sem živel še petsto let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
11.en: Shem lived after he became the father of Arpachshad five hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

12.sl: Ko je bil Arpahšád star petintrideset let, se mu je rodil Šelah.
12.en: Arpachshad lived thirty-five years, and became the father of Shelah.

13.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Šelah, je Arpahšád živel še štiristo tri leta in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
13.en: Arpachshad lived after he became the father of Shelah four hundred three years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

14.sl: Ko je bil Šelah star trideset let, se mu je rodil Eber.
14.en: Shelah lived thirty years, and became the father of Eber:

15.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Eber, je Šelah živel še štiristo tri leta in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
15.en: and Shelah lived after he became the father of Eber four hundred three years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

16.sl: Ko je bil Eber star štiriintrideset let, se mu je rodil Peleg.
16.en: Eber lived thirty-four years, and became the father of Peleg.

17.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Peleg, je Eber živel še štiristo trideset let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
17.en: Eber lived after he became the father of Peleg four hundred thirty years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

18.sl: Ko je bil Peleg star trideset let, se mu je rodil Regu.
18.en: Peleg lived thirty years, and became the father of Reu.

19.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Regu, je Peleg živel še dvesto devet let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
19.en: Peleg lived after he became the father of Reu two hundred nine years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

20.sl: Ko je bil Regu star dvaintrideset let, se mu je rodil Serúg.
20.en: Reu lived thirty-two years, and became the father of Serug.

21.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Serúg, je Regu živel še dvesto sedem let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
21.en: Reu lived after he became the father of Serug two hundred seven years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

22.sl: Ko je bil Serúg star trideset let, se mu je rodil Nahór.
22.en: Serug lived thirty years, and became the father of Nahor.

23.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Nahór, je Serúg živel še dvesto let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
23.en: Serug lived after he became the father of Nahor two hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

24.sl: Ko je bil Nahór star devetindvajset let, se mu je rodil Terah.
24.en: Nahor lived twenty-nine years, and became the father of Terah.

25.sl: Potem ko se mu je rodil Terah, je Nahór živel še sto devetnajst let in rodili so se mu sinovi in hčere.
25.en: Nahor lived after he became the father of Terah one hundred nineteen years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

26.sl: Terah je bil star sedemdeset let, ko so se mu rodili Abram, Nahór in Harán.
26.en: Terah lived seventy years, and became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

27.sl: To je Terahov rodovnik. Terahu so se rodili Abram, Nahór in Harán, Haránu pa se je rodil Lot.
27.en: Now this is the history of the generations of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran became the father of Lot.

28.sl: Harán je umrl pred svojim očetom Terahom v svoji rojstni deželi, v Uru Kaldejcev.
28.en: Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldees.

29.sl: Abram in Nahór sta se oženila. Abramovi ženi je bilo ime Sarája, Nahórjevi pa Milka. Bila je hči Harána, Milkinega in Jiskinega očeta.
29.en: Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran who was also the father of Iscah.

30.sl: Sarája pa je bila nerodovitna, ni imela otrok.
30.en: Sarai was barren. She had no child.

31.sl: Terah je vzel sina Abrama in vnuka Lota, Haránovega sina, ter svojo snaho Sarájo, ženo svojega sina Abrama, in odšel z njimi iz Ura Kaldejcev, da bi šel v deželo Kánaan. Prišli so do Harána in se tam naselili.
31.en: Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of Haran, his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife. They went forth from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan. They came to Haran, and lived there.

32.sl: Vseh Terahovih dni je bilo dvesto pet let. Potem je Terah umrl v Haránu.
32.en: The days of Terah were two hundred five years. Terah died in Haran.

1.sl: Gospod je rekel Abramu: »Pojdi iz svoje dežele, iz svoje rodbine in iz hiše svojega očeta v deželo, ki ti jo bom pokazal.
1.en: Now Yahweh said to Abram, “Get out of your country, and from your relatives, and from your father’s house, to the land that I will show you.

2.sl: Iz tebe bom naredil velik narod, blagoslovil te bom in naredil tvoje ime veliko, da bo v blagoslov.
2.en: I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you, and make your name great. You will be a blessing.

3.sl: Blagoslovil bom tiste, ki te bodo blagoslavljali, in preklel tiste, ki te bodo preklinjali, in v tebi bodo blagoslovljeni  vsi rodovi zemlje.«
3.en: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who curses you. In you will all of the families of the earth be blessed.”

4.sl: Abram je šel, kakor mu je naročil Gospod, in Lot je šel z njim. Ko je Abram odšel iz Harána, je bil star petinsedemdeset let.
4.en: So Abram went, as Yahweh had spoken to him. Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed out of Haran.

5.sl:
S seboj je vzel ženo Sarájo, bratovega sina Lota in vse premoženje, ki sta ga zbrala, in vse duše,  ki sta jih pridobila v Haránu. Odšli so in se napotili proti kánaanski deželi.
 Ko so prišli v kánaansko deželo,
5.en: Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother’s son, all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls who they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan. Into the land of Canaan they came.

6.sl: je Abram prehodil deželo do kraja Sihem, do Moréjevega hrasta – Kánaanci so takrat živeli v deželi.
6.en: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. The Canaanite was then in the land.

7.sl: Gospod se mu je prikazal in rekel: »Tvojemu potomstvu bom dal to deželo.« Tam je postavil oltar Gospodu, ki se mu je bil prikazal.
7.en:
Yahweh appeared to Abram, and said, “I will give this land to your seed .”
 He built an altar there to Yahweh, who appeared to him.

8.sl: Od tam je šel naprej na vzhodno gorovje do Betela in se ušotoril tako, da je imel Betel na zahodni, Aj pa na vzhodni strani. Tam je postavil Gospodu oltar in klical Gospodovo ime.
8.en: He left from there to the mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh, and called on the name of Yahweh.

9.sl: Potem se je spet odpravil na pot in tako potoval proti Negebu.
9.en: Abram traveled, going on still toward the South.

10.sl: Tedaj je v deželi nastala lakota in Abram je šel v Egipt, da bi tam nekaj časa ostal; kajti lakota v deželi je bila huda.
10.en: There was a famine in the land. Abram went down into Egypt to live as a foreigner there, for the famine was sore in the land.

11.sl: Ko pa se je približal Egiptu, je rekel ženi Saráji: »Glej, vem, da si lepa ženska.
11.en: It happened, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said to Sarai his wife, “See now, I know that you are a beautiful woman to look on.

12.sl: Ko te bodo Egipčani videli in rekli: ›To je njegova žena,‹ bodo mene ubili, tebe pa pustili pri življenju.
12.en: It will happen, when the Egyptians will see you, that they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ They will kill me, but they will save you alive.

13.sl: Reci, prosim, da si moja sestra, da se mi bo dobro godilo zaradi tebe in bom po tvoji zaslugi ostal živ.«
13.en: Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you.”

14.sl: Ko je torej Abram prispel v Egipt, so Egipčani videli, da je žena zelo lepa.
14.en: It happened that when Abram had come into Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.

15.sl: Videli so jo tudi faraonovi uradniki in jo hvalili faraonu. Tako so ženo vzeli v faraonovo hišo.
15.en: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.

16.sl: Zaradi nje je lepo ravnal z Abramom: dobil je drobnico in govedo, osle, hlapce in dekle, oslice in kamele.
16.en: He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, and oxen, and male donkeys, and men-servants, and maid-servants, and female donkeys, and camels.

17.sl: Gospod pa je udaril faraona in njegovo hišo s hudimi nadlogami zaradi Abramove žene Saráje.
17.en: Yahweh plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram’s wife.

18.sl: Faraon je poklical Abrama in rekel: »Kako si mi mogel to storiti? Zakaj mi nisi povedal, da je to tvoja žena?
18.en: Pharaoh called Abram, and said, “What is this that you have done to me? Why didn’t you tell me that she was your wife?

19.sl: Zakaj si rekel, da je tvoja sestra, da sem si jo vzel za ženo? Glej, tu imaš zdaj svojo ženo, vzemi jo in pojdi!«
19.en: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, see your wife, take her, and go your way.”

20.sl: Faraon je glede njega dal ukaze svojim možem in pospremili so Abrama, njegovo ženo in vse njegovo imetje.
20.en: Pharaoh gave men charge concerning him: and they brought him on the way, and his wife, and all that he had.

1.sl: Abram je torej odšel iz Egipta proti Negebu. Z njim je šla njegova žena, vse, kar je imel, in Lot.
1.en: Abram went up out of Egypt: he, his wife, all that he had, and Lot with him, into the South.

2.sl: Abram je bil silno bogat z živino, s srebrom in z zlatom.
2.en: Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.

3.sl: Potem se je selil s šotori od Negeba do Betela, do kraja, kjer si je prej postavil šotor, med Betelom in Ajem.
3.en: He went on his journeys from the South even to Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,

4.sl: To je kraj, kjer je prej postavil oltar; in tam je klical Gospodovo ime.
4.en: to the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first. There Abram called on the name of Yahweh.

5.sl: Tudi Lot, ki je potoval z Abramom, je imel drobnico, govedo in šotore.
5.en: Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.

6.sl: A dežela ni mogla preživljati obeh, ko sta prebivala skupaj. Kajti njuno premoženje je bilo tako veliko, da nista mogla živeti skupaj.
6.en: The land was not able to bear them, that they might live together: for their substance was great, so that they could not live together.

7.sl: Vnel se je prepir med pastirji Abramovih čred in pastirji Lotovih čred – Kánaanci in Perizéjci so tisti čas prebivali v deželi –
7.en: There was a strife between the herdsmen of Abram’s cattle and the herdsmen of Lot’s cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite lived then in the land.

8.sl: in Abram je rekel Lotu: »Naj ne bo prepira med menoj in teboj, med mojimi in tvojimi pastirji, saj sva brata!
8.en: Abram said to Lot, “Please, let there be no strife between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; for we are relatives.

9.sl: Mar ni vsa dežela pred teboj? Loči se torej od mene! Če pojdeš ti na levo, grem jaz na desno, če se ti obrneš proti desni, bom jaz krenil na levo.«
9.en: Isn’t the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right. Or if you go to the right hand, then I will go to the left.”

10.sl: Lot je povzdignil oči in videl vso jordansko pokrajino. Preden je Gospod pokončal Sódomo in Gomóro, je bila v celoti namakana. Vse do Coara je bila kakor Gospodov vrt, kakor egiptovska dežela.
10.en: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.

11.sl: Lot si je torej izbral vso jordansko pokrajino in se odselil proti vzhodu. Tako sta se ločila.
11.en: So Lot chose the Plain of the Jordan for himself. Lot traveled east, and they separated themselves the one from the other.

12.sl: Abram je prebival v kánaanski deželi, Lot pa je živel v mestih pokrajine in šotoril tja do Sódome.
12.en: Abram lived in the land of Canaan, and Lot lived in the cities of the plain, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.

13.sl: Sódomci pa so bili hudobni in so silno grešili zoper Gospoda.
13.en: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinners against Yahweh.

14.sl: Gospod je govoril Abramu, potem ko se je Lot ločil od njega: »Povzdigni oči in poglej s svojega mesta proti severu in jugu, proti vzhodu in zahodu!
14.en: Yahweh said to Abram, after Lot was separated from him, “Now, lift up your eyes, and look from the place where you are, northward and southward and eastward and westward,

15.sl: Zares, vso deželo, ki jo vidiš, za vedno dajem tebi in tvojemu potomstvu.
15.en: for all the land which you see, I will give to you, and to your offspring forever.

16.sl: In storil bom, da bo tvojega zaroda kakor prahu zemlje. Če bi kdo mogel prešteti prah zemlje, bi lahko preštel tudi tvoj zarod.
16.en: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then your seed may also be numbered.

17.sl: Vstani in prehodi deželo po vsej njeni dolžini in širini, kajti tebi jo dajem.«
17.en: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it to you.”

18.sl: Abram je šotoril ter prišel in se naselil pri Mamrejevih hrastih, ki so pri Hebrónu. Tam je postavil oltar Gospodu.
18.en: Abram moved his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built an altar there to Yahweh.

1.sl: Za časa šinárskega kralja Amraféla so se elasárski kralj Arjóh, elámski kralj Kedorlaómer in gojímski kralj Tidál
1.en: It happened in the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim,

2.sl: vojskovali zoper sódomskega kralja Bera, gomórskega kralja Biršája, admaškega kralja Šinába, cebojímskega kralja Šeméberja in kralja Bele, to je Coarja.
2.en: that they made war with Bera, king of Sodom, and with Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, and Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar).

3.sl: Vsi ti so zbrali svoje čete v Sidímski dolini, to je Slano morje.
3.en: All these joined together in the valley of Siddim (the same is the Salt Sea).

4.sl: Dvanajst let so služili Kedorlaómerju, trinajsto leto pa so se uprli.
4.en: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year, they rebelled.

5.sl: Štirinajsto leto so prišli Kedorlaómer in kralji, ki so bili z njim. Premagali so Rafájevce pri Ašterót Karnájimu, Zuzéjce pri Hamu, Emejce v Kirjatájimski dolini
5.en: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer came, and the kings who were with him, and struck the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim,

6.sl: in Horéjce na njihovem pogorju Seír ter prišli do El Parána na robu puščave.
6.en: and the Horites in their Mount Seir, to Elparan, which is by the wilderness.

7.sl: Ko so se vračali, so prišli do En Mišpáta, to je Kadeša, in pokončali vse amalečanske kraje in tudi Amoréjce, ki so bivali v Hacecón Tamáru.
7.en: They returned, and came to En-mishpat (the same is Kadesh), and struck all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that lived in Hazazon Tamar.

8.sl: Tedaj so se sódomski, gomórski, admaški, cebojímski in belaški – to je coarski – kralj odpravili na pot in se v Sidímski dolini spustili v spopad
8.en: There went out the king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar); and they set the battle in array against them in the valley of Siddim;

9.sl: z elámskim kraljem Kedorlaómerjem, gojímskim kraljem Tidálom, šinárskim kraljem Amrafélom in elasárskim kraljem Arjóhom: štirje kralji proti petim.
9.en: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings against the five.
