10.sl: V Sidímski dolini pa je bilo vse polno smolnih jam. Na begu sta sódomski in gomórski kralj padla v eno od njih, drugi pa so zbežali v gore.
10.en: Now the valley of Siddim was full of tar pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and they fell there, and those who remained fled to the mountain.

11.sl: Oni pa so pobrali vse imetje Sódome in Gomóre, ves njihov živež, in odšli.
11.en: They took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their food, and went their way.

12.sl: Vzeli so tudi Lota, sina Abramovega brata, in njegovo imetje ter odšli. Prebival je namreč v Sódomi.
12.en: They took Lot, Abram’s brother’s son, who lived in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.

13.sl: Neki ubežnik je prišel do Hebrejca Abrama in mu to povedal. Ta se je naselil pri hrastih Amoréjca Mamreja, Eškólovega in Anêrjevega brata, ki so bili Abramovi zavezniki.
13.en: One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. Now he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and these were allies of Abram.

14.sl: Ko je torej Abram slišal, da je njegov brat ujet, je sklical svoje izurjene može, rojene v njegovi hiši, tristo osemnajst ljudi, in jih zasledoval do Dana.
14.en: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led forth his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.

15.sl: Ponoči je razdelil svoje može in z njimi napadel sovražnike. Premagal jih je in jih zasledoval do Hobe, ki je severno od Damaska.
15.en: He divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and struck them, and pursued them to Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.

16.sl: In spravil je nazaj vse imetje in tudi svojega brata in njegovo premoženje je spravil nazaj, z ženami in drugimi ljudmi vred.
16.en: He brought back all the goods, and also brought back his relative, Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.

17.sl: Potem ko se je vrnil z zmage nad Kedorlaómerjem in kralji, ki so bili z njim, mu je prišel naproti sódomski kralj v dolini Šavé, to je v Kraljevi dolini.
17.en: The king of Sodom went out to meet him, after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, at the valley of Shaveh (the same is the King’s Valley).

18.sl: Salemski kralj Melkízedek pa je prinesel kruha in vina. Bil je duhovnik Najvišjega Boga
18.en: Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was priest of God Most High.

19.sl:
in ga je blagoslovil, rekoč:
 »Blagoslovi naj te, Abram, Bog Najvišji,
 ki je ustvaril nebo in zemljo!
19.en: He blessed him, and said, “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth:

20.sl:
In slavljen bodi Bog Najvišji,
 ki ti je dal v roke tvoje nasprotnike!«
 Potem mu je Abram dal desetino od vsega.
20.en:
and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand.”
 Abram gave him a tenth of all.

21.sl: Sódomski kralj pa je rekel Abramu: »Daj mi duše,  imetje pa obdrži zase!«
21.en: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people, and take the goods to yourself.”

22.sl: Abram mu je odgovoril: »Prisegam Gospodu, Bogu Najvišjemu, ki je ustvaril nebo in zemljo:
22.en: Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,

23.sl: Ne, niti vrvice ali jermena od sandale, prav ničesar od tega, kar je tvoje, ne bom vzel, da ne porečeš: ›Jaz sem storil, da je Abram bogat.‹
23.en: that I will not take a thread nor a shoe-latchet nor anything that is yours, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich.’

24.sl: Samó tisto, kar so pojedli moji ljudje, in delež plena za može, ki so šli z menoj: Anêr, Eškól in Mamre. Naj vzamejo svoje deleže.«
24.en: Except only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men who went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre: let them take their portion.”

1.sl: Po teh dogodkih se je Abramu v videnju zgodila Gospodova beseda, rekoč: »Ne boj se, Abram! Jaz sem tvoj ščit, tvoje plačilo bo zelo veliko.«
1.en: After these things the word of Yahweh came to Abram in a vision, saying, “Don’t be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward.”

2.sl: Abram pa je rekel: »Gospod Bog, kaj mi boš vendar dal, ko pa ostajam brez otrok in bo dedič moje hiše Damaščan Eliézer?«
2.en: Abram said, “Lord Yahweh, what will you give me, seeing I go childless, and he who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?”

3.sl: In Abram je rekel: »Glej, nisi mi naklonil potomstva, zato, glej, bo moj dedič hlapec moje hiše.«
3.en: Abram said, “Behold, to me you have given no seed: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir.”

4.sl: A glej, zgodila se mu je Gospodova beseda, rekoč: »Ne bo ta dedoval za teboj, temveč tisti, ki bo prišel iz tebe, bo tvoj dedič.«
4.en: Behold, the word of Yahweh came to him, saying, “This man will not be your heir, but he who will come forth out of your own body will be your heir.”

5.sl: Popeljal ga je ven in mu rekel: »Poglej proti nebu in preštej zvezde, če jih moreš prešteti!« Potem mu je rekel: »Tako bo s tvojim potomstvom.«
5.en: Yahweh brought him outside, and said, “Look now toward the sky, and count the stars, if you are able to count them.” He said to Abram, “So shall your seed be.”

6.sl: Veroval je Gospodu in ta mu je to štel v pravičnost.
6.en: He believed in Yahweh; and he reckoned it to him for righteousness.

7.sl: Rekel mu je: »Jaz sem Gospod, ki sem te izpeljal iz Ura Kaldejcev, da bi ti dal to deželo v posest.«
7.en: He said to him, “I am Yahweh who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give you this land to inherit it.”

8.sl: Rekel je: »Gospod Bog, po čem bom spoznal, da jo dobim v posest?«
8.en: He said, “Lord Yahweh, how will I know that I will inherit it?”

9.sl: Pa mu je rekel: »Vzemi zame triletno telico, triletno kozo, triletnega kozla, grlico in mladega goloba!«
9.en: He said to him, “Take me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtle-dove, and a young pigeon.”

10.sl: Vzel je torej zanj vse te živali, jih razpolovil in položil vsako polovico nasproti drugi, le ptic ni razpolovil.
10.en: He took him all these, and divided them in the middle, and laid each half opposite the other; but he didn’t divide the birds.

11.sl: Ptice roparice so se spuščale na trupla, Abram pa jih je odganjal.
11.en: The birds of prey came down on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.

12.sl: Ko se je sonce nagibalo k zatonu, je Abrama obšel trden spanec in glej, polastila se ga je groza in gost mrak je padel nanj.
12.en: When the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram. Now terror and great darkness fell on him.

13.sl: Rekel je Abramu: »Vedi, da bodo tvoji potomci priseljenci v deželi, ki ne bo njihova, spravili jih bodo v sužnost in jih stiskali štiristo let.
13.en: He said to Abram, “Know for sure that your seed will live as foreigners in a land that is not theirs, and will serve them. They will afflict them four hundred years.

14.sl: A tudi narodu, ki jih bo imel zasužnjene, bom sodil. Potem bodo odšli z velikim imetjem.
14.en: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great substance.

15.sl: Ti pa pojdeš v miru k svojim očetom; pokopan boš v visoki starosti.
15.en: But you will go to your fathers in peace. You will be buried in a good old age.

16.sl: V četrtem rodu se bodo vrnili sem, kajti hudobija Amoréjcev še ni dopolnjena.«
16.en: In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full.”

17.sl: Sonce je zašlo in legel je mrak. In glej, lonec za ogenj, iz katerega se je kadilo, in plameneča bakla sta se premikala med kosi živali.
17.en: It came to pass that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace, and a flaming torch passed between these pieces.

18.sl: Tisti dan je Gospod sklenil z Abramom zavezo in rekel: »Tvojemu potomstvu dajem to deželo od Egiptovske reke do vélike reke, reke Evfrata;
18.en: In that day Yahweh made a covenant with Abram, saying, “To your seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:

19.sl: Kenéjce, Kenázovce, Kadmonéjce,
19.en: the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

20.sl: Hetejce, Perizéjce, Rafájevce,
20.en: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,

21.sl: Amoréjce, Kánaance, Girgašéjce in Jebusejce.«
21.en: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”

1.sl: Žena Sarája Abramu ni rodila otrok; imela pa je egiptovsko deklo, ki ji je bilo ime Hagára.
1.en: Now Sarai, Abram’s wife, bore him no children. She had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.

2.sl: Sarája je rekla Abramu: »Glej, Gospod mi ni dal, da bi rodila. Pojdi k moji dekli! Mogoče bom po njej dobila otroka.« Abram je poslušal Sarájo.
2.en: Sarai said to Abram, “See now, Yahweh has restrained me from bearing. Please go in to my handmaid. It may be that I will obtain children by her.” Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.

3.sl: Potem ko je preteklo deset let, odkar se je Abram naselil v kánaanski deželi, je Abramova žena Sarája vzela svojo egiptovsko deklo Hagáro in jo dala možu Abramu za ženo.
3.en: Sarai, Abram’s wife, took Hagar the Egyptian, her handmaid, after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to Abram her husband to be his wife.

4.sl: Šel je k Hagári in je spočela. Ko pa je videla, da je spočela, je začela zaničevati gospodarico.
4.en: He went in to Hagar, and she conceived. When she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.

5.sl: Sarája je rekla Abramu: »Ti si kriv, da me žali. Dala sem ti svojo deklo v naročje, ko pa je videla, da je spočela, me je začela zaničevati. Naj Gospod sodi med menoj in teboj!«
5.en: Sarai said to Abram, “This wrong is your fault. I gave my handmaid into your bosom, and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes. Yahweh judge between me and you.”

6.sl: Abram je rekel Saráji: »Glej, tvoja dekla je v tvoji roki; naredi z njo, kar se ti zdi prav!« Tedaj je začela Sarája z njo tako trdo ravnati, da je Hagára pobegnila od nje.
6.en: But Abram said to Sarai, “Behold, your maid is in your hand. Do to her whatever is good in your eyes.” Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she fled from her face.

7.sl: Gospodov angel jo je našel pri studencu v puščavi, pri izviru ob poti proti Šuru.
7.en: The angel of Yahweh found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.

8.sl: Rekel je: »Hagára, Sarájina dekla, od kod prihajaš in kam greš?« Rekla je: »Bežim od svoje gospodarice Saráje.«
8.en:
He said, “Hagar, Sarai’s handmaid, where did you come from? Where are you going?”
 She said, “I am fleeing from the face of my mistress Sarai.”

9.sl: Gospodov angel ji je rekel: »Vrni se k svoji gospodarici in se podrêdi njeni roki!«
9.en: The angel of Yahweh said to her, “Return to your mistress, and submit yourself under her hands.”

10.sl: Potem ji je Gospodov angel rekel: »Silno bom namnožil tvoje potomstvo, da ga ne bo mogoče prešteti.«
10.en: The angel of Yahweh said to her, “I will greatly multiply your seed, that they will not be numbered for multitude.”

11.sl:
In Gospodov angel ji je rekel:
 »Glej, spočela si in rodila boš sina;
 daj mu ime Izmael, 
 kajti Gospod te je slišal v tvoji stiski.
11.en: The angel of Yahweh said to her, “Behold, you are with child, and will bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael, because Yahweh has heard your affliction.

12.sl:
Ta človek bo pravi divji osel.
 Njegova roka bo proti vsem
 in roke vseh proti njemu;
 nasproti vsem svojim bratom se bo naselil.«
12.en: He will be like a wild donkey among men. His hand will be against every man, and every man’s hand against him. He will live opposite all of his brothers.”

13.sl: Imenovala je Gospoda, ki je z njo govoril: »Ti si El Roí«;  rekla je namreč: »Ali sem res tukaj videla tistega,  ki me je videl?«
13.en: She called the name of Yahweh who spoke to her, “You are a God who sees,” for she said, “Have I even stayed alive after seeing him?”

14.sl: Zato se vodnjak imenuje Beêr Laháj Roí;  glej, je med Kadešem in Beredom.
14.en: Therefore the well was called Beer Lahai Roi.  Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.

15.sl: Potem je Hagára Abramu rodila sina. Abram je dal sinu, ki ga je rodila Hagára, ime Izmael.
15.en: Hagar bore a son for Abram. Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.

16.sl: Ko je Hagára Abramu rodila Izmaela, je bil Abram star šestinosemdeset let.
16.en: Abram was eighty-six years old, when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.

1.sl: Ko pa je Abram imel devetindevetdeset let, se mu je prikazal Gospod in mu rekel: »Jaz sem Bog Mogočni. Hodi pred menoj in bodi popoln!
1.en: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, Yahweh appeared to Abram, and said to him, “I am God Almighty. Walk before me, and be blameless.

2.sl: Sklenil bom svojo zavezo med seboj in teboj in silno te bom namnožil.«
2.en: I will make my covenant between me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly.”

3.sl: Abram je padel na obraz in Bog je govoril z njim ter rekel:
3.en: Abram fell on his face. God talked with him, saying,

4.sl: »Glej, to je moja zaveza s teboj: postal boš oče množice narodov.
4.en: “As for me, behold, my covenant is with you. You will be the father of a multitude of nations.

5.sl: Ne boš se več imenoval Abram,  temveč Abraham  ti bo ime, kajti postavljam te za očeta množici narodov.
5.en: Neither will your name any more be called Abram, but your name will be Abraham; for the father of a multitude of nations have I made you.

6.sl: Naredil te bom silno rodovitnega, napravil bom iz tebe narode in kralji bodo izšli iz tebe.
6.en: I will make you exceeding fruitful, and I will make nations of you. Kings will come out of you.

7.sl: Postavljam svojo zavezo med seboj in teboj ter tvojimi potomci za teboj iz roda v rod kot večno zavezo. Tebi in tvojim potomcem za teboj bom Bog.
7.en: I will establish my covenant between me and you and your seed after you throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God to you and to your seed after you.

8.sl: Tebi in tvojemu potomstvu dajem deželo, v kateri bivaš kot tujec, vso kánaansko deželo, v večno last in bom njihov Bog.«
8.en: I will give to you, and to your seed after you, the land where you are traveling, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession. I will be their God.”

9.sl: Bog je rekel Abrahamu: »Ti pa se dŕži moje zaveze, ti in tvoji potomci za teboj iz roda v rod!
9.en: God said to Abraham, “As for you, you will keep my covenant, you and your seed after you throughout their generations.

10.sl: To je moja zaveza, ki se je držite, zaveza med menoj in vami ter tvojimi potomci za teboj: vsak moški pri vas naj bo obrezan!
10.en: This is my covenant, which you shall keep, between me and you and your seed after you. Every male among you shall be circumcised.

11.sl: Obrežite si meso svojih prednjih kožic! To bodi znamenje zaveze med menoj in vami!
11.en: You shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin. It will be a token of a covenant between me and you.

12.sl: Osem dni po rojstvu naj bodo obrezani vsi moški iz roda v rod, najsi bodo rojeni v hiši ali pridobljeni za denar od katerega koli tujca, ki ni izmed tvojih potomcev.
12.en: He who is eight days old will be circumcised among you, every male throughout your generations, he who is born in the house, or bought with money of any foreigner who is not of your seed.

13.sl: Oboji morajo biti obrezani, rojeni v tvoji hiši in pridobljeni za tvoj denar. Takó bo moja zaveza v vašem mesu večna zaveza.
13.en: He who is born in your house, and he who is bought with your money, must be circumcised. My covenant will be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.

14.sl: Kar pa zadeva neobrezanega moškega, ki ni obrezan na mesu svoje prednje kožice, naj bo iztrebljen iz svojega ljudstva; prelomil je mojo zavezo.«
14.en: The uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off from his people. He has broken my covenant.”

15.sl: Potem je Bog rekel Abrahamu: »Svoje žene Saráje ne imenuj več Sarája, temveč Sara bodi njeno ime!
15.en: God said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but her name will be Sarah.

16.sl: Blagoslovil jo bom in ti dal sina tudi od nje; blagoslovil jo bom, da bodo iz nje nastali narodi in bodo kralji ljudstev izšli iz nje.«
16.en: I will bless her, and moreover I will give you a son by her. Yes, I will bless her, and she will be a mother of nations. Kings of peoples will come from her.”

17.sl: Abraham je padel na obraz in se zasmejal. Rekel si je: »Ali se bo stoletniku rodil sin? Ali bo devetdesetletna Sara rodila?«
17.en: Then Abraham fell on his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, “Will a child be born to him who is one hundred years old? Will Sarah, who is ninety years old, give birth?”

18.sl: Abraham je rekel Bogu: »O da bi le Izmael živel pred teboj!«
18.en: Abraham said to God, “Oh that Ishmael might live before you!”

19.sl: Bog pa je odgovoril: »Ne, temveč tvoja žena Sara ti bo rodila sina in dal mu boš ime Izak.  Sklenil bom z njim svojo zavezo kot večno zavezo za njegove potomce za njim.
19.en: God said, “No, but Sarah, your wife, will bear you a son. You shall call his name Isaac.  I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant for his seed after him.

20.sl: Tudi glede Izmaela sem te uslišal; glej, blagoslovil ga bom in ga naredil rodovitnega ter ga silno namnožil; dvanajst knezov se mu bo rodilo in naredil bom iz njega velik narod.
20.en: As for Ishmael, I have heard you. Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly. He will become the father of twelve princes, and I will make him a great nation.

21.sl: Svojo zavezo pa bom sklenil z Izakom, ki ti ga bo rodila Sara čez leto dni.«
21.en: But my covenant I establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this set time in the next year.”

22.sl: Ko je Bog nehal govoriti z njim, se je vzdignil od Abrahama.
22.en: When he finished talking with him, God went up from Abraham.

23.sl: Abraham je vzel sina Izmaela, vse, ki so bili rojeni v hiši, in vse, ki so bili pridobljeni za denar, vse moške izmed ljudi Abrahamove hiše, in obrezal meso njihove prednje kožice še isti dan, kakor mu je Bog naročil.
23.en: Abraham took Ishmael his son, all who were born in his house, and all who were bought with his money; every male among the men of Abraham’s house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the same day, as God had said to him.

24.sl: Ko je bil Abraham obrezan na mesu svoje prednje kožice, je bil star devetindevetdeset let,
24.en: Abraham was ninety-nine years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

25.sl: njegovemu sinu Izmaelu pa je bilo trinajst let, ko je bil obrezan na mesu svoje prednje kožice.
25.en: Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

26.sl: Istega dne sta bila obrezana Abraham in njegov sin Izmael.
26.en: In the same day both Abraham and Ishmael, his son, were circumcised.

27.sl: Z njim vred so bili obrezani vsi moški njegove hiše, rojeni v hiši in za denar kupljeni od tujcev.
27.en: All the men of his house, those born in the house, and those bought with money of a foreigner, were circumcised with him.

1.sl: Gospod se je prikazal Abrahamu  pri Mamrejevih hrastih, ko je ob dnevni vročini sedèl pred vhodom v šotor.
1.en: Yahweh appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day.

2.sl: Povzdignil je oči, pogledal in glej, pred njim so stali trije možje. Ko jih je zagledal, jim je stekel naproti od vhoda v šotor in se jim priklonil do tal.
2.en: He lifted up his eyes and looked, and saw that three men stood opposite him. When he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself to the earth,

3.sl: Rekel je: »Moj gospod, če sem našel naklonjenost v tvojih očeh, nikar ne hodi mimo svojega služabnika!
3.en: and said, “My lord, if now I have found favor in your sight, please don’t go away from your servant.

4.sl: Naj prinesejo malo vode, da si umijete noge. Potem se spočijte pod drevesom!
4.en: Now let a little water be fetched, wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree.

5.sl: Jaz pa prinesem kos kruha, da se okrepčate, potem pa lahko greste naprej. Čemu bi sicer prišli mimo svojega služabnika!« Rekli so: »Stori, kakor si rekel!«
5.en:
I will get a morsel of bread so you can refresh your heart. After that you may go your way, now that you have come to your servant.”
 They said, “Very well, do as you have said.”

6.sl: Abraham je pohitel v šotor k Sari in rekel: »Hitro vzemi tri merice boljše moke, zamesi jo in speci kolače!«
6.en: Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah, and said, “Quickly make ready three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes.”

7.sl: Potem je Abraham tekel k živini. Vzel je mlado in lepo tele in ga dal hlapcu; ta ga je hitro pripravil.
7.en: Abraham ran to the herd, and fetched a tender and good calf, and gave it to the servant. He hurried to dress it.

8.sl: Vzel je masla in mleka ter tele, ki ga je bil pripravil, in vse to položil prednje. Stal je pri njih pod drevesom in so jedli.
8.en: He took butter, milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them. He stood by them under the tree, and they ate.

9.sl: Rekli so mu: »Kje je tvoja žena Sara?« Rekel je: »Glejte, v šotoru.«
9.en:
They said to him, “Where is Sarah, your wife?
 He said, “See, in the tent.”

10.sl: Pa je rekel: »Čez leto dni se bom vrnil k tebi in glej, tvoja žena Sara bo imela sina.« Sara pa je poslušala za vhodom v šotor, ki je bil za njim.
10.en:
He said, “I will certainly return to you when the season comes round. Behold, Sarah your wife will have a son.”
 Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him.

11.sl: Abraham in Sara sta bila stara, že zelo v letih; Sari se je nehalo dogajati, kakor se dogaja ženskam,
11.en: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age. It had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.

12.sl: pa se je sama pri sebi zasmejala in rekla: »Mar naj zdaj, ko sem uvela, še občutim slast? Tudi moj gospod je star.«
12.en: Sarah laughed within herself, saying, “After I have grown old will I have pleasure, my lord being old also?”

13.sl: Gospod pa je rekel Abrahamu: »Zakaj se je Sara zasmejala in rekla: ›Ali bom res rodila, ko sem že ostarela?‹
13.en: Yahweh said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh, saying, ‘Will I really bear a child, yet I am old?’

14.sl: Ali je za Gospoda kaj pretežko? Ko bom čez leto dni v tem času spet prišel k tebi, bo Sara imela sina.«
14.en: Is anything too hard for Yahweh? At the set time I will return to you, when the season comes round, and Sarah will have a son.”

15.sl: Sara pa je tajila in rekla: »Nisem se zasmejala.« Bala se je namreč. »Pač,« je rekel, »zares si se zasmejala.«
15.en:
Then Sarah denied, saying, “I didn’t laugh,” for she was afraid.
 He said, “No, but you did laugh.”

16.sl: Tedaj so se možje odpravili in gledali proti Sódomi, Abraham pa je šel z njimi, da bi jih pospremil.
16.en: The men rose up from there, and looked toward Sodom. Abraham went with them to see them on their way.

17.sl: Gospod si je rekel: »Ali naj skrivam pred Abrahamom, kaj nameravam storiti?
17.en: Yahweh said, “Will I hide from Abraham what I do,

18.sl: Iz Abrahama bo vendar nastal velik in mogočen narod in v njem bodo blagoslovljeni  vsi narodi zemlje.
18.en: seeing that Abraham has surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth will be blessed in him?

19.sl: Izbral  sem ga, da bo zapovedal svojim sinovom in svoji hiši za njim, naj se držijo Gospodove poti in ravnajo v skladu s pravičnostjo in pravico; tako bo Gospod izpolnil Abrahamu, kar mu je obljubil.«
19.en: For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, that they may keep the way of Yahweh, to do righteousness and justice; to the end that Yahweh may bring on Abraham that which he has spoken of him.”

20.sl: Gospod je rekel: »Vpitje iz Sódome in Gomóre je res silno in njihov greh je izredno težak.
20.en: Yahweh said, “Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous,

21.sl: Stopil bom dol, da vidim, ali so res počeli vse tisto, o čemer govori vpitje, ki prihaja do mene, ali ne. Izvedeti hočem.«
21.en: I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come to me. If not, I will know.”

22.sl: Moža sta se obrnila in odšla proti Sódomi, Abraham pa je še stal pred Gospodom.
22.en: The men turned from there, and went toward Sodom, but Abraham stood yet before Yahweh.

23.sl: Abraham je pristopil in rekel: »Ali boš res pokončal pravičnega s krivičnim vred?
23.en: Abraham drew near, and said, “Will you consume the righteous with the wicked?

24.sl: Mogoče je v mestu petdeset pravičnih. Ali boš tudi te pokončal in ne boš prizanesel kraju zaradi petdesetih pravičnih, ki so v njem?
24.en: What if there are fifty righteous within the city? Will you consume and not spare the place for the fifty righteous who are therein?

25.sl: Daleč naj bo od tebe, da bi ti storil kaj takega, da bi pobil pravičnega s krivičnim vred, da bi se enako zgodilo pravičnim kakor krivičnim! Daleč naj bo od tebe! Ali ne bo sodnik vse zemlje ravnal pravično?«
25.en: Be it far from you to do things like that, to kill the righteous with the wicked, that so the righteous should be as the wicked. May that be far from you. Shouldn’t the Judge of all the earth do right?”

26.sl: Gospod je rekel: »Če najdem v Sódomi petdeset pravičnih med meščani, bom prizanesel vsemu kraju zaradi njih.«
26.en: Yahweh said, “If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sake.”

27.sl: Abraham pa je rekel: »Glej, jaz, ki sem prah in pepel, sem si dovolil govoriti z Gospodom.
27.en: Abraham answered, “See now, I have taken it on myself to speak to the Lord, who am but dust and ashes.

28.sl: Mogoče jih petdesetim pravičnim manjka pet, ali boš zaradi teh petih uničil vse mesto?« Rekel je: »Ne bom ga uničil, če jih tam najdem petinštirideset.«
28.en:
What if there will lack five of the fifty righteous? Will you destroy all the city for lack of five?”
 He said, “I will not destroy it, if I find forty-five there.”

29.sl: Pa je spet spregovoril in mu rekel: »Mogoče se jih tam najde štirideset.« Odgovoril je: »Ne bom storil tega zaradi teh štiridesetih.«
29.en:
He spoke to him yet again, and said, “What if there are forty found there?”
 He said, “I will not do it for the forty’s sake.”

30.sl: Pa je rekel: »Naj se Gospod ne jezi, če govorim; mogoče se jih tam najde trideset.« Rekel je: »Ne bom storil tega, če jih najdem trideset.«
30.en:
He said, “Oh don’t let the Lord be angry, and I will speak. What if there are thirty found there?”
 He said, “I will not do it, if I find thirty there.”

31.sl: Rekel je: »Glej, dovolil sem si govoriti z Gospodom; mogoče se jih tam najde dvajset.« Rekel je: »Ne bom jih uničil zaradi teh dvajsetih.«
31.en:
He said, “See now, I have taken it on myself to speak to the Lord. What if there are twenty found there?”
 He said, “I will not destroy it for the twenty’s sake.”

32.sl: Abraham je rekel: »Naj se Gospod ne jezi, če spregovorim še tokrat: Mogoče se jih tam najde deset.« Odgovoril je: »Ne bom jih uničil zaradi teh desetih.«
32.en:
He said, “Oh don’t let the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once. What if ten are found there?”
 He said, “I will not destroy it for the ten’s sake.”

33.sl: Gospod je potem, ko je nehal govoriti z Abrahamom, odšel. Abraham pa se je vrnil v svoj kraj.
33.en: Yahweh went his way, as soon as he had finished communing with Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.

1.sl: Zvečer sta angela prišla v Sódomo, ko je Lot sedèl pri sódomskih vratih. Ko ju je zagledal, je vstal, jima šel naproti in se priklonil z obrazom do tal.
1.en: The two angels came to Sodom at evening. Lot sat in the gate of Sodom. Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them. He bowed himself with his face to the earth,

2.sl: Rekel je: »Prosim, gospoda, stopita v hišo svojega služabnika, da prenočita in si umijeta noge, zjutraj pa vstaneta in odideta po svoji poti.« Rekla sta: »Ne, prenočila bova na trgu.«
2.en:
and he said, “See now, my lords, please turn aside into your servant’s house, stay all night, wash your feet, and you will rise up early, and go on your way.”
 They said, “No, but we will stay in the street all night.”

3.sl: Zelo ju je silil, zato sta le odšla z njim in stopila v njegovo hišo. Pripravil jima je večerjo, spekel nekvašeni kruh in sta jedla.
3.en: He urged them greatly, and they came in with him, and entered into his house. He made them a feast, and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.

4.sl: Preden sta legla, so hišo obstopili meščani, sódomski moški, vsi, od dečkov do starcev, vse ljudstvo do zadnjega moža.
4.en: But before they lay down, the men of the city, the men of Sodom, surrounded the house, both young and old, all the people from every quarter.

5.sl: Klicali so Lota in mu rekli: »Kje sta moža, ki sta nocoj prišla k tebi? Pripelji ju ven k nam, da ju spoznamo!«
5.en: They called to Lot, and said to him, “Where are the men who came in to you this night? Bring them out to us, that we may have sex with them.”

6.sl: Lot je tedaj stopil ven k njim na prag, zaprl vrata za seboj
6.en: Lot went out to them to the door, and shut the door after him.

7.sl: in rekel: »Nikar, bratje moji, ne delajte hudega!
7.en: He said, “Please, my brothers, don’t act so wickedly.

8.sl: Glejte, imam dve hčeri, ki še nista spoznali moža; naj ju pripeljem k vam, da storite z njima, kar boste hoteli. Samo tema možema ne storite ničesar, saj sta prišla v senco moje strehe!«
8.en: See now, I have two virgin daughters. Please let me bring them out to you, and do you to them as is good in your eyes. Only don’t do anything to these men, because they have come under the shadow of my roof.”

9.sl: Rekli so: »Poberi se!« Potem so rekli: »Nekdo je prišel sem kot tujec, pa bi rad razsojal. Tebi bomo storili še kaj hujšega kakor njima.« Silno so pritiskali na Lota in bili na tem, da razbijejo vrata.
9.en: They said, “Stand back!” They said, “This one fellow came in to live as a foreigner, and he appoints himself a judge. Now will we deal worse with you, than with them!” They pressed hard on the man, even Lot, and drew near to break the door.

10.sl: A moža sta iztegnila roke, potegnila Lota k sebi v hišo in zaprla vrata.
10.en: But the men put forth their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and shut the door.

11.sl: Može pa, ki so stali pri vhodu, sta udarila s slepoto, od najmanjših do največjih, tako da niso mogli najti vrat.
11.en: They struck the men who were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great, so that they wearied themselves to find the door.

12.sl: In moža sta rekla Lotu: »Imaš v mestu še koga, morda zeta, sinove, hčere ali sicer kakega svojega človeka? Odpelji jih iz kraja!
12.en: The men said to Lot, “Do you have anybody else here? Sons-in-law, your sons, your daughters, and whoever you have in the city, bring them out of the place:

13.sl: Midva bova namreč ta kraj uničila, kajti njihovo vpitje, ki je prišlo do Gospoda, je prehudo. Zato naju je Gospod poslal, da ga uničiva.«
13.en: for we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is grown great before Yahweh. Yahweh has sent us to destroy it.”

14.sl: Lot je šel ven in govoril s svojima zetoma, ki sta nameravala vzeti njegovi hčeri. Rekel je: »Vstanita, pojdita iz tega kraja, kajti Gospod bo mesto uničil!« Toda zeta sta mislila, da se šali.
14.en:
Lot went out, and spoke to his sons-in-law, who were pledged to marry his daughters, and said, “Get up! Get out of this place, for Yahweh will destroy the city.”
 But he seemed to his sons-in-law to be joking.

15.sl: Ko se je vzdignila jutranja zarja, sta angela priganjala Lota in rekla: »Vstani, vzemi ženo in hčeri, ki sta tu, da ne boš pokončan zaradi krivde tega mesta!«
15.en: When the morning arose, then the angels hurried Lot, saying, “Arise, take your wife, and your two daughters who are here, lest you be consumed in the iniquity of the city.”

16.sl: Obotavljal se je, zato sta ga moža zgrabila za roko, prav tako tudi njegovo ženo in hčeri – ker mu je Gospod hotel prizanesti – in ga odpeljala ven ter ga pustila zunaj mesta.
16.en: But he lingered; and the men laid hold on his hand, and on the hand of his wife, and on the hand of his two daughters, Yahweh being merciful to him; and they took him out, and set him outside of the city.

17.sl: Ko sta jih vodila ven, sta rekla: »Reši si življenje! Ne oziraj se nazaj in ne ustavljaj se nikjer v pokrajini! V gorovje se reši, da ne boš pokončan!«
17.en: It came to pass, when they had taken them out, that he said, “Escape for your life! Don’t look behind you, neither stay anywhere in the plain. Escape to the mountain, lest you be consumed!”

18.sl: Lot jima je odgovoril: »Nikar, gospod!
18.en: Lot said to them, “Oh, not so, my lord.

19.sl: Glej, tvoj služabnik je našel milost v tvojih očeh in s tem, da si mi rešil življenje, si mi izkazal veliko dobroto. Toda ne morem se rešiti v gore; lahko bi se mi pripetila nesreča in bi umrl.
19.en: See now, your servant has found favor in your sight, and you have magnified your loving kindness, which you have shown to me in saving my life. I can’t escape to the mountain, lest evil overtake me, and I die.

20.sl: Glej, tisto mesto je dovolj blizu, da se morem zateči vanj. In tako majhno je. Dovôli, da se rešim tja! Ali ni res majhno? Tako bom ostal živ.«
20.en: See now, this city is near to flee to, and it is a little one. Oh let me escape there (isn’t it a little one?), and my soul will live.”

21.sl: Rekel mu je: »Glej, uslišal ti bom tudi to prošnjo in ne bom razdejal mesta, o katerem si govoril.
21.en: He said to him, “Behold, I have granted your request concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow the city of which you have spoken.

22.sl: Hitro se reši tja! Ničesar ne morem storiti, dokler ne prideš tja.« Zato se mesto imenuje Coar.
22.en: Hurry, escape there, for I can’t do anything until you get there.” Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.

23.sl: Sonce je vzhajalo nad deželo, ko je Lot prišel do Coarja
23.en: The sun was risen on the earth when Lot came to Zoar.

24.sl: in je Gospod storil, da sta od Gospoda, z neba, deževala na Sódomo in Gomóro žveplo in ogenj.
24.en: Then Yahweh rained on Sodom and on Gomorrah sulfur and fire from Yahweh out of the sky.

25.sl: Razdejal je ti mesti in vso pokrajino, vse prebivalce mest in vse rastlinstvo te dežele.
25.en: He overthrew those cities, all the plain, all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew on the ground.

26.sl: Lotova žena, ki je bila z njim, pa se je ozrla nazaj in postala solnat steber.
26.en: But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.

27.sl: Zgodaj zjutraj je šel Abraham na kraj, kjer je bil stal pred Gospodom.
27.en: Abraham got up early in the morning to the place where he had stood before Yahweh.

28.sl: Pogledal je proti Sódomi in Gomóri in vse naokrog po pokrajini. Pogledal je in glej, z zemlje se je vzdigoval dim, kakor bi se kadilo iz peči.
28.en: He looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain, and looked, and saw that the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace.

29.sl: Ko je Bog uničil mesta pokrajine, se je spomnil Abrahama in poslal Lota proč od razdejanja, ko je razdejal mesta, kjer je prebival Lot.
29.en: It happened, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in which Lot lived.

30.sl: Lot je iz Coarja odšel navzgor in se s hčerama naselil na gorovju. Bal se je namreč bivati v Coarju, zato je živel v votlini, on in obe hčeri.
30.en: Lot went up out of Zoar, and lived in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he was afraid to live in Zoar. He lived in a cave with his two daughters.

31.sl: Starejša hči je rekla mlajši: »Najin oče je star, v deželi pa ni moža, ki bi se nama približal po navadi vse zemlje.
31.en: The firstborn said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in to us after the manner of all the earth.

32.sl: Dajva, napojiva očeta z vinom in leziva z njim; tako obudiva zarod po očetu.«
32.en: Come, let’s make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve our father’s seed.”

33.sl: Tisti večer sta torej napojili očeta z vinom in starejša je šla in legla k očetu. Pa ni zaznal, ne ko je legla ne ko je vstala.
33.en: They made their father drink wine that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father. He didn’t know when she lay down, nor when she arose.

34.sl: Naslednji dan je starejša hči rekla mlajši: »Sinoči sem ležala z očetom; še nocoj ga napojiva z vinom! Potem pojdi ti in lezi z njim! Tako bova obudili zarod po očetu.«
34.en: It came to pass on the next day, that the firstborn said to the younger, “Behold, I lay last night with my father. Let us make him drink wine again, tonight. You go in, and lie with him, that we may preserve our father’s seed.”

35.sl: Tudi tisti večer sta napojili očeta z vinom. Mlajša hči je vstala in legla k njemu, pa ni zaznal, ne ko je legla ne ko je vstala.
35.en: They made their father drink wine that night also. The younger arose, and lay with him. He didn’t know when she lay down, nor when she arose.

36.sl: Tako sta obe Lotovi hčeri zanosili s svojim očetom.
36.en: Thus both of Lot’s daughters were with child by their father.

37.sl: Starejša hči je rodila sina in mu dala ime Moáb. To je oče Moábcev do danes.
37.en: The firstborn bore a son, and named him Moab. The same is the father of the Moabites to this day.

38.sl: Tudi mlajša hči je rodila sina in dala mu je ime Ben Amí. To je oče Amóncev do danes.
38.en: The younger also bore a son, and called his name Ben Ammi. The same is the father of the children of Ammon to this day.

1.sl: Od tam se je Abraham odpravil v pokrajino Negeb in se zadrževal med Kadešem in Šurom. Ko pa je kot tujec živel v Gerárju,
1.en: Abraham traveled from there toward the land of the South, and lived between Kadesh and Shur. He lived as a foreigner in Gerar.

2.sl: je govoril o svoji ženi Sari: »Moja sestra je.« Tedaj je gerárski kralj Abiméleh poslal po Saro in jo vzel k sebi.
2.en: Abraham said about Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.

3.sl: Toda Bog je prišel k Abimélehu ponoči v sanjah in mu rekel: »Glej, umrl boš zaradi ženske, ki si jo vzel, kajti poročena je!«
3.en: But God came to Abimelech in a dream of the night, and said to him, “Behold, you are a dead man, because of the woman whom you have taken. For she is a man’s wife.”

4.sl: Abiméleh pa se ji še ni približal. Rekel je: »Gospod, ali ubijaš tudi pravične ljudi?
4.en: Now Abimelech had not come near her. He said, “Lord, will you kill even a righteous nation?

5.sl: Mar ni on rekel: ›Moja sestra je.‹ Pa tudi sama je rekla: ›Moj brat je.‹ S poštenim srcem in čistimi rokami sem to storil.«
5.en: Didn’t he tell me, ‘She is my sister?’ She, even she herself said, ‘He is my brother.’ In the integrity of my heart and the innocence of my hands have I done this.”

6.sl: Bog pa mu je odgovoril v sanjah: »Tudi jaz vem, da si to storil s poštenim srcem in sam sem te obvaroval, da nisi grešil zoper mene. Zato nisem dal, da bi se je dotaknil.
6.en: God said to him in the dream, “Yes, I know that in the integrity of your heart you have done this, and I also withheld you from sinning against me. Therefore I didn’t allow you to touch her.

7.sl: Zdaj pa vrni ženo možu, kajti prerok je in molil bo zate, da ostaneš živ. Če pa je ne vrneš, vedi, da boste gotovo umrli ti in vsi tvoji.«
7.en: Now therefore, restore the man’s wife. For he is a prophet, and he will pray for you, and you will live. If you don’t restore her, know for sure that you will die, you, and all who are yours.”

8.sl: Abiméleh je vstal zgodaj zjutraj, sklical vse služabnike in jim povedal vse, kar se je zgodilo. Možje so se silno prestrašili.
8.en: Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ear. The men were very scared.

9.sl: Potem je Abiméleh poklical Abrahama in mu rekel: »Kaj si nam storil? S čim sem se pregrešil zoper tebe, da si nadme in nad moje kraljestvo spravil to veliko pregreho? Storil si mi, česar človek ne sme narediti.«
9.en: Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said to him, “What have you done to us? How have I sinned against you, that you have brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? You have done deeds to me that ought not to be done!”

10.sl: Dalje je Abiméleh rekel Abrahamu: »Kaj ti je prišlo na misel, da si to storil?«
10.en: Abimelech said to Abraham, “What did you see, that you have done this thing?”

11.sl: Abraham je rekel: »Rekel sem si: ›Gotovo ni strahu Božjega v tem kraju; ubili me bodo zaradi žene.‹
11.en: Abraham said, “Because I thought, ‘Surely the fear of God is not in this place. They will kill me for my wife’s sake.’

12.sl: Sicer pa je res moja sestra; hči mojega očeta je, a ne hči moje matere. Tako je postala moja žena.
12.en: Moreover she is indeed my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.

13.sl: Ko me je Bog poslal iz hiše mojega očeta po svetu, sem ji rekel: ›Narêdi mi tole dobroto: v vsakem kraju, kamor bova prišla, reci, da sem tvoj brat!‹«
13.en: It happened, when God caused me to wander from my father’s house, that I said to her, ‘This is your kindness which you shall show to me. Everywhere that we go, say of me, “He is my brother.”’”

14.sl: Abiméleh je tedaj vzel drobnico in govedo, hlapce in dékle ter jih dal Abrahamu. Vrnil mu je ženo Saro.
14.en: Abimelech took sheep and oxen, men-servants and women-servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored Sarah, his wife to him.

15.sl: Potem je Abiméleh rekel: »Glej, moja dežela je pred teboj; prebivaj, kjer ti ugaja.«
15.en: Abimelech said, “Behold, my land is before you. Dwell where it pleases you.”

16.sl: Sari pa je rekel: »Glej, tvojemu bratu dajem tisoč srebrnikov; glej, naj bo zate kot zagrinjalo čez oči za vse, ki so s teboj. Tako si v vsem opravičena.«
16.en: To Sarah he said, “Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver. Behold, it is for you a covering of the eyes to all that are with you. In front of all you are vindicated.”

17.sl: Potem je Abraham molil k Bogu in Bog je ozdravil Abiméleha, njegovo ženo in dékle, da so mogle roditi.
17.en: Abraham prayed to God. God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his maid-servants, and they bore children.

18.sl: Gospod je bil namreč zaprl naročja  vsem ženskam v Abimélehovi hiši zaradi Abrahamove žene Sare.
18.en: For Yahweh had closed up tight all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, Abraham’s wife.

1.sl: Gospod je obiskal Saro, kakor je rekel, in Gospod je storil Sari, kakor je napovedal.
1.en: Yahweh visited Sarah as he had said, and Yahweh did to Sarah as he had spoken.

2.sl: Sara je spočela in rodila Abrahamu sina v njegovi starosti ob času, ki mu ga je Bog napovedal.
2.en: Sarah conceived, and bore Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him.

3.sl: Abraham je svojemu sinu, ki mu ga je rodila Sara, dal ime Izak.
3.en: Abraham called his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bare to him, Isaac.

4.sl: Ko je bil sin Izak star osem dni, ga je Abraham obrezal, kakor mu je Bog zapovedal.
4.en: Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.

5.sl: Abraham je bil star sto let, ko se mu je rodil sin Izak.
5.en: Abraham was one hundred years old when his son, Isaac, was born to him.

6.sl: Sara je rekla: »Bog mi je pripravil smeh; kdor bo to slišal, se mi bo nasmihal.«
6.en: Sarah said, “God has made me laugh. Everyone who hears will laugh with me.”

7.sl: In rekla je: »Kdo bi dejal Abrahamu, da bo Sara dojila otroke? In vendar sem mu rodila sina v njegovi starosti.«
7.en: She said, “Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah would nurse children? For I have borne him a son in his old age.”

8.sl: Deček je rastel in ga je odstavila. Na dan, ko je bil Izak odstavljen, je Abraham napravil veliko gostijo.
8.en: The child grew, and was weaned. Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.

9.sl: Ko je Sara nekoč videla sina Egipčanke Hagáre, ki ga je rodila Abrahamu, kako se posmehuje,
9.en: Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, mocking.

10.sl: je rekla Abrahamu: »Naženi to deklo in njenega sina! Kajti sin te dekle ne sme dedovati skupaj z mojim sinom Izakom.«
10.en: Therefore she said to Abraham, “Cast out this handmaid and her son! For the son of this handmaid will not be heir with my son, even with Isaac.”

11.sl: Ta beseda Abrahamu zaradi sina ni bila prav nič pogodu.
11.en: The thing was very grievous in Abraham’s sight on account of his son.

12.sl: Bog pa mu je rekel: »Naj ti ne bo žal ne dečka ne dekle! Poslušaj Saro, kar koli ti poreče! Kajti po Izaku se ti bo imenovalo potomstvo.
12.en: God said to Abraham, “Don’t let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called.

13.sl: A tudi iz deklinega sina bom naredil narod, kajti tvoj potomec je.«
13.en: Also of the son of the handmaid will I make a nation, because he is your seed.”

14.sl: Abraham je zgodaj zjutraj vstal, vzel kruha in meh vode, dal to Hagári na rame in jo z dečkom  poslal proč. Šla je in blodila po beeršébski puščavi.
14.en: Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and gave her the child, and sent her away. She departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.

15.sl: Ko pa je voda v mehu pošla, je vrgla dečka pod enega od grmov.
15.en: The water in the bottle was spent, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.

16.sl: Potem je šla in sedla za streljaj puščice daleč; rekla si je namreč: »Naj ne gledam, kako deček umira!« Ko je tako sedela v bližini, je na glas zajokala.
16.en: She went and sat down opposite him, a good way off, about a bow shot away. For she said, “Don’t let me see the death of the child.” She sat over against him, and lifted up her voice, and wept.

17.sl: Bog je pa slišal dečkov glas in Božji angel je iz nebes poklical Hagáro ter ji rekel: »Kaj ti je, Hagára? Ne boj se, kajti Bog je slišal dečkov glas od tam, kjer leži.
17.en:
God heard the voice of the boy.
 The angel of God called to Hagar out of the sky, and said to her, “What ails you, Hagar? Don’t be afraid. For God has heard the voice of the boy where he is.

18.sl: Vstani, poberi dečka in ga dŕži s svojo roko! Kajti iz njega bom naredil velik narod.«
18.en: Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation.”

19.sl: Bog ji je tedaj odprl oči, da je zagledala studenec. Šla je, napolnila meh z vodo in dala piti dečku.
19.en: God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went, filled the bottle with water, and gave the boy drink.

20.sl: Bog je bil z dečkom. Rastel je, prebival v puščavi in postal lokostrelec.
20.en: God was with the boy, and he grew. He lived in the wilderness, and became, as he grew up, an archer.

21.sl: Živel je v paránski puščavi. Mati pa mu je dobila ženo iz egiptovske dežele.
21.en: He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.

22.sl: Tisti čas pa sta Abiméleh in poveljnik njegove vojske Pihól rekla Abrahamu: »Bog je s teboj v vsem, kar delaš.
22.en: It happened at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his army spoke to Abraham, saying, “God is with you in all that you do.

23.sl: Prisezi mi zdaj tukaj pri Bogu, da ne boš varal ne mene ne mojih naslednikov ne potomcev; enako dobroto, kakršno sem ti izkazoval jaz, izkazuj ti meni in deželi, v kateri prebivaš kot tujec!«
23.en: Now therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son’s son. But according to the kindness that I have done to you, you shall do to me, and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner.”

24.sl: Abraham je odgovoril: »Prisežem.«
24.en: Abraham said, “I will swear.”

25.sl: Tedaj se je Abraham pritožil Abimélehu zaradi studenca, ki so si ga Abimélehovi hlapci s silo prilastili.
25.en: Abraham complained to Abimelech because of a water well, which Abimelech’s servants had violently taken away.

26.sl: Abiméleh je rekel: »Ne vem, kdo je to storil, tudi ti mi nisi povedal in sam nisem slišal o tem do danes.«
26.en: Abimelech said, “I don’t know who has done this thing. Neither did you tell me, neither did I hear of it, until today.”

27.sl: Abraham je vzel od drobnice in goveda, dal to Abimélehu in sklenila sta zavezo.
27.en: Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them to Abimelech. Those two made a covenant.

28.sl: Abraham je oddelil od drobnice sedem jagnjic.
28.en: Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves.

29.sl: Abiméleh je rekel Abrahamu: »Kaj pomeni teh sedem jagnjic, ki si jih oddelil?«
29.en: Abimelech said to Abraham, “What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?”

30.sl: Rekel je: »Resnično, vzel boš sedem jagnjic iz moje roke, da mi boš za pričo, da sem jaz izkopal ta vodnjak.«
30.en: He said, “You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, that it may be a witness to me, that I have dug this well.”

31.sl: Zato je ta kraj dobil ime Beeršéba,  ker sta tam oba prisegla.
31.en: Therefore he called that place Beersheba,  because they both swore there.

32.sl: Tako sta pri Beeršébi sklenila zavezo. Potem sta Abiméleh in poveljnik njegove vojske Pihól vstala in se vrnila v filistejsko deželo.
32.en: So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Abimelech rose up with Phicol, the captain of his army, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.

33.sl: Abraham  je v Beeršébi zasadil tamarisko in tam klical ime Gospoda, večnega Boga.
33.en: Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and called there on the name of Yahweh, the Everlasting God.

34.sl: In Abraham je prebival veliko dni kot tujec v filistejski deželi.
34.en: Abraham lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines many days.

1.sl: Po teh dogodkih je Bog preizkušal Abrahama. Rekel mu je: »Abraham!« Rekel je: »Tukaj sem.«
1.en:
It happened after these things, that God tested Abraham, and said to him, “Abraham!”
 He said, “Here I am.”

2.sl: Pa je rekel: »Vzemi svojega sina, svojega edinca, ki ga ljubiš, Izaka, in pojdi v deželo Moríja! Tam ga daruj v žgalno daritev na gori, ki ti jo bom pokazal!«
2.en: He said, “Now take your son, your only son, whom you love, even Isaac, and go into the land of Moriah. Offer him there for a burnt offering on one of the mountains which I will tell you of.”

3.sl: Abraham je vstal zgodaj zjutraj, osedlal osla, vzel s seboj dva hlapca in svojega sina Izaka. Nacepil je drv za žgalno daritev, potem pa je vstal in odšel proti kraju, o katerem mu je govoril Bog.
3.en: Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went to the place of which God had told him.

4.sl: Tretji dan je povzdignil oči in od daleč zagledal kraj.
4.en: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place far off.

5.sl: Rekel je hlapcema: »Ostanita tukaj z oslom, jaz in deček pa greva tjakaj, da pomoliva. Potem se vrneva k vama.«
5.en: Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey. The boy and I will go yonder. We will worship, and come back to you.

6.sl: Abraham je vzel drva za žgalno daritev in jih naložil svojemu sinu Izaku, v svojo roko pa je vzel ogenj in nož. In šla sta oba skupaj.
6.en: Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. He took in his hand the fire and the knife. They both went together.

7.sl: Izak je nagovoril svojega očeta Abrahama in rekel: »Moj oče!« Ta je rekel: »Tukaj sem, moj sin.« Pa je rekel: »Glej, ogenj in drva, kje pa je jagnje za žgalno daritev?«
7.en:
Isaac spoke to Abraham his father, and said, “My father?”
 He said, “Here I am, my son.”
 He said, “Here is the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?”

8.sl: Abraham je rekel: »Bog si bo preskrbel jagnje za žgalno daritev, moj sin.« In šla sta oba skupaj.
8.en: Abraham said, “God will provide himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” So they both went together.

9.sl: Prišla sta na kraj, o katerem mu je Bog rekel. Tam je Abraham sezidal oltar in razložil drva. Zvezal je svojega sina Izaka in ga položil na oltar na drva.
9.en: They came to the place which God had told him of. Abraham built the altar there, and laid the wood in order, bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, on the wood.

10.sl: Potem je Abraham iztegnil svojo roko in vzel nož, da bi zaklal svojega sina.
10.en: Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to kill his son.

11.sl: Tedaj mu je zaklical Gospodov angel iz nebes in rekel: »Abraham, Abraham!« Rekel je: »Tukaj sem.«
11.en:
The angel of Yahweh called to him out of the sky, and said, “Abraham, Abraham!”
 He said, “Here I am.”

12.sl: In je rekel: »Ne izteguj svoje roke nad dečka in ne stôri mu ničesar, kajti zdaj vem, da se bojiš Boga, saj mi nisi odrekel svojega sina, svojega edinca.«
12.en: He said, “Don’t lay your hand on the boy, neither do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, seeing you have not withheld your son, your only son, from me.”

13.sl: Abraham je povzdignil oči in pogledal, in glej, za njim je bil oven, ki se je z rogovi zapletel v grmovje. Abraham je torej šel in vzel ovna in ga daroval v žgalno daritev namesto svojega sina.
13.en: Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and saw that behind him was a ram caught in the thicket by his horns. Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering instead of his son.

14.sl: Zato je Abraham tisti kraj imenoval »Gospod bo preskrbel«, kakor pravijo danes: Na gori Gospodovi bo preskrbljeno.
14.en: Abraham called the name of that place Yahweh-Jireh.  As it is said to this day, “In Yahweh’s mountain it will be provided.

15.sl: Gospodov angel je drugič poklical Abrahama iz nebes
15.en: The angel of Yahweh called to Abraham a second time out of the sky,

16.sl: in rekel: »Prisegel sem pri sebi, govori Gospod: Ker si to storil in nisi odrekel svojega sina, svojega edinca,
16.en: and said, “I have sworn by myself, says Yahweh, because you have done this thing, and have not withheld your son, your only son,

17.sl: te bom zares obilno blagoslovil in silno namnožil tvoje potomstvo, kakor zvezde na nebu in kakor pesek, ki je na morskem bregu. Tvoji potomci bodo vzeli v posest vrata svojih sovražnikov
17.en: that in blessing I will bless you, and in multiplying I will multiply your seed as the stars of the heavens, and as the sand which is on the seashore. Your seed will possess the gate of his enemies.

18.sl: in s tvojimi potomci se bodo blagoslavljali vsi narodi na zemlji, ker si poslušal moj glas.«
18.en: In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice.”

19.sl: Abraham se je vrnil k hlapcema, vzdignili so se in skupaj odšli proti Beeršébi. In Abraham je prebival v Beeršébi.
19.en: So Abraham returned to his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba. Abraham lived at Beersheba.

20.sl: Po teh dogodkih so povedali Abrahamu in rekli: »Tudi Milka je rodila sinove tvojemu bratu Nahórju:
20.en: It happened after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, “Behold, Milcah, she also has borne children to your brother Nahor:

21.sl: prvorojenca Uca, njegovega brata Buza, Arámovega očeta Kemuéla,
21.en: Uz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram,

22.sl: Keseda, Hazója, Pildáša, Jidláfa in Betuéla.«
22.en: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.”

23.sl: Betuélu pa se je rodila Rebeka. Osem otrok je rodila Milka Abrahamovemu bratu Nahórju.
23.en: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.

24.sl: Njegova stranska žena, Reúma po imenu, je tudi rodila, in sicer Tebaha, Gahama, Tahaša in Maahája.
24.en: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bare Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

1.sl: Sarino življenje je trajalo sto sedemindvajset let.
1.en: Sarah lived one hundred twenty-seven years. These were the years of Sarah’s life.

2.sl: Potem je umrla v Kirját Arbi, to je v Hebrónu, v kánaanski deželi. Abraham je prišel, da bi opravil za Saro žalovanje in jo objokoval.
2.en: Sarah died in Kiriath Arba (the same is Hebron), in the land of Canaan. Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.

3.sl: Ko se je Abraham vzdignil od pokojnice, je spregovoril Hetovim sinovom in rekel:
3.en: Abraham rose up from before his dead, and spoke to the children of Heth, saying,

4.sl: »Tujec in priseljenec sem pri vas. Dajte mi kos zemlje za grobišče pri vas, da spravim pokojnico od doma in jo pokopljem!«
4.en: “I am a stranger and a foreigner living with you. Give me a possession of a burying-place with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.”

5.sl: Hetovi sinovi so odgovorili in mu rekli:
5.en: The children of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him,

6.sl: »Poslušaj nas, gospod! Božji knez si med nami; v najlepšem izmed naših grobov pokoplji pokojnico! Nobeden izmed nas ti ne bo odrekel groba, da ne bi mogel pokopati pokojnice.«
6.en: “Hear us, my lord. You are a prince of God among us. In the choice of our tombs bury your dead. None of us will withhold from you his tomb, but that you may bury your dead.”

7.sl: Abraham se je vzdignil in se priklonil ljudstvu dežele, Hetovim sinovom.
7.en: Abraham rose up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.

8.sl: Potem jim je govoril in rekel: »Če vam je prav, da spravim pokojnico od doma in jo pokopljem, me poslušajte in rotite Coharjevega sina Efróna,
8.en: He talked with them, saying, “If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,

9.sl: naj mi da votlino Mahpélo, ki jo ima na koncu svojega polja. Za polno vrednost srebra naj mi jo da sredi med vami za grobišče.«
9.en: that he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he has, which is in the end of his field. For the full price let him give it to me in the midst of you for a possession of a burying-place.”

10.sl: Efrón pa je sedèl sredi med Hetovimi sinovi. In Hetejec Efrón je odgovoril Abrahamu vpričo Hetovih sinov, vseh, ki so prihajali k vratom njegovega mesta, in rekel:
10.en: Now Ephron was sitting in the midst of the children of Heth. Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the children of Heth, even of all who went in at the gate of his city, saying,

11.sl: »Ne, gospod, poslušaj me! Dam ti polje in tudi votlino, ki je na njem, ti dam; vpričo sinov svojega ljudstva ti jo dam. Le pokoplji pokojnico!«
11.en: “No, my lord, hear me. I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. In the presence of the children of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead.”

12.sl: Abraham se je priklonil pred ljudstvom dežele
12.en: Abraham bowed himself down before the people of the land.

13.sl: in govoril Efrónu vpričo ljudstva dežele in rekel: »Ko bi me le hotel poslušati! Dam ti srebro za polje. Vzemi ga od mene, da tam pokopljem pokojnico.«
13.en: He spoke to Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, “But if you will, please hear me. I will give the price of the field. Take it from me, and I will bury my dead there.”

14.sl: Efrón je odgovoril Abrahamu in mu rekel:
14.en: Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,

15.sl: »Poslušaj me, gospod! Zemljišče za štiristo šeklov srebra, kaj je to med menoj in teboj? Le pokoplji pokojnico!«
15.en: “My lord, listen to me. What is a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver between me and you? Therefore bury your dead.”

16.sl: Ko je Abraham slišal Efróna, mu je vpričo Hetovih sinov odtehtal srebro, ki ga je zahteval: štiristo šeklov srebra po veljavni trgovski teži.
16.en: Abraham listened to Ephron. Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the audience of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the current merchants’ standard.

17.sl: Tako je prešlo Efrónovo polje, ki je v Mahpéli nasproti Mamreju, polje in votlina na njem in vse drevje, ki je bilo na polju po vsem zemljišču naokrog,
17.en: So the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the border of it round about, were made sure

18.sl: Abrahamu v last vpričo Hetovih sinov, vseh, ki so prihajali k vratom njegovega mesta.
18.en: to Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all who went in at the gate of his city.

19.sl: Potem je Abraham pokopal svojo ženo Saro v votlini na polju Mahpéli nasproti Mamreju, to je Hebrónu, v kánaanski deželi.
19.en: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre (the same is Hebron), in the land of Canaan.

20.sl: Tako sta polje in votlina na njem od Hetovih sinov prešla v last Abrahamu za grobišče.
20.en: The field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure to Abraham for a possession of a burying place by the children of Heth.

1.sl: Abraham je bil star, že močno v letih in Gospod ga je v vsem blagoslovil.
1.en: Abraham was old, and well stricken in age. Yahweh had blessed Abraham in all things.

2.sl: Abraham je rekel najstarejšemu služabniku svoje hiše, ki je upravljal vse njegovo imetje: »Polôži roko pod moja ledja,
2.en: Abraham said to his servant, the elder of his house, who ruled over all that he had, “Please put your hand under my thigh.

3.sl: da te zaprisežem pri Gospodu, Bogu neba in Bogu zemlje, da ne vzameš žene mojemu sinu izmed hčera Kánaancev, med katerimi prebivam,
3.en: I will make you swear by Yahweh, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I live.

4.sl: ampak da pojdeš v mojo deželo, k mojemu sorodstvu, in dobiš ženo za mojega sina Izaka.«
4.en: But you shall go to my country, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son Isaac.”

5.sl: Služabnik pa mu je rekel: »Kaj pa, če ženska ne bo hotela iti z menoj v to deželo? Ali naj popeljem tvojega sina nazaj v deželo, iz katere si prišel?«
5.en: The servant said to him, “What if the woman isn’t willing to follow me to this land? Must I bring your son again to the land you came from?”

6.sl: Abraham mu je rekel: »Varuj se tega, da bi odpeljal mojega sina tjakaj!
6.en: Abraham said to him, “Beware that you don’t bring my son there again.

7.sl: Gospod, Bog neba, ki me je vzel iz hiše mojega očeta in iz dežele moje rodbine, ta, ki mi je govoril, mi prisegel in rekel: ›Tvojemu potomstvu bom dal to deželo,‹ bo poslal svojega angela pred teboj, da boš od tam dobil ženo mojemu sinu.
7.en: Yahweh, the God of heaven, who took me from my father’s house, and from the land of my birth, who spoke to me, and who swore to me, saying, ‘I will give this land to your seed .’ He will send his angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there.

8.sl: Če pa ženska ne bi hotela iti s teboj, si prost te moje prisege. Samo nikar ne vôdi mojega sina tjakaj!«
8.en: If the woman isn’t willing to follow you, then you shall be clear from this my oath. Only you shall not bring my son there again.”

9.sl: Služabnik je tedaj položil roko pod ledja svojega gospoda Abrahama in mu prisegel glede te zadeve.
9.en: The servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning this matter.

10.sl: Služabnik je vzel deset kamel izmed kamel svojega gospoda in odšel. S seboj je vzel tudi vseh vrst blago, najdragocenejše stvari svojega gospoda. Odpravil se je na pot in šel proti Mezopotamiji v Nahórjevo mesto.
10.en: The servant took ten camels, of his master’s camels, and departed, having all goodly things of his master’s in his hand. He arose, and went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor.

11.sl: Ustavil je kamele, da bi se spočile zunaj mesta pri vodnjaku. Bilo je proti večeru ob času, ko hodijo ženske zajemat vodo.
11.en: He made the camels kneel down outside the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time that women go out to draw water.

12.sl: Tedaj je rekel: »Gospod, Bog mojega gospoda Abrahama, pomagaj mi, da se mi danes posreči, in izkaži dobroto mojemu gospodu Abrahamu!
12.en: He said, “Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, please give me success this day, and show kindness to my master Abraham.

13.sl: Glej, stojim pri studencu in hčere mož tega mesta prihajajo zajemat vodo.
13.en: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water. The daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water.

14.sl: Dekle, ki ji bom rekel: ›Nagni, prosim, vrč, da bom pil!‹ in ki bo rekla: ›Pij! Pa tudi tvoje kamele bom napojila,‹ naj bo tista, ki si jo določil za svojega služabnika Izaka, in po tem bom spoznal, da si izkazal dobroto mojemu gospodu.«
14.en: Let it happen, that the young lady to whom I will say, ‘Please let down your pitcher, that I may drink.’ She will say, ‘Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink.’ Let the same be she who you have appointed for your servant Isaac. Thereby will I know that you have shown kindness to my master.”

15.sl: Še preden je to do kraja izgovoril, je prišla Rebeka, ki se je rodila Betuélu, sinu Milke, žene Abrahamovega brata Nahórja, z vrčem na rami.
15.en: It happened, before he had done speaking, that behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham’s brother, with her pitcher on her shoulder.

16.sl: Bila je zelo lepega videza, devica, ki je še ni spoznal moški. Stopila je k studencu, napolnila vrč in prišla gor.
16.en: The young lady was very beautiful to look at, a virgin, neither had any man known her. She went down to the spring, filled her pitcher, and came up.

17.sl: Tedaj ji je služabnik pritekel naproti in rekel: »Daj mi, prosim, piti malo vode iz vrča!«
17.en: The servant ran to meet her, and said, “Please give me a drink, a little water from your pitcher.”

18.sl: Rekla je: »Pij, gospod!« Hitro je spustila vrč na roko in mu dala piti.
18.en: She said, “Drink, my lord.” She hurried, and let down her pitcher on her hand, and gave him drink.

19.sl: In ko ga je napojila, je rekla: »Tudi tvojim kamelam grem zajemat vodo, dokler se ne napijejo.«
19.en: When she had done giving him drink, she said, “I will also draw for your camels, until they have done drinking.”

20.sl: Urno je spraznila vrč v korito in spet stekla k vodnjaku zajemat. Tako je zajela vsem njegovim kamelam.
20.en: She hurried, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again to the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.

21.sl: Medtem jo je mož molče opazoval, da bi spoznal, ali je Gospod njegovo pot naredil uspešno ali ne.
21.en: The man looked steadfastly at her, holding his peace, to know whether Yahweh had made his journey prosperous or not.

22.sl: Ko so se kamele napile, je vzel zlat obroček, težak pol šekla, in dve zlati zapestnici, težki deset šeklov, za njeni roki.
22.en: It happened, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold,

23.sl: Rekel je: »Čigava hči si? Povej mi, ali je v hiši tvojega očeta kaj prostora, kjer bi mi prenočili!«
23.en: and said, “Whose daughter are you? Please tell me. Is there room in your father’s house for us to lodge in?”

24.sl: Rekla mu je: »Sem hči Betuéla, Milkinega sina, ki ga je rodila Nahórju.«
24.en: She said to him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”

25.sl: Rekla mu je še: »Imamo veliko slame in krme in tudi prostora za prenočevanje.«
25.en: She said moreover to him, “We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.”

26.sl: Mož je pokleknil in se priklonil Gospodu.
26.en: The man bowed his head, and worshiped Yahweh.

27.sl: Rekel je: »Blagoslovljen bodi Gospod, Bog mojega gospoda Abrahama, ki ni odrekel svoje dobrote in zvestobe mojemu gospodu! Gospod me je vodil po poti, ki me je pripeljala do hiše brata mojega gospoda.«
27.en: He said, “Blessed be Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken his loving kindness and his truth toward my master. As for me, Yahweh has led me in the way to the house of my master’s relatives.”

28.sl: Dekle je stekla in povedala hiši svoje matere, kaj se je zgodilo.
28.en: The young lady ran, and told her mother’s house about these words.

29.sl: Rebeka je imela brata, ki mu je bilo ime Labán. In Labán je tekel ven k možu pri studencu.
29.en: Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man, to the spring.

30.sl: Ko je videl obroček in zapestnici na rokah svoje sestre in slišal besede sestre Rebeke, kako je rekla: »Tako mi je rekel mož,« je šel k možu. Ta je stal pri kamelah ob studencu.
30.en: It happened, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister’s hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, “This is what the man said to me,” that he came to the man. Behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring.

31.sl: Rekel je: »Pridi, blagoslovljen od Gospoda! Kaj bi stal zunaj! Pospravil sem hišo in naredil prostor za kamele.«
31.en: He said, “Come in, you blessed of Yahweh. Why do you stand outside? For I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.”

32.sl: Mož je stopil v hišo, Labán pa je razsedlal kamele, jim dal slame in krme, njemu in možem, ki so bili z njim, pa vode, da bi si umili noge.
32.en: The man came into the house, and he unloaded the camels. He gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him.

33.sl: Ko je predenj postavil jedi, je ta rekel: »Ne bom jedel, dokler ne povem svoje zadeve.« Labán je rekel: »Govôri!«
33.en:
Food was set before him to eat. But he said, “I will not eat until I have told my message.”
 He said, “Speak on.”

35.sl: Gospod je silno blagoslovil mojega gospoda, tako da je obogatel. Dal mu je drobnice in goveda, srebra in zlata, hlapcev in dekel, kamel in oslov.
35.en: Yahweh has blessed my master greatly. He has become great. He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, men-servants and maid-servants, and camels and donkeys.

36.sl: Sara, žena mojega gospoda, mu je rodila sina, potem ko je ostarela. Temu je izročil vse imetje.
36.en: Sarah, my master’s wife, bore a son to my master when she was old. He has given all that he has to him.

37.sl: Moj gospod me je zaprisegel in rekel: ›Ne jemlji mojemu sinu žene izmed hčera Kánaancev, v katerih deželi prebivam,
37.en: My master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live,

38.sl: temveč pojdi do hiše mojega očeta, k moji rodbini, in dôbi ženo mojemu sinu!‹
38.en: but you shall go to my father’s house, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son.’

39.sl: Rekel sem svojemu gospodu: ›Kaj pa, če ženska ne bo hotela iti z menoj?‹
39.en: I said to my master, ‘What if the woman will not follow me?’

40.sl: Pa mi je rekel: ›Gospod, pred čigar obličjem hodim, bo poslal svojega angela s teboj in bo storil, da bo tvoja pot uspešna in da boš dobil ženo mojemu sinu iz moje rodbine, iz hiše mojega očeta.
40.en: He said to me, ‘Yahweh, before whom I walk, will send his angel with you, and prosper your way. You shall take a wife for my son of my relatives, and of my father’s house.

41.sl: Le tedaj te prisega, ki si mi jo izrekel, ne bo več vezala, če boš prišel k moji rodbini in ti je ne bodo hoteli dati, tedaj si prost prisege.‹
41.en: Then will you be clear from my oath, when you come to my relatives. If they don’t give her to you, you shall be clear from my oath.’

42.sl: Tako sem danes prišel k studencu in govoril: ›Gospod, Bog mojega gospoda Abrahama, ko bi vendar hotel narediti uspešno to pot, po kateri hodim!
42.en: I came this day to the spring, and said, ‘Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go.

43.sl: Glej, stojim pri studencu; ko pride dekle zajemat, ji bom rekel: Daj mi piti malo vode iz svojega vrča!
43.en: Behold, I am standing by the spring of water. Let it happen, that the maiden who comes forth to draw, to whom I will say, Give me, I pray you, a little water from your pitcher to drink.

44.sl: Če mi bo rekla: Pij, pa tudi za tvoje kamele bom zajela, je to tista ženska, ki jo je Gospod določil za sina mojega gospoda.‹
44.en: She will tell me, “Drink, and I will also draw for your camels.” Let the same be the woman whom Yahweh has appointed for my master’s son.’

45.sl: Še preden sem to izgovoril v svojem srcu, je prišla Rebeka z vrčem na rami in stopila dol k studencu zajemat. Pa sem ji rekel: ›Daj mi, prosim, piti!‹
45.en: Before I had done speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder. She went down to the spring, and drew. I said to her, ‘Please let me drink.’

46.sl: Hitro je spustila vrč z rame in rekla: ›Pij, pa tudi tvoje kamele bom napojila.‹ Pil sem torej in tudi kamele je napojila.
46.en: She hurried and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, ‘Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink.’ So I drank, and she made the camels drink also.

47.sl: Vprašal sem jo: ›Čigava hči si?‹ Rekla je: ›Sem hči Betuéla, Nahórjevega sina, ki mu ga je rodila Milka.‹ Tedaj sem ji dal obroček na nos in zapestnici na roke.
47.en: I asked her, and said, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ She said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor’s son, whom Milcah bare to him.’ I put the ring on her nose, and the bracelets on her hands.

48.sl: Potem sem pokleknil in se priklonil Gospodu in hvalil Gospoda, Boga svojega gospoda Abrahama, ki me je vodil po pravi poti, da bi vzel hčer brata  svojega gospoda za njegovega sina.
48.en: I bowed my head, and worshiped Yahweh, and blessed Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master’s brother’s daughter for his son.

49.sl: Če ste torej pripravljeni izkazati dobroto in zvestobo mojemu gospodu, mi povejte! In če ne, mi povejte, da se obrnem na desno ali na levo!«
49.en: Now if you will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me. If not, tell me. That I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.”

50.sl: Labán in Betuél sta odgovorila: »Od Gospoda je prišla ta stvar, ne moreva ti reči o tem ne dobro ne slabo.
50.en: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, “The thing proceeds from Yahweh. We can’t speak to you bad or good.

51.sl: Tu imaš Rebeko; vzemi jo in pojdi in naj bo žena sinu tvojega gospoda, kakor je govoril Gospod!«
51.en: Behold, Rebekah is before you, take her, and go, and let her be your master’s son’s wife, as Yahweh has spoken.”

52.sl: Ko je Abrahamov služabnik slišal te besede, se je do tal priklonil Gospodu.
52.en: It happened that when Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth to Yahweh.

53.sl: In služabnik je potegnil na dan srebrne in zlate posode in oblačila ter dal to Rebeki. Tudi njenemu bratu in materi je dal dragocena darila.
53.en: The servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing, and gave them to Rebekah. He gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.

54.sl: Potem so jedli in pili, on in možje, ki so bili z njim, in prenočili. Ko pa so zjutraj vstali, je rekel: »Odpustite me k mojemu gospodu!«
54.en: They ate and drank, he and the men who were with him, and stayed all night. They rose up in the morning, and he said, “Send me away to my master.”

55.sl: Njen brat in njena mati sta rekla: »Naj dekle ostane pri nas še nekaj časa, kakih deset dni, potem bo šla.«
55.en: Her brother and her mother said, “Let the young lady stay with us a few days, at least ten. After that she will go.”

56.sl: Rekel jima je: »Ne zadržujta me! Gospod je mojo pot kronal z uspehom. Odpustita me, naj odidem k svojemu gospodu!«
56.en: He said to them, “Don’t hinder me, seeing Yahweh has prospered my way. Send me away that I may go to my master.”

57.sl: Rekla sta: »Pokličimo dekle in jo vprašajmo, kaj meni!«
57.en: They said, “We will call the young lady, and ask her.”

58.sl: Poklicala sta Rebeko in ji rekla: »Ali bi hotela oditi s tem možem?« Rekla je: »Pojdem.«
58.en:
They called Rebekah, and said to her, “Will you go with this man?”
 She said, “I will go.”

59.sl: Odpustili so torej svojo sestro Rebeko, njeno dojiljo, Abrahamovega služabnika in njegove može.
59.en: They sent away Rebekah, their sister, with her nurse, Abraham’s servant, and his men.

60.sl:
Blagoslovili so Rebeko in ji rekli:
 »O sestra naša,
 namnôži se v tisoče deset tisočev!
 Tvoj zarod naj zavzame
 vrata svojih sovražnikov!«
60.en: They blessed Rebekah, and said to her, “Our sister, may you be the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let your seed possess the gate of those who hate them.”

61.sl: Rebeka in njene služabnice so se vzdignile, sedle na kamele in šle za možem. Tako je služabnik vzel Rebeko in odšel.
61.en: Rebekah arose with her ladies. They rode on the camels, and followed the man. The servant took Rebekah, and went his way.

62.sl: Tisti čas se je Izak vrnil od vodnjaka v Laháj Roí in prebival v pokrajini Negeb.
62.en: Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi. For he lived in the land of the South.

63.sl: Proti večeru se je šel sprehajat  na polje. Ko je vzdignil oči, je zagledal, da se bližajo kamele.
63.en: Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the evening. He lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming.

64.sl: Tudi Rebeka je vzdignila oči in zagledala Izaka. Spustila se je s kamele.
64.en: Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from the camel.

65.sl: Rekla je služabniku: »Kdo je človek, ki nam prihaja naproti po polju?« Služabnik je rekel: »To je moj gospod.« Tedaj je vzela tančico in se zakrila.
65.en:
She said to the servant, “Who is the man who is walking in the field to meet us?”
 The servant said, “It is my master.”
 She took her veil, and covered herself.

66.sl: Služabnik je Izaku poročal o vsem, kar je storil.
