66.en: The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.

67.sl: Izak jo je popeljal v šotor svoje matere Sare. Vzel je Rebeko, da je postala njegova žena. Izak jo je ljubil in se potolažil po materini smrti.
67.en: Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah’s tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife. He loved her. Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.

1.sl: Abraham si je spet vzel ženo. Ime ji je bilo Ketúra.
1.en: Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah.

2.sl: Rodila mu je Zimrána, Jokšána, Medána, Midjána, Jišbáka in Šuaha.
2.en: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

3.sl: Jokšánu pa sta se rodila Šebá in Dedán. Dedánovi sinovi so Ašuríti, Letušéjci in Leuméjci.
3.en: Jokshan became the father of Sheba, and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.

4.sl: Midjánovi sinovi so Efá, Efer, Henoh, Abidá in Eldaá. Vsi ti so Ketúrini sinovi.
4.en: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.

5.sl: Abraham je vse svoje imetje izročil Izaku.
5.en: Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac,

6.sl: Sinovom stranskih žena, ki jih je imel, pa je Abraham dal darove in jih poslal, dokler je še živel, proč od sina Izaka proti vzhodu v vzhodno deželo.
6.en: but to the sons of the concubines who Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts. He sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, to the east country.

7.sl: To je število Abrahamovih let, ki jih je preživel: sto petinsedemdeset.
7.en: These are the days of the years of Abraham’s life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years.

8.sl: Abraham je izdihnil in umrl v visoki starosti, star in nasičen z dnevi, in bil pridružen svojim ljudem.
8.en: Abraham gave up the spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years, and was gathered to his people.

9.sl: Sinova Izak in Izmael sta ga pokopala v votlini Mahpéli na polju Efróna, sina Hetejca Coharja, nasproti Mamreju,
9.en: Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre,

10.sl: na polju, ki ga je Abraham kupil od Hetovih sinov; tam sta bila pokopana Abraham in njegova žena Sara.
10.en: the field which Abraham purchased of the children of Heth. There was Abraham buried, with Sarah his wife.

11.sl: Po Abrahamovi smrti pa je Bog blagoslovil njegovega sina Izaka. Prebival je pri vodnjaku Laháj Roí.
11.en: It happened after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac, his son. Isaac lived by Beer Lahai Roi.

12.sl: To je rodovnik Abrahamovega sina Izmaela, ki ga je Abrahamu rodila Egipčanka Hagára, Sarina dekla.
12.en: Now this is the history of the generations of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s handmaid, bore to Abraham.

13.sl: To so imena Izmaelovih sinov, imena po redu rojstev: Izmaelov prvorojenec Nebajót, potem Kedár, Adbeél, Mibsám,
13.en: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to the order of their birth: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

14.sl: Mišmá, Dumá, Masá,
14.en: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

15.sl: Hadád, Temá, Jetúr, Nafíš in Kedma.
15.en: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.

16.sl: To so Izmaelovi sinovi in to so njihova imena po naseljih in šotoriščih, dvanajst knezov po njihovih rodovih.
16.en: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments: twelve princes, according to their nations.

17.sl: To pa so leta Izmaelovega življenja: sto sedemintrideset let. Izdihnil je in umrl ter bil pridružen svojim ljudem.
17.en: These are the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred thirty-seven years. He gave up the spirit and died, and was gathered to his people.

18.sl: Prebivali so od Havíle do Šura, ki je nasproti Egiptu, in vse do Asirije. Naselil se je nasproti vsem svojim bratom.
18.en: They lived from Havilah to Shur that is before Egypt, as you go toward Assyria. He lived opposite all his relatives.

19.sl: To pa je rodovnik Abrahamovega sina Izaka. Abrahamu se je rodil Izak.
19.en: This is the history of the generations of Isaac, Abraham’s son. Abraham became the father of Isaac.

20.sl: Ko je bil Izak star štirideset let, je vzel za ženo Rebeko, hčer Aramejca Betuéla iz Mezopotamije, sestro Aramejca Labána.
20.en: Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Paddan Aram, the sister of Laban the Syrian, to be his wife.

21.sl: Izak je prosil Gospoda za ženo, ker je bila nerodovitna. Gospod ga je uslišal in žena Rebeka je spočela.
21.en: Isaac entreated Yahweh for his wife, because she was barren. Yahweh was entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

22.sl: Ko sta se otroka pehala v njenem telesu, je rekla: »Če je tako, čemu naj še živim?«  Šla je vprašat za svet Gospoda.
22.en: The children struggled together within her. She said, “If it be so, why do I live?” She went to inquire of Yahweh.

23.sl:
Gospod ji je rekel:
 »Dva naroda sta v tvojem telesu,
 dve ljudstvi se bosta ločili iz tvojega naročja.
 Eno bo močnejše od drugega
 in starejše bo služilo mlajšemu.«
23.en:
Yahweh said to her,
 Two nations are in your womb,
 Two peoples will be separated from your body.
 The one people will be stronger than the other people.
 The elder will serve the younger.

24.sl: Ko so se dopolnili dnevi, da bi rodila, glej, sta bila v njenem telesu dvojčka.
24.en: When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

25.sl: Prišel je na svet prvi, rdečkast, ves poraščen, kakor bi imel kožuh. Zato so mu dali ime Ezav.
25.en: The first came out red all over, like a hairy garment. They named him Esau.

26.sl: Potem je prišel na svet njegov brat. Z roko je trdno držal Ezava za peto. Dali so mu ime Jakob.  Ko sta se rodila, je bil Izak star šestdeset let.
26.en: After that, his brother came out, and his hand had hold on Esau’s heel. He was named Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.

27.sl: Dečka sta rastla in Ezav je postal izkušen lovec. Bil je človek polja. Jakob pa je bil miren človek in je prebival v šotorih.
27.en: The boys grew. Esau was a skillful hunter, a man of the field. Jacob was a quiet man, living in tents.

28.sl: Izak je ljubil Ezava, ker je imel rad divjačino, Rebeka pa je imela rajši Jakoba.
28.en: Now Isaac loved Esau, because he ate his venison. Rebekah loved Jacob.

29.sl: Ko je nekoč Jakob skuhal jed, je prišel Ezav ves onemogel s polja.
29.en: Jacob boiled stew. Esau came in from the field, and he was famished.

30.sl: Ezav je rekel Jakobu: »Daj mi, da pogoltnem malo rdečega, tega rdečega, kajti ves onemogel sem.« Zato je dobil ime Edóm.
30.en: Esau said to Jacob, “Please feed me with that same red stew, for I am famished.” Therefore his name was called Edom.

31.sl: Jakob je rekel: »Prej mi prodaj svojo pravico prvorojenstva!«
31.en: Jacob said, “First, sell me your birthright.”

32.sl: Ezav je rekel: »Vidiš, da umiram, čemu mi bo prvorojenstvo?«
32.en: Esau said, “Behold, I am about to die. What good is the birthright to me?”

33.sl: Jakob je rekel: »Prej  mi prisezi!« In mu je prisegel in prodal pravico prvorojenstva Jakobu.
33.en:
Jacob said, “Swear to me first.”
 He swore to him. He sold his birthright to Jacob.

34.sl: Jakob je potem Ezavu dal kruha in kuhane leče. Jedel je in pil, nato pa je vstal in odšel. Tako malo je Ezav cenil pravico prvorojenstva.
34.en: Jacob gave Esau bread and stew of lentils. He ate and drank, rose up, and went his way. So Esau despised his birthright.

1.sl: V deželi je nastala lakota, druga od tiste, ki je bila v Abrahamovih dneh. Zato je šel Izak k filistejskemu kralju Abimélehu v Gerár.
1.en: There was a famine in the land, besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines, to Gerar.

2.sl: Gospod se mu je prikazal in rekel: »Ne hôdi v Egipt, ostani v deželi, ki ti jo določim!
2.en: Yahweh appeared to him, and said, “Don’t go down into Egypt. Dwell in the land which I will tell you of.

3.sl: Bivaj kot tujec v tej deželi; s teboj bom in te bom blagoslovil, kajti tebi in tvojemu potomstvu bom dal vse te dežele. Izpolnil bom prisego, ki sem jo dal tvojemu očetu Abrahamu.
3.en: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you, and will bless you. For to you, and to your seed, I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I swore to Abraham your father.

4.sl: Namnožil bom tvoje potomce, da jih bo, kolikor je zvezd na nebu. Tvojemu potomstvu bom dal vse te dežele in s tvojim zarodom se bodo blagoslavljali vsi narodi zemlje.
4.en: I will multiply your seed as the stars of the sky, and will give to your seed all these lands. In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed,

5.sl: Zato, ker je Abraham poslušal moj glas in izpolnjeval, kar sem mu ukazal, moje zapovedi, zakone in postave.«
5.en: because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.”

6.sl: Izak je torej ostal v Gerárju.
6.en: Isaac lived in Gerar.

7.sl: Ko so ga možje tega kraja vprašali o njegovi ženi, je rekel: »Moja sestra je.« Bal se je namreč reči, da je njegova žena. Mislil si je:  »Da me morda možje tega kraja ne umorijo zaradi Rebeke.« Bila je namreč lepega videza.
7.en: The men of the place asked him about his wife. He said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say, “My wife,” lest, he thought, the men of the place might kill me for Rebekah, because she was beautiful to look on.

8.sl: Ko je tam bival že več dni, je filistejski kralj Abiméleh pogledal skoz okno in glej, Izak je ljubkoval ženo Rebeko.
8.en: It happened, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was caressing Rebekah, his wife.

9.sl: Abiméleh je poklical Izaka in rekel: »Tako torej, to je tvoja žena! Kako si mogel reči: ›Moja sestra je.‹« Izak mu je rekel: »Resnično sem mislil: da morda ne umrem zaradi nje.«
9.en:
Abimelech called Isaac, and said, “Behold, surely she is your wife. Why did you say, ‘She is my sister?’”
 Isaac said to him, “Because I said, ‘Lest I die because of her.’”

10.sl: Abiméleh pa je rekel: »Kaj si nam storil! Prav lahko bi kdo od ljudstva ležal s tvojo ženo in ti bi spravil krivdo na nas.«
10.en: Abimelech said, “What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt on us!”

11.sl: Abiméleh je zapovedal vsemu ljudstvu in rekel: »Kdor se dotakne tega moža ali njegove žene, mora umreti!«
11.en: Abimelech charged all the people, saying, “He who touches this man or his wife will surely be put to death.”

12.sl: Izak je sejal v tej deželi. Tisto leto je pridelal stotero; tako ga je Gospod blagoslovil.
12.en: Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year one hundred times what he planted. Yahweh blessed him.

13.sl: Mož je obogatel in potem še in še bogatel, tako da je bil silno mogočen.
13.en: The man grew great, and grew more and more until he became very great.

14.sl: Imel je črede drobnice in goveda in veliko služabnikov. Zaradi tega so mu bili Filistejci nevoščljivi.
14.en: He had possessions of flocks, possessions of herds, and a great household. The Philistines envied him.

15.sl: Vse vodnjake, ki so jih izkopali hlapci njegovega očeta v Abrahamovih dneh, so Filistejci zasuli in jih napolnili s prstjo.
15.en: Now all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped, and filled with earth.

16.sl: Abiméleh je rekel Izaku: »Pojdi od nas, kajti premogočen si postal za nas!«
16.en: Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go from us, for you are much mightier than we.”

17.sl: Izak je torej šel odondod, postavil šotor v Gerárski dolini in tam prebival.
17.en: Isaac departed from there, encamped in the valley of Gerar, and lived there.

18.sl: Dal je spet izkopati vodnjake, ki so jih izkopali v dneh njegovega očeta Abrahama, pa so jih Filistejci po Abrahamovi smrti zasuli. Dal jim je tista imena, s katerimi jih je poimenoval njegov oče.
18.en: Isaac dug again the wells of water, which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father. For the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham. He called their names after the names by which his father had called them.

19.sl: Izakovi hlapci so kopali v dolini in tam našli vodnjak žive vode.
19.en: Isaac’s servants dug in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.

20.sl: Gerárski pastirji pa so se začeli prepirati z Izakovimi pastirji in rekli: »Voda je naša.« Zato je Izak studenec imenoval Esek,  ker so se z njim prepirali.
20.en: The herdsmen of Gerar argued with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” He called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him.

21.sl: Izkopali so še drug vodnjak. Pa tudi zaradi tega so se sprli. Zato mu je dal ime Sitna.
21.en: They dug another well, and they argued over that, also. He called the name of it Sitnah.

22.sl: Premaknil se je od tam in izkopal drug vodnjak, zanj pa se niso prepirali; zato mu je dal ime Rehobót.  Rekel je: »Resnično, zdaj nam je Gospod razširil prostor, da lahko rastemo v deželi.«
22.en: He left that place, and dug another well. They didn’t argue over that one. He called it Rehoboth. He said, “For now Yahweh has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land.”

23.sl: Od tam je šel v Beeršébo.
23.en: He went up from there to Beersheba.

24.sl: Gospod se mu je prikazal tisto noč in rekel: »Jaz sem Bog tvojega očeta Abrahama. Nikar se ne boj, kajti jaz sem s teboj! Blagoslovil te bom in pomnožil tvoje potomstvo zaradi svojega služabnika Abrahama.«
24.en: Yahweh appeared to him the same night, and said, “I am the God of Abraham your father. Don’t be afraid, for I am with you, and will bless you, and multiply your seed for my servant Abraham’s sake.”

25.sl: Tam je Izak postavil oltar in klical Gospodovo ime. Razpel je svoj šotor in Izakovi hlapci so tam izkopali vodnjak.
25.en: He built an altar there, and called on the name of Yahweh, and pitched his tent there. There Isaac’s servants dug a well.

26.sl: Tedaj je prišel k njemu Abiméleh iz Gerárja. Z njim sta bila še njegov svetovalec Ahuzát in poveljnik vojske Pihól.
26.en: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol the captain of his army.

27.sl: Izak jim je rekel: »Čemu ste prišli k meni, ko me sovražite in ste me pregnali od sebe?«
27.en: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, since you hate me, and have sent me away from you?”

28.sl: Rekli so: »Jasno smo videli, da je Gospod s teboj in smo rekli: ›Dogovorimo se med seboj, mi in ti!‹ Radi bi sklenili zavezo s teboj,
28.en: They said, “We saw plainly that Yahweh was with you. We said, ‘Let there now be an oath between us, even between us and you, and let us make a covenant with you,

29.sl: da nam ne storiš nič hudega, kakor se te mi nismo dotaknili in kakor smo ti storili le dobro in te odpustili v miru. Zdaj je tebe Gospod blagoslovil.«
29.en: that you will do us no harm, as we have not touched you, and as we have done to you nothing but good, and have sent you away in peace.’ You are now the blessed of Yahweh.”

30.sl: Tedaj jim je napravil gostijo, jedli so in pili.
30.en: He made them a feast, and they ate and drank.

31.sl: Zjutraj so zgodaj vstali in si prisegli med seboj. Potem jih je Izak odpustil in odšli so v miru.
31.en: They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

32.sl: Prav tistega dne so prišli Izakovi hlapci in mu povedali o vodnjaku, ki so ga kopali. Rekli so: »Našli smo vodo.«
32.en: It happened the same day, that Isaac’s servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water.”

33.sl: Dal mu je ime Šiba.  Zato se mesto imenuje Beeršéba  do današnjega dne.
33.en: He called it Shibah.  Therefore the name of the city is Beersheba  to this day.

34.sl: Ko je bil Ezav star štirideset let, je vzel za ženo Jehudíto, hčer Hetejca Beeríja, in Basemáto, hčer Hetejca Elóna.
34.en: When Esau was forty years old, he took as wife Judith, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon the Hittite.

35.sl: Ti dve sta Izaku in Rebeki zagrenili življenje.
35.en: They grieved Isaac and Rebekah’s spirits.

1.sl: Izak se je postaral in oči so mu opešale, da ni mogel videti. Poklical je starejšega sina Ezava in mu rekel: »Moj sin!« Ta mu je rekel: »Tukaj sem.«
1.en:
It happened, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said to him, “My son?”
 He said to him, “Here I am.”

2.sl: Rekel je: »Glej, postaral sem se in ne vem, kdaj pride dan moje smrti.
2.en: He said, “See now, I am old. I don’t know the day of my death.

3.sl: Vzemi zdaj svojo pripravo, tulec in lok, pojdi na polje in ulôvi zame kako divjad!
3.en: Now therefore, please take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison.

4.sl: Potem mi pripravi okusno jed, kakršno imam rad, in mi jo prinesi, da bom jedel. Zato, da te moja duša blagoslovi, preden umrem.«
4.en: Make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat, and that my soul may bless you before I die.”

5.sl: Rebeka pa je poslušala, kaj je Izak govoril sinu Ezavu. Ezav je odšel na polje, da bi ulovil in prinesel plen.
5.en: Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son. Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.

6.sl: Rebeka pa je rekla sinu Jakobu: »Slišala sem, kaj je oče govoril tvojemu bratu Ezavu. Rekel je:
6.en: Rebekah spoke to Jacob her son, saying, “Behold, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying,

7.sl: ›Prinesi mi plen in mi pripravi okusno jed, da bom jedel in te blagoslovil pred Gospodom, preden umrem.‹
7.en: ‘Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless you before Yahweh before my death.’

8.sl: Zdaj pa, moj sin, poslušaj moj glas, kaj ti zapovem!
8.en: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command you.

9.sl: Pojdi k čredi in vzemi od tam dva lepa kozlička, da ju pripravim za okusno jed, kakršno ima tvoj oče rad!
9.en: Go now to the flock, and get me from there two good kids of the goats. I will make them savory food for your father, such as he loves.

10.sl: Potem jo boš odnesel očetu, da bo jedel in te blagoslovil, preden umre.«
10.en: You shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, so that he may bless you before his death.”

11.sl: Jakob je rekel materi Rebeki: »Glej, moj brat Ezav je kosmat človek, jaz pa sem gladek.
11.en: Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, “Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.

12.sl: Morda me oče potipa. Menil bo, da se norčujem iz njega, in namesto blagoslova si bom nakopal prekletstvo.«
12.en: What if my father touches me? I will seem to him as a deceiver, and I would bring a curse on myself, and not a blessing.”

13.sl: Mati mu je rekla: »Tvoje prekletstvo naj pride name, moj sin! Le poslušaj moj glas, pojdi in mi prinesi!«
13.en: His mother said to him, “Let your curse be on me, my son. Only obey my voice, and go get them for me.”

14.sl: Šel je, vzel in prinesel materi. In mati je pripravila okusno jed, kakršno je imel oče rad.
14.en: He went, and got them, and brought them to his mother. His mother made savory food, such as his father loved.

15.sl: Nato je Rebeka vzela najboljšo obleko svojega starejšega sina Ezava, ki jo je imela pri sebi v hiši, in jo nadela svojemu mlajšemu sinu Jakobu.
15.en: Rebekah took the good clothes of Esau, her elder son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob, her younger son.

16.sl: Koži kozličkov pa mu je ovila okoli rok in okoli gladkega vratu.
16.en: She put the skins of the kids of the goats on his hands, and on the smooth of his neck.

17.sl: In dala je okusno jed in kruh, ki ga je pripravila, v roke svojemu sinu Jakobu.
17.en: She gave the savory food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.

18.sl: Ko je prišel k očetu, je rekel: »Moj oče!« Ta je rekel: »Tukaj sem. Kdo si ti, moj sin?«
18.en:
He came to his father, and said, “My father?”
 He said, “Here I am. Who are you, my son?”

19.sl: Jakob je rekel očetu: »Ezav sem, tvoj prvorojenec. Storil sem, kakor si mi ukazal. Vstani, sédi in jej od mojega plena, da me tvoja duša blagoslovi!«
19.en: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau your firstborn. I have done what you asked me to do. Please arise, sit and eat of my venison, that your soul may bless me.”

20.sl: Izak je rekel sinu: »Kako to, da si ga našel tako hitro, moj sin?« Pa je rekel: »Gospod mi ga je poslal naproti.«
20.en:
Isaac said to his son, “How is it that you have found it so quickly, my son?”
 He said, “Because Yahweh your God gave me success.”

21.sl: Izak je rekel Jakobu: »Stopi bliže, da te potipam, moj sin, ali si ti moj sin Ezav ali ne!«
21.en: Isaac said to Jacob, “Please come near, that I may feel you, my son, whether you are really my son Esau or not.”

22.sl: Jakob se je približal očetu Izaku in ta ga je potipal in rekel: »Glas je Jakobov glas, toda roki sta Ezavovi roki.«
22.en: Jacob went near to Isaac his father. He felt him, and said, “The voice is Jacob’s voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.”

23.sl: Tako ga ni spoznal, ker je imel roki poraščeni kakor njegov brat Ezav. Potem ga je blagoslovil.
23.en: He didn’t recognize him, because his hands were hairy, like his brother, Esau’s hands. So he blessed him.

24.sl: Rekel je: »Si ti moj sin Ezav?« Rekel je: »Sem.«
24.en:
He said, “Are you really my son Esau?”
 He said, “I am.”

25.sl: Potem je rekel: »Daj mi bliže, da bom jedel od plena svojega sina in te moja duša blagoslovi!« Postavil je jed predenj in on je jedel. Prinesel mu je vina in je pil.
25.en:
He said, “Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son’s venison, that my soul may bless you.”
 He brought it near to him, and he ate. He brought him wine, and he drank.

26.sl: Potem mu je oče Izak rekel: »Stopi sem in me poljubi, moj sin!«
26.en: His father Isaac said to him, “Come near now, and kiss me, my son.”

27.sl:
Stopil je k njemu in ga poljubil. Tedaj je začutil vonj njegove obleke. Blagoslovil ga je, rekoč:
 »Glej, vonj mojega sina je kakor vonj polja,
 ki ga Gospod blagoslavlja.
27.en:
He came near, and kissed him. He smelled the smell of his clothing, and blessed him, and said,
 “Behold, the smell of my son
 Is as the smell of a field which Yahweh has blessed.

28.sl:
Bog ti daj rose neba
 in rodovitno zemljo
 in obilico žita in vina!
28.en:
God give you of the dew of the sky,
 of the fatness of the earth,
 and plenty of grain and new wine.

29.sl:
Naj ti služijo ljudstva
 in se ti priklanjajo rodovi!
 Zagospoduj svojim bratom
 in priklanjajo naj se ti sinovi tvoje matere!
 Preklet naj bo, kdor te preklinja,
 in blagoslovljen, kdor te blagoslavlja!«
29.en:
Let peoples serve you,
 Nations bow down to you.
 Be lord over your brothers,
 Let your mother’s sons bow down to you.
 Cursed be everyone who curses you,
 Blessed be everyone who blesses you.”

30.sl: Ko pa je Izak sklenil svoj blagoslov nad Jakobom in je Jakob komaj odšel izpred obličja očeta Izaka, se je njegov brat Ezav vrnil z lova.
30.en: It happened, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob had just gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.

31.sl: Tudi on je pripravil okusno jed in jo prinesel očetu. Rekel je: »Vstani, moj oče, in jej od plena svojega sina, da me tvoja duša blagoslovi!«
31.en: He also made savory food, and brought it to his father. He said to his father, “Let my father arise, and eat of his son’s venison, that your soul may bless me.”

32.sl: Oče Izak pa mu je rekel: »Kdo si?« Rekel je: »Tvoj prvorojeni sin Ezav sem.«
32.en:
Isaac his father said to him, “Who are you?”
 He said, “I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.”

33.sl: Izak se je tedaj na moč prestrašil in rekel: »Kdo pa je potem oni, ki mi je ulovil in prinesel plen, da sem jedel od vsega, preden si prišel ti? Blagoslovil sem ga in ostal bo blagoslovljen!«
33.en: Isaac trembled violently, and said, “Who, then, is he who has taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before you came, and have blessed him? Yes, he will be blessed.”

34.sl: Ko je Ezav slišal očetove besede, je glasno in bridko zajokal in rekel očetu: »Blagoslovi tudi mene, oče!«
34.en: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said to his father, “Bless me, even me also, my father.”

35.sl: Rekel je: »Tvoj brat je prišel s prevaro in vzel tvoj blagoslov.«
35.en: He said, “Your brother came with deceit, and has taken away your blessing.”

36.sl: Ezav je rekel: »Mar mu je zato ime Jakob,  ker me je dvakrat ogoljufal? Vzel mi je pravico prvorojenstva, zdaj pa mi je vzel še blagoslov.« Rekel je: »Ali nisi prihranil nobenega blagoslova zame?«
36.en: He said, “Isn’t he rightly named Jacob? For he has supplanted me these two times. He took away my birthright. See, now he has taken away my blessing.” He said, “Haven’t you reserved a blessing for me?”

37.sl: Izak je odgovoril in rekel Ezavu: »Glej, za gospodarja sem ga postavil tebi in vse njegove brate sem mu dal za služabnike. Z žitom in vinom sem ga oskrbel; kaj pa naj storim zate, moj sin?«
37.en: Isaac answered Esau, “Behold, I have made him your lord, and all his brothers have I given to him for servants. With grain and new wine have I sustained him. What then will I do for you, my son?”

38.sl: Ezav je rekel očetu: »Ali imaš samo en blagoslov, moj oče? Blagoslovi tudi mene, oče!« Ezav je glasno zajokal.
38.en: Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, my father.” Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.

39.sl:
Oče Izak je odgovoril in mu rekel:
 »Glej, daleč od plodne zemlje bo tvoje bivališče
 in daleč od rose neba od zgoraj.
39.en:
Isaac his father answered him,
 “Behold, of the fatness of the earth will be your dwelling,
 and of the dew of the sky from above.

40.sl:
Z mečem se boš preživljal
 in bratu boš služil;
 ko pa se boš stresel,
 boš zlomil njegov jarem z vratu.«
40.en:
By your sword will you live, and you will serve your brother.
 It will happen, when you will break loose,
 That you shall shake his yoke from off your neck.”

41.sl: Ezav je zasovražil Jakoba zaradi blagoslova, s katerim ga je blagoslovil njegov oče. Sam pri sebi je govoril: »Bližajo se dnevi žalovanja za očetom; potem brata Jakoba ubijem.«
41.en: Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him. Esau said in his heart, “The days of mourning for my father are at hand. Then I will kill my brother Jacob.”

42.sl: Rebeki so sporočili besede starejšega sina Ezava. Dala je poklicati mlajšega sina Jakoba in mu rekla: »Glej, tvoj brat Ezav se hoče maščevati nad teboj in te ubiti.
42.en: The words of Esau, her elder son, were told to Rebekah. She sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, “Behold, your brother Esau comforts himself about you by planning to kill you.

43.sl: Zdaj pa, moj sin, poslušaj moj glas! Odpravi se in zbéži k mojemu bratu Labánu v Harán!
43.en: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice. Arise, flee to Laban, my brother, in Haran.

44.sl: Ostani pri njem nekaj časa, dokler se bratov srd ne poleže,
44.en: Stay with him a few days, until your brother’s fury turns away;

45.sl: dokler se njegova jeza do tebe ne odvrne od tebe in ne pozabi, kaj si mu storil. Tedaj bom poslala pote in te vzela od tam. Zakaj naj bi vaju oba izgubila isti dan?«
45.en: until your brother’s anger turn away from you, and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will send, and get you from there. Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?”

46.sl: Rebeka je rekla Izaku: »Zaradi Hetovih hčera mi je zoprno živeti. Če si še Jakob vzame za ženo katero izmed Hetovih hčera, kakor sta oni dve, izmed hčera te dežele, čemu naj še živim?«
46.en: Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob takes a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these, of the daughters of the land, what good will my life do me?”

1.sl: Izak je tedaj poklical Jakoba, ga blagoslovil in mu zapovedal: »Ne jemlji si žene izmed Kánaanovih hčera!
1.en: Isaac called Jacob, blessed him, and commanded him, “You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

2.sl: Odpravi se na pot in pojdi v Mezopotamijo, v hišo Betuéla, očeta tvoje matere, in od tam si vzemi ženo, izmed hčera materinega brata Labána!
2.en: Arise, go to Paddan Aram, to the house of Bethuel your mother’s father. Take a wife from there from the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.

3.sl: Bog Mogočni naj te blagoslovi, naj te stori rodovitnega in te namnoži, da bo iz tebe nastalo občestvo ljudstev!
3.en: May God Almighty bless you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, that you may be a company of peoples,

4.sl: Naj ti dá Abrahamov blagoslov, tebi in tvojim potomcem za teboj, da vzameš v last deželo svojega tujčevanja, ki jo je Bog dal Abrahamu!«
4.en: and give you the blessing of Abraham, to you, and to your seed with you, that you may inherit the land where you travel, which God gave to Abraham.”

5.sl: Tako je Izak poslal Jakoba od doma. In šel je v Mezopotamijo k Labánu, sinu Aramejca Betuéla, bratu Jakobove in Ezavove matere Rebeke.
5.en: Isaac sent Jacob away. He went to Paddan Aram to Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, Rebekah’s brother, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.

6.sl: Ezav je izvedel, kako je Izak blagoslovil Jakoba in ga odposlal v Mezopotamijo, da bi si od tam vzel ženo, in kako mu je pri blagoslovu zapovedal in rekel: »Ne jemlji si žene izmed kánaanskih hčera!«
6.en: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan Aram, to take him a wife from there, and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, “You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan,”

7.sl: In še, da je Jakob poslušal očeta in mater ter odšel v Mezopotamijo.
7.en: and that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Paddan Aram.

8.sl: Tako je Ezav spoznal, da njegov oče ne vidi rad kánaanskih hčera.
8.en: Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan didn’t please Isaac, his father.

9.sl: Šel je torej k Izmaelu in si vzel k svojima ženama za ženo še Mahaláto, hčer Abrahamovega sina Izmaela, Nebajótovo sestro.
9.en: Esau went to Ishmael, and took, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife.

10.sl: Jakob je odšel iz Beeršébe in potoval proti Haránu.
10.en: Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.

11.sl: Dospel je do nekega kraja, in ker je sonce že zašlo, je tam prenočil. Vzel je enega od kamnov tistega kraja, si ga položil za vzglavje in zaspal na tistem mestu.
11.en: He came to a certain place, and stayed there all night, because the sun had set. He took one of the stones of the place, and put it under his head, and lay down in that place to sleep.

12.sl: V sanjah so se mu prikazale stopnice,  ki so bile postavljene na zemljo, vrh pa jim je segal do neba. In po njih so Božji angeli hodili gor in dol.
12.en: He dreamed. Behold, a stairway set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven. Behold, the angels of God ascending and descending on it.

13.sl: In glej, Gospod je stal zgoraj in rekel: »Jaz sem Gospod, Bog tvojega očeta Abrahama in Izakov Bog. Zemljo, na kateri ležiš, bom dal tebi in tvojim potomcem.
13.en: Behold, Yahweh stood above it, and said, “I am Yahweh, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The land whereon you lie, to you will I give it, and to your seed.

14.sl: Tvojih potomcev bo kakor prahu zemlje. Razširil se boš proti zahodu in vzhodu, proti severu in jugu, in v tebi in tvojem potomstvu bodo blagoslovljeni  vsi rodovi zemlje.
14.en: Your seed will be as the dust of the earth, and you will spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south. In you and in your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed.

15.sl: Glej, jaz bom s teboj in varoval te bom, kjer koli boš hodil, in pripeljal te bom nazaj v to deželo. Zares te ne bom zapustil, dokler ne storim, kar sem ti obljubil.«
15.en: Behold, I am with you, and will keep you, wherever you go, and will bring you again into this land. For I will not leave you, until I have done that which I have spoken of to you.”

16.sl: Ko se je Jakob prebudil, je rekel: »Zares, Gospod je na tem kraju, pa nisem vedel.«
16.en: Jacob awakened out of his sleep, and he said, “Surely Yahweh is in this place, and I didn’t know it.”

17.sl: Prevzel ga je strah in je rekel: »Kako strah vzbujajoč je ta kraj! To ni nič drugega kakor hiša Božja in vrata nebeška!«
17.en: He was afraid, and said, “How dreadful is this place! This is none other than God’s house, and this is the gate of heaven.”

18.sl: Zjutraj je Jakob zgodaj vstal, vzel kamen, ki ga je imel za vzglavje, in ga postavil za spomenik ter na vrh izlil olje.
18.en: Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put under his head, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil on the top of it.

19.sl: Ta kraj je imenoval Betel,  prej pa se je mesto imenovalo Luz.
19.en: He called the name of that place Bethel, but the name of the city was Luz at the first.

20.sl: Potem se je Jakob zaobljubil in rekel: »Če bo Bog z menoj in me bo varoval na poti, po kateri hodim, če mi bo dajal kruha, da ga bom jedel, in obleko, da se bom oblačil,
20.en: Jacob vowed a vow, saying, “If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and clothing to put on,

21.sl: in če se bom srečno vrnil v očetovo hišo, bo Gospod moj Bog.
21.en: so that I come again to my father’s house in peace, and Yahweh will be my God,

22.sl: Ta kamen pa, ki sem ga postavil za spomenik, bo Božja hiša. In od vsega, kar mi boš dal, ti bom zagotovo dajal desetino.«
22.en: then this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, will be God’s house. Of all that you will give me I will surely give the tenth to you.”

1.sl: Jakob je vzdignil svoje noge in šel v deželo sinov vzhoda.
1.en: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the children of the east.

2.sl: Pogledal je in zagledal vodnjak na polju. Pri njem so počivale tri črede drobnice, kajti iz tega vodnjaka so napajali črede. Odprtina pri vodnjaku pa je bila pokrita z velikim kamnom.
2.en: He looked, and behold, a well in the field, and, behold, three flocks of sheep lying there by it. For out of that well they watered the flocks. The stone on the well’s mouth was great.

3.sl: Kadar so se tam zbrale vse črede, so ga odvalili in napojili drobnico. Nato pa so kamen spet zavalili na njegovo mesto nad odprtino.
3.en: There all the flocks were gathered. They rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again on the well’s mouth in its place.

4.sl: Jakob jim je rekel: »Bratje, od kod ste?« Rekli so: »Iz Harána smo.«
4.en:
Jacob said to them, “My relatives, where are you from?”
 They said, “We are from Haran.”

5.sl: Rekel jim je: »Ali poznate Labána, Nahórjevega sina?« Rekli so: »Poznamo.«
5.en:
He said to them, “Do you know Laban, the son of Nahor?”
 They said, “We know him.”

6.sl: Rekel jim je: »Ali se mu dobro godi?« Rekli so: »Dobro. Glej, njegova hči Rahela prihaja z drobnico.«
6.en:
He said to them, “Is it well with him?”
 They said, “It is well. See, Rachel, his daughter, is coming with the sheep.”

7.sl: Rekel je: »Poglejte, dan je še dolg, ni še čas, da bi zbrali živino; napojite drobnico in pojdite past!«
7.en: He said, “Behold, it is still the middle of the day, not time to gather the cattle together. Water the sheep, and go and feed them.”

8.sl: Pa so rekli: »Ne moremo, dokler se ne zberejo vse črede. Potem odvalijo kamen z odprtine vodnjaka in napojimo drobnico.«
8.en: They said, “We can’t, until all the flocks are gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well’s mouth. Then we water the sheep.”

9.sl: Ko je še govoril z njimi, je prišla Rahela z drobnico svojega očeta; bila je namreč pastirica.
9.en: While he was yet speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s sheep, for she kept them.

10.sl: Ko je Jakob videl Rahelo, hčer materinega brata Labána, in drobnico materinega brata Labána, je pristopil in odvalil kamen z odprtine vodnjaka in napojil drobnico materinega brata Labána.
10.en: It happened, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban, his mother’s brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother’s brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well’s mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother’s brother.

11.sl: Potem je Jakob poljubil Rahelo in na glas zajokal.
11.en: Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.

12.sl: In Jakob je povedal Raheli, da je brat  njenega očeta in Rebekin sin. Tekla je to povedat očetu.
12.en: Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s brother, and that he was Rebekah’s son. She ran and told her father.

13.sl: Ko je Labán slišal sporočilo o sestrinem sinu Jakobu, mu je tekel naproti, ga objel in poljubil ter ga popeljal v svojo hišo. Potem je Labánu povedal vse, kar se je zgodilo.
13.en: It happened, when Laban heard the news of Jacob, his sister’s son, that he ran to meet Jacob, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. Jacob told Laban all these things.

14.sl: Labán mu je rekel: »Zares si moja kost in moje meso!« In Jakob je ostal pri njem mesec dni.
14.en: Laban said to him, Surely you are my bone and my flesh. He lived with him for a month.

15.sl: Potem je Labán rekel Jakobu: »Mar mi boš zato, ker si moj brat, zastonj služil? Povej mi, kakšno plačilo hočeš!«
15.en: Laban said to Jacob, “Because you are my brother, should you therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what will your wages be?”

16.sl: Labán pa je imel dve hčeri: starejši je bilo ime Lea, mlajši pa Rahela.
16.en: Laban had two daughters. The name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.

17.sl: Leine oči so bile motne, Rahela pa je imela lepo postavo in lep obraz.
17.en: Leah’s eyes were weak, but Rachel was beautiful and well favored.

18.sl: Ker je Jakob ljubil Rahelo, je rekel Labánu: »Služil ti bom sedem let za tvojo mlajšo hčer Rahelo.«
18.en: Jacob loved Rachel. He said, “I will serve you seven years for Rachel, your younger daughter.”

19.sl: Labán je rekel: »Boljše je, da jo dam tebi, kakor da bi jo dal komu drugemu. Ostani pri meni!«
19.en: Laban said, “It is better that I give her to you, than that I should give her to another man. Stay with me.”

20.sl: Jakob je služil za Rahelo sedem let, toda ker jo je ljubil, so se mu zdela kakor nekaj dni.
20.en: Jacob served seven years for Rachel. They seemed to him but a few days, for the love he had for her.

21.sl: Tedaj je rekel Labánu: »Daj mi mojo ženo, da grem k njej! Kajti čas je potekel.«
21.en: Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her.”

22.sl: Labán je zbral vse može iz kraja in napravil svatbo.
22.en: Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.

23.sl: Zvečer pa je vzel hčer Leo in jo pripeljal k njemu, da je šel k njej. –
23.en: It happened in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him. He went in to her.

24.sl: Labán je dal hčeri Lei svojo deklo Zilpo za deklo. –
24.en: Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid to his daughter Leah for a handmaid.

25.sl: Zjutraj pa, glej, je bila tam Lea! Tedaj je Jakob rekel Labánu: »Kaj si mi vendar storil! Ali ti nisem služil za Rahelo? Zakaj si me prevaral?«
25.en: It happened in the morning that, behold, it was Leah. He said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? Didn’t I serve with you for Rachel? Why then have you deceived me?”

26.sl: Labán je rekel: »V našem kraju ni navada, da bi mlajšo hčer oddajali pred starejšo.
26.en: Laban said, “It is not done so in our place, to give the younger before the first born.

27.sl: Dokončaj teden s to, potem ti dam še ono, zanjo pa mi boš služil še drugih sedem let.«
27.en: Fulfill the week of this one, and we will give you the other also for the service which you will serve with me yet seven other years.”

28.sl: Jakob je storil tako; dokončal je teden z Leo. Nato mu je Labán dal hčer Rahelo za ženo. –
28.en: Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week. He gave him Rachel his daughter as wife.

29.sl: Tej je dal svojo deklo Bilho za deklo. –
29.en: Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah, his handmaid, to be her handmaid.

30.sl: Jakob je šel tudi k Raheli in je bolj ljubil Rahelo kakor Leo. In služil mu je še drugih sedem let.
30.en: He went in also to Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.

31.sl: Ko je Gospod videl, da je Lea zapostavljena, ji je odprl naročje,  Rahela pa je ostala nerodovitna.
31.en: Yahweh saw that Leah was hated, and he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.

32.sl: Lea je spočela in rodila sina. Dala mu je ime Ruben;  rekla je namreč: »Gospod se je ozrl na mojo bedo. Zdaj me bo mož ljubil.«
32.en: Leah conceived, and bore a son, and she named him Reuben. For she said, “Because Yahweh has looked at my affliction. For now my husband will love me.”

33.sl: Spet je spočela in rodila sina. Rekla je: »Gospod je slišal,  da sem zapostavljena, in mi je dal še tega.« Dala mu je ime Simeon.
33.en: She conceived again, and bare a son, and said, “Because Yahweh has heard that I am hated, he has therefore given me this son also.” She named him Simeon.

34.sl: In spet je spočela in rodila sina. Rekla je: »Zdaj se bo mož vendar držal  mene, saj sem mu rodila tri sinove.« Zato mu je dala ime Levi.
34.en: She conceived again, and bare a son. Said, “Now this time will my husband be joined to me, because I have borne him three sons.” Therefore was his name called Levi.

35.sl: Spet je spočela in rodila sina. Rekla je: »Tokrat bom hvalila  Gospoda.« Zato mu je dala ime Juda. Potem ni več rodila.
35.en: She conceived again, and bare a son. She said, “This time will I praise Yahweh.” Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.

1.sl: Rahela je videla, da Jakobu ne rojeva otrok. Zato je bila ljubosumna na sestro. Rekla je Jakobu: »Daj mi otrók, sicer bom umrla!«
1.en: When Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister. She said to Jacob, “Give me children, or else I will die.”

2.sl: Jakob se je razjezil na Rahelo in rekel: »Sem mar jaz namesto Boga, ki ti je odrekel telesni sad?«
2.en: Jacob’s anger was kindled against Rachel, and he said, “Am I in God’s place, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?”

3.sl: Pa je rekla: »Tu je moja dekla Bilha, pojdi k njej, da bo rodila na mojih kolenih in bom po njej tudi jaz prišla do otrok.«
3.en: She said, “Behold, my maid Bilhah. Go in to her, that she may bear on my knees, and I also may obtain children by her.”

4.sl: Dala mu je torej svojo deklo Bilho za ženo in Jakob je šel k njej.
4.en: She gave him Bilhah her handmaid as wife, and Jacob went in to her.

5.sl: Bilha je spočela in rodila Jakobu sina.
5.en: Bilhah conceived, and bore Jacob a son.

6.sl: Rahela je rekla: »Bog mi je prisodil pravico in tudi uslišal mojo prošnjo; dal mi je sina.« Zato mu je dala ime Dan.
6.en: Rachel said, “God has judged me, and has also heard my voice, and has given me a son.” Therefore called she his name Dan.

7.sl: Rahelina dekla Bilha pa je spet spočela in rodila Jakobu drugega sina.
7.en: Bilhah, Rachel’s handmaid, conceived again, and bore Jacob a second son.

8.sl: Rahela je rekla: »Božje boje  sem bojevala  s sestro in sem tudi zmagala.« Dala mu je ime Neftáli.
8.en: Rachel said, “With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have prevailed.” She named him Naphtali.

9.sl: Ko pa je Lea spoznala, da ne bo več rodila, je vzela svojo deklo Zilpo in jo dala Jakobu za ženo.
9.en: When Leah saw that she had finished bearing, she took Zilpah, her handmaid, and gave her to Jacob as a wife.

10.sl: Zilpa je Jakobu rodila sina.
10.en: Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid, bore Jacob a son.

11.sl: Lea pa je rekla: »Srečno!« Dala mu je ime Gad.
11.en: Leah said, “How fortunate!” She named him Gad.

12.sl: Leina dekla Zilpa je rodila Jakobu še drugega sina.
12.en: Zilpah, Leah’s handmaid, bore Jacob a second son.

13.sl: Lea je rekla: »Blagor meni, kajti žene me bodo blagrovale!« In dala mu je ime Aser.
13.en: Leah said, “Happy am I, for the daughters will call me happy.” She named him Asher.

14.sl: Ko je šel Ruben v času pšenične žetve na polje, je našel nadliščke. Nesel jih je svoji materi Lei. Rahela pa je rekla Lei: »Daj mi nekaj nadliščkov svojega sina!«
14.en: Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother, Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”

15.sl: Pa ji je rekla: »Ti mar ni zadosti, da si mi vzela moža, da mi hočeš vzeti še sinove nadliščke?« Rahela je rekla: »Prav, pa naj nocoj leži s teboj za nadliščke tvojega sina!«
15.en:
She said to her, “Is it a small matter that you have taken away my husband? Would you take away my son’s mandrakes, also?”
 Rachel said, “Therefore he will lie with you tonight for your son’s mandrakes.”

16.sl: Ko se je Jakob zvečer vračal s polja, mu je šla Lea naproti in rekla: »K meni pojdeš, kajti plačala sem zate z nadliščki svojega sina!« Ležal je torej tisto noč z njo.
16.en:
Jacob came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, “You must come in to me; for I have surely hired you with my son’s mandrakes.”
 He lay with her that night.

17.sl: Bog je Leo uslišal; spočela je in rodila Jakobu petega sina.
17.en: God listened to Leah, and she conceived, and bore Jacob a fifth son.

18.sl: In Lea je rekla: »Bog mi je dal plačilo,  ker sem dala svojo deklo možu.« In dala mu je ime Isahár.
18.en: Leah said, “God has given me my hire, because I gave my handmaid to my husband.” She named him Issachar.

19.sl: Potem je Lea spet spočela in rodila Jakobu šestega sina.
19.en: Leah conceived again, and bore a sixth son to Jacob.

20.sl: In Lea je rekla: »Bog me je obdaril z lepim darilom; zdaj me bo mož povišal,  kajti rodila sem mu šest sinov.« Dala mu je ime Zábulon.
20.en: Leah said, “God has endowed me with a good dowry. Now my husband will live with me, because I have borne him six sons.” She named him Zebulun.

21.sl: Potem je rodila hčer in ji dala ime Dina.
21.en: Afterwards, she bore a daughter, and named her Dinah.

22.sl: Potem se je Bog spomnil Rahele; Bog jo je uslišal in ji odprl naročje.
22.en: God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her, and opened her womb.

23.sl: Spočela je in rodila sina. Rekla je: »Bog mi je odvzel sramoto.«
23.en: She conceived, bore a son, and said, “God has taken away my reproach.”

24.sl: Dala je sinu ime Jožef  in rekla: »Naj mi Gospod doda še drugega sina!«
24.en: She named him Joseph,  saying, “May Yahweh add another son to me.”

25.sl: Potem ko je Rahela rodila Jožefa, je Jakob rekel Labánu: »Odpusti me, da grem v svoj kraj in v svojo deželo!
25.en: It happened, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away, that I may go to my own place, and to my country.

26.sl: Naj vzamem ženi, za kateri sem ti služil, in otroke ter odidem. Saj veš, kako sem ti služil.«
26.en: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go: for you know my service with which I have served you.”

27.sl: Labán pa mu je rekel: »O, da bi našel naklonjenost v tvojih očeh! Iz znamenj sem spoznal, da me je Gospod blagoslovil zaradi tebe.«
27.en: Laban said to him, “If now I have found favor in your eyes, stay here, for I have divined that Yahweh has blessed me for your sake.”

28.sl: Pristavil je še: »Določi si plačilo in ti ga dam!«
28.en: He said, “Appoint me your wages, and I will give it.”

29.sl: Rekel mu je: »Veš, kako sem ti služil in kaj se je zgodilo z živino v moji oskrbi.
29.en: He said to him, “You know how I have served you, and how your cattle have fared with me.

30.sl: Kajti tisto malo, kar si imel pred menoj, je zrastlo in se pomnožilo. Gospod te je blagoslovil za vsak moj korak. Zdaj pa – kdaj bom tudi jaz lahko delal za svojo hišo?«
30.en: For it was little which you had before I came, and it has increased to a multitude. Yahweh has blessed you wherever I turned. Now when will I provide for my own house also?”

31.sl: In je rekel: »Kaj naj ti dam?« Jakob je rekel: »Ničesar ti ni treba dati, le tole mi stôri: naj še naprej pasem in varujem tvojo drobnico!
31.en:
He said, “What shall I give you?”
 Jacob said, “You shall not give me anything. If you will do this thing for me, I will again feed your flock and keep it.

32.sl: Danes bom šel po sredi vse tvoje drobnice in izločil vsa črno pikasta in marogasta jagnjeta in vse črne ovce. Prav tako tudi koze z belimi marogami ali belo pikaste. To naj bo moje plačilo!
32.en: I will pass through all your flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted one, and every black one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats. This will be my hire.

33.sl: Tako naj se izkaže moja pravičnost v prihodnosti, ko boš prišel k meni zaradi mojega plačila: vse, kar ne bo belo pikasto ali marogasto pri kozah in kar ne bo črno pri ovcah, to naj velja pri meni za ukradeno!«
33.en: So my righteousness will answer for me hereafter, when you come concerning my hire that is before you. Everyone that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and black among the sheep, that might be with me, will be counted stolen.”

34.sl: Labán je rekel: »Prav, naj se zgodi, kakor si rekel!«
34.en: Laban said, “Behold, I desire it to be according to your word.”

35.sl: Tisti dan je Labán izločil svetlo progaste in marogaste kozle in vse pikaste in marogaste koze, vse, ki so imele kaj belega na sebi. Prav tako pa tudi vse, kar je imelo kaj črnega pri ovnih. Dal jih je v roke svojim sinovom.
35.en: That day, he removed the male goats that were streaked and spotted, and all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and all the black ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.

36.sl: Določil je razdaljo treh dni hoje med seboj in Jakobom. Ta je namreč pasel preostalo Labánovo drobnico.
36.en: He set three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban’s flocks.

37.sl: Jakob si je vzel muževne šibe belega topola, mandeljnovca in platane in jih olupil tako, da so imele bele proge, ker je odkril belino na šibah.
37.en: Jacob took to himself rods of fresh poplar, almond, plane tree, peeled white streaks in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods.

38.sl: Polagal je šibe, ki jih je obelil, v žlebove, korita, h katerim je prihajala drobnica pit. Mrkala se je namreč, ko je prihajala pit.
38.en: He set the rods which he had peeled opposite the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink. They conceived when they came to drink.

39.sl: Drobnica se je torej parila pred šibami, potem pa povrgla progaste, pikaste in marogaste mladiče.
39.en: The flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted.

40.sl: Jagnjeta je potem Jakob izločal. Postavljal je drobnico tako, da je bila obrnjena proti progam in vsemu, kar je bilo črnega pri Labánovi drobnici. Tako je pripravljal črede zase namesto za Labánovo drobnico.
40.en: Jacob separated the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the streaked and all the black in the flock of Laban: and he put his own droves apart, and didn’t put them into Laban’s flock.

41.sl: Vedno, kadar se je mrkala krepka drobnica, je Jakob položil šibe pred oči drobnice v korita, da bi se parila pred šibami.
41.en: It happened, whenever the stronger of the flock conceived, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the flock in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods;

42.sl: Pri slabotni drobnici pa ni polagal šib, zato so slabotne živali pripadle Labánu, krepke pa Jakobu.
42.en: but when the flock were feeble, he didn’t put them in. So the feebler were Laban’s, and the stronger Jacob’s.

43.sl: Mož je silno obogatel; imel je številno drobnico, dekle in hlapce ter kamele in osle.
43.en: The man increased exceedingly, and had large flocks, maid-servants and men-servants, and camels and donkeys.

1.sl: In slišal je besede Labánovih sinov, ko so rekli: »Jakob je pobral vse očetovo imetje in iz posesti našega očeta si je pripravil vse to bogastvo.«
1.en: He heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, “Jacob has taken away all that was our father’s. From that which was our father’s, has he gotten all this wealth.”

2.sl: Tudi na Labánovem obrazu je Jakob opazil, da ni več tak do njega, kakor je bil dotlej.
2.en: Jacob saw the expression on Laban’s face, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.

3.sl: Gospod je tedaj rekel Jakobu: »Vrni se v deželo svojih očetov, k svoji rodbini! S teboj bom!«
3.en: Yahweh said to Jacob, “Return to the land of your fathers, and to your relatives, and I will be with you.”

4.sl: Jakob je dal poklicati Rahelo in Leo na polje k drobnici.
4.en: Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field to his flock,

5.sl: Rekel jima je: »Na obrazu vajinega očeta vidim, da ni več tak do mene, kakršen je bil doslej, toda Bog mojega očeta je bil z menoj.
5.en: and said to them, “I see the expression on your father’s face, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

6.sl: Vedve vesta, da sem vajinemu očetu služil z vso svojo močjo.
6.en: You know that I have served your father with all of my strength.

7.sl: A vajin oče me je varal in mi desetkrat spremenil plačilo. Toda Bog mu ni pustil, da bi mi škodoval.
7.en: Your father has deceived me, and changed my wages ten times, but God didn’t allow him to hurt me.

8.sl: Če je rekel: ›Pikasta živina bo tvoje plačilo,‹ tedaj je vsa drobnica dobivala pikasta jagnjeta. Če pa je rekel: ›Progasta živina bo tvoje plačilo,‹ je vsa drobnica dobivala progasta jagnjeta.
8.en: If he said this, ‘The speckled will be your wages,’ then all the flock bore speckled. If he said this, ‘The streaked will be your wages,’ then all the flock bore streaked.

9.sl: Tako je Bog vzel živino vajinemu očetu in jo dal meni.
9.en: Thus God has taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.

10.sl: V času, ko se drobnica pari, sem v sanjah povzdignil oči in zagledal progaste, pikaste in marogaste ovne, ki so skakali na ovce.
10.en: It happened at the time that the flock conceive, that I lifted up my eyes, and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats which leaped on the flock were streaked, speckled, and grizzled.

11.sl: In Božji angel mi je rekel v sanjah: ›Jakob!‹ Rekel sem: ›Tukaj sem.‹
11.en: The angel of God said to me in the dream, ‘Jacob,’ and I said, ‘Here I am.’

12.sl: Pa je rekel: ›Povzdigni vendar oči in poglej, da so vsi ovni, ki skačejo na ovce, progasti, pikasti in marogasti; kajti videl sem vse, kar ti je storil Labán.
12.en: He said, ‘Now lift up your eyes, and behold, all the male goats which leap on the flock are streaked, speckled, and grizzled, for I have seen all that Laban does to you.

13.sl: Jaz sem Bog Betela, ki si mu mazilil spomenik in ki si mu izrekel zaobljubo. Vstani zdaj, odidi iz te dežele in se vrni v svojo rojstno deželo!‹«
13.en: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar, where you vowed a vow to me. Now arise, get out from this land, and return to the land of your birth.”

14.sl: Rahela in Lea sta mu odgovorili: »Ali imava še delež in dediščino v očetovi hiši?
14.en: Rachel and Leah answered him, “Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father’s house?

15.sl: Ali nisva zanj kakor tujki? Saj naju je prodal in tudi požrl najin denar.
15.en: Aren’t we accounted by him as foreigners? For he has sold us, and has also quite devoured our money.

16.sl: Zares, vse bogastvo, ki ga je Bog vzel najinemu očetu, pripada nama in najinim otrokom. Stôri zdaj vse, kar ti je rekel Bog!«
16.en: For all the riches which God has taken away from our father, that is ours and our children’s. Now then, whatever God has said to you, do.”

17.sl: Jakob je tedaj vstal in posadil otroke in ženi na kamele.
17.en: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives on the camels,

18.sl: Odgnal je vse govedo in vse imetje, ki si ga je pridobil, govedo in drobnico, kar si je pridobil v Mezopotamiji, da bi šel k očetu Izaku v kánaansko deželo.
18.en: and he carried away all his cattle, and all his substance which he had gathered, the cattle of his getting, which he had gathered in Paddan Aram, to go to Isaac his father to the land of Canaan.

19.sl: Medtem ko je Labán odšel strič drobnico, je Rahela ukradla očetove hišne bogove.
19.en: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim  that were her father’s.

20.sl: Jakob je ukanil Aramejca Labána tako, da mu ni dal slutiti, da hoče zbežati.
20.en: Jacob deceived Laban the Syrian, in that he didn’t tell him that he was running away.

21.sl: Pobegnil je z vsem, kar je imel. Vzdignil se je, prekoračil reko  in se obrnil proti gorovju Gileád.
21.en: So he fled with all that he had. He rose up, passed over the River, and set his face toward the mountain of Gilead.

22.sl: Tretji dan so Labánu povedali, da je Jakob pobegnil.
22.en: Laban was told on the third day that Jacob had fled.

23.sl: Vzel je s seboj brate  in ga zasledoval sedem dni hoda in se mu čisto približal v gorovju Gileád.
23.en: He took his relatives with him, and pursued after him seven days’ journey. He overtook him in the mountain of Gilead.

24.sl: Ponoči pa je k Aramejcu Labánu v sanjah prišel Bog in mu rekel: »Varuj se, da bi Jakobu kar koli očital!«
24.en: God came to Laban, the Syrian, in a dream of the night, and said to him, “Take heed to yourself that you don’t speak to Jacob either good or bad.”

25.sl: Labán je dohitel Jakoba, ko je ta postavil šotor na gori. Tudi Labán se je s svojimi brati  ušotoril v gorovju Gileád.
25.en: Laban caught up with Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mountain, and Laban with his relatives encamped in the mountain of Gilead.

26.sl: Labán je rekel Jakobu: »Kaj si storil! Ukanil si me in odgnal moji hčeri kakor ujetnici meča.
26.en: Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done, that you have deceived me, and carried away my daughters like captives of the sword?

27.sl: Zakaj si skrivaj zbežal in me okradel? Nisi mi povedal, da bi te pospremil z veseljem in pesmimi, z bobnom in s citrami.
27.en: Why did you flee secretly, and deceive me, and didn’t tell me, that I might have sent you away with mirth and with songs, with tambourine and with harp;

28.sl: Nisi mi dal priložnosti, da bi poljubil svoje sinove in hčere. Tokrat si ravnal nespametno.
28.en: and didn’t allow me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Now have you done foolishly.

29.sl: V moji moči je, da bi z vami ravnal hudo, toda Bog vaših očetov mi je sinoči rekel: ›Varuj se, da bi Jakobu kar koli očital!‹
29.en: It is in the power of my hand to hurt you, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, ‘Take heed to yourself that you don’t speak to Jacob either good or bad.’

30.sl: No, ko si že odšel, ker si močno hrepenel po očetovi hiši, zakaj si ukradel moje bogove?«
30.en: Now, you want to be gone, because you sore longed after your father’s house, but why have you stolen my gods?”

31.sl: Jakob je Labánu odgovoril: »Bal sem se in sem si rekel: ›Da mi s silo ne vzame svojih hčera!‹
31.en: Jacob answered Laban, “Because I was afraid, for I said, ‘Lest you should take your daughters from me by force.’

32.sl: Tisti pa, pri komer najdeš svoje bogove, naj ne živi več! Vpričo najinih bratov preišči, kaj je pri meni tvojega, in si vzemi!« Jakob pa ni vedel, da jih je ukradla Rahela.
32.en: With whoever you find your gods, he shall not live. Before our relatives, discern what is yours with me, and take it.” For Jacob didn’t know that Rachel had stolen them.

33.sl: Labán je stopil v Jakobov šotor, nato v Lein šotor in še v šotor obeh dekel in ni našel ničesar. Zapustil je Lein šotor in šel v Rahelinega.
33.en: Laban went into Jacob’s tent, into Leah’s tent, and into the tent of the two maid-servants; but he didn’t find them. He went out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.

34.sl: Rahela pa je prej vzela bogove, jih položila pod kamelino sedlo in sedla nanje. Labán je prebrskal ves šotor, pa ni našel ničesar.
34.en: Now Rachel had taken the teraphim, put them in the camel’s saddle, and sat on them. Laban felt about all the tent, but didn’t find them.

35.sl: Rahela je rekla očetu: »Naj mi gospod ne zameri, ne morem vstati pred tvojim obličjem, ker se mi godi, kakor se dogaja ženskam.« Vse je natančno preiskal, pa ni našel bogov.
35.en: She said to her father, “Don’t let my lord be angry that I can’t rise up before you; for the manner of women is on me.” He searched, but didn’t find the teraphim.

36.sl: Jakob se je močno razsrdil na Labána in se začel prepirati z njim. In Jakob je odgovoril in rekel Labánu: »Kaj je moj prestopek, s čim sem se pregrešil, da me divje zasleduješ?
36.en: Jacob was angry, and argued with Laban. Jacob answered Laban, “What is my trespass? What is my sin, that you have hotly pursued after me?

37.sl: Saj si prebrskal vse moje stvari in kaj si našel, da je iz tvoje hiše? Polôži sem pred moje in svoje brate, pa naj razsodijo med nama!
37.en: Now that you have felt around in all my stuff, what have you found of all your household stuff? Set it here before my relatives and your relatives, that they may judge between us two.

38.sl: Dvajset let sem bil pri tebi; tvoje ovce in tvoje koze niso izvrgle in ovnov tvoje črede nisem jedel.
38.en: These twenty years have I been with you. Your ewes and your female goats have not cast their young, and I haven’t eaten the rams of your flocks.

39.sl: Raztrganih živali ti nisem prinašal, sam sem trpel škodo. Zahteval si jih iz mojih rok, naj jih je kdo ukradel podnevi ali ponoči.
39.en: That which was torn of animals, I didn’t bring to you. I bore the loss of it. Of my hand you required it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night.

40.sl: Podnevi me je morila vročina, ponoči mraz in spanec mi je bežal iz oči.
40.en: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep fled from my eyes.

41.sl: Dvajset let sem bil v tvoji hiši; štirinajst let sem ti služil za tvoji hčeri in šest let za tvojo drobnico. Ti pa si mi desetkrat spremenil plačilo.
41.en: These twenty years have I been in your house. I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times.

42.sl: Ko ne bi bil z menoj Bog mojega očeta, Abrahamov Bog in Izakov Strah,  bi me ti zdaj odpravil praznih rok. Toda Bog je videl mojo bedo in trud mojih rok; v pretekli noči je razsodil.«
42.en: Unless the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely now you would have sent me away empty. God has seen my affliction and the labor of my hands, and rebuked you last night.”

43.sl: Labán je odgovoril in rekel Jakobu: »Hčeri sta moji, sinovi so moji in drobnica je moja; vse, kar vidiš, je moja last. Toda kaj naj danes storim tema hčerama ali otrokom, ki sta jih rodili?
43.en: Laban answered Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine: and what can I do this day to these my daughters, or to their children whom they have borne?

44.sl: Zdaj dajva, skleniva zavezo: jaz in ti, naj bo nekaj za pričo med nama!«
44.en: Now come, let us make a covenant, you and I; and let it be for a witness between me and you.”

45.sl: Jakob je vzel kamen in ga postavil pokonci za spomenik.
45.en: Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.

46.sl: Nato je Jakob rekel bratom: »Naberite kamenja!« Vzeli so kamne in napravili kup. Potem so tam na kupu jedli.
46.en: Jacob said to his relatives, “Gather stones.” They took stones, and made a heap. They ate there by the heap.

47.sl: Labán ga je imenoval Jegár Sahadutá,  Jakob pa Galéd.
47.en: Laban called it Jegar Sahadutha,  but Jacob called it Galeed.

48.sl: Labán je rekel: »Ta kup naj bo danes priča med menoj in teboj!« Zato ga je imenoval Galéd
48.en: Laban said, “This heap is witness between me and you this day.” Therefore it was named Galeed

49.sl: in Micpa,  ker je rekel: »Naj Gospod straži med menoj in teboj, ko ne bova več vedela drug za drugega.
49.en: and Mizpah, for he said, “Yahweh watch between me and you, when we are absent one from another.

50.sl: Če boš grdo ravnal z mojima hčerama in če boš vzel zraven njiju še druge žene, vedi, četudi ni človeka pri naju, da je Bog priča med menoj in teboj!«
50.en: If you will afflict my daughters, and if you will take wives besides my daughters, no man is with us; behold, God is witness between me and you.”

51.sl: In Labán je rekel Jakobu: »Poglej ta kup in poglej ta spomenik, ki sem ga postavil med menoj in teboj!
51.en: Laban said to Jacob, “See this heap, and see the pillar, which I have set between me and you.

52.sl: Priča naj bo ta kup in priča ta spomenik: jaz ne bom šel nikoli prek tega kupa na tvojo stran in ti ne smeš s slabim namenom prek tega kupa na mojo stran in mimo tega spomenika.
52.en: May this heap be a witness, and the pillar be a witness, that I will not pass over this heap to you, and that you will not pass over this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.

53.sl: Bog Abrahamov in Bog Nahórjev« – Bog njunega očeta – »naj sodi med nama!« In Jakob je prisegel pri Strahu  svojega očeta Izaka.
53.en: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us.” Then Jacob swore by the fear of his father, Isaac.

54.sl: Na gori je Jakob daroval daritev, potem pa je povabil brate, da bi jedli kruh. Jedli so kruh in prenočili na gori.
54.en: Jacob offered a sacrifice in the mountain, and called his relatives to eat bread. They ate bread, and stayed all night in the mountain.

1.sl: Jakob je vzdignil oči in zagledal Ezava, ki je prihajal, in z njim štiristo mož. Razdelil je otroke med Leo, Rahelo in dekli.
1.en: Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. He divided the children between Leah, Rachel, and to the two handmaids.

2.sl: Spredaj je postavil dekli in njune otroke, za njimi Leo in njene otroke, nazadnje pa Rahelo in Jožefa.
2.en: He put the handmaids and their children in front, Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph at the rear.

3.sl: Sam je šel pred njimi in se sedemkrat priklonil do tal, dokler se ni približal svojemu bratu.
3.en: He himself passed over in front of them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.

4.sl: Ezav mu je pritekel naproti, ga objel, mu padel okoli vratu, ga poljubil in zajokala sta.
4.en: Esau ran to meet him, embraced him, fell on his neck, kissed him, and they wept.

5.sl: Povzdignil je oči in opazil ženske in otroke in rekel: »Kdo so tile pri tebi?« Rekel je: »Otroci, ki jih je Bog naklonil tvojemu služabniku.«
5.en:
He lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, “Who are these with you?”
 He said, “The children whom God has graciously given your servant.”

6.sl: Pristopili sta dekli s svojimi otroki in priklonili so se.
6.en: Then the handmaids came near with their children, and they bowed themselves.

7.sl: Nato je pristopila Lea s svojimi otroki in priklonili so se. Za njimi sta pristopila Jožef in Rahela in se priklonila.
7.en: Leah also and her children came near, and bowed themselves. After them, Joseph came near with Rachel, and they bowed themselves.

8.sl: Ezav je rekel: »Kaj hočeš z vso to vojsko, ki sem jo srečal?« Rekel je: »Hotel sem najti naklonjenost v očeh svojega gospoda.«
8.en:
Esau said, “What do you mean by all this company which I met?”
 Jacob said, “To find favor in the sight of my lord.”

9.sl: Ezav pa je rekel: »Zadosti imam, brat moj, naj bo tvoje, kar imaš!«
9.en: Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; let that which you have be yours.”

10.sl: A Jakob je rekel: »Nikar, prosim! Če sem našel naklonjenost v tvojih očeh, potem vzemi darilo iz moje roke. Gledal sem namreč tvoj obraz kakor človek gleda Božje obličje, tako prijazno si me sprejel.
10.en: Jacob said, “Please, no, if I have now found favor in your sight, then receive my present at my hand, because I have seen your face, as one sees the face of God, and you were pleased with me.

11.sl: Vzemi, prosim, moj dar, ki so ti ga pripeljali! Kajti Bog me je obdaril in vsega imam zadosti!« Tako dolgo ga je silil, da je sprejel.
11.en: Please take the gift that I brought to you; because God has dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough.” He urged him, and he took it.

12.sl: Potem je Ezav rekel: »Odpraviva se in pojdiva naprej! Potoval bom ob tebi.«
12.en: Esau said, “Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before you.”

13.sl: Pa mu je rekel: »Moj gospod ve, da so otroci nežni in da imam na skrbi doječe živali pri drobnici in pri govedu; če jih preveč ženemo le en dan, bo poginila vsa drobnica.
13.en: Jacob said to him, “My lord knows that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds with me have their young, and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die.

14.sl: Naj gre, prosim, moj gospod pred svojim služabnikom, jaz pa bom šel počasi, kakor bo hodila živina, ki je pred menoj, in kakor bodo hodili otroci, dokler ne pridem k svojemu gospodu v Seír.«
14.en: Please let my lord pass over before his servant: and I will lead on gently, according to the pace of the cattle that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come to my lord to Seir.”

15.sl: Ezav je rekel: »Potem pa mi dovôli, da pustim pri tebi nekaj svojih ljudi!« Jakob je rekel: »Le čemu? Samó da sem našel naklonjenost v očeh svojega gospoda.«
15.en:
Esau said, “Let me now leave with you some of the folk who are with me.”
 He said, “Why? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord.”

16.sl: In Ezav se je tisti dan vrnil po svoji poti v Seír.
16.en: So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir.

17.sl: Jakob pa se je odpravil v Sukót in si postavil hišo, za svojo živino pa je naredil kolibe; zato se kraj imenuje Sukót.
17.en: Jacob traveled to Succoth, built himself a house, and made shelters for his cattle. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.

18.sl: Jakob je iz Mezopotamije zdrav prišel do mesta Sihema v kánaanski deželi in se ušotoril pred mestom.
18.en: Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan Aram; and encamped before the city.

19.sl: Od sinov Hamórja, Sihemovega očeta, je za sto cekinov kupil kos polja in si tam razpel šotor.
19.en: He bought the parcel of ground, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for one hundred pieces of money.

20.sl: Tam je postavil tudi oltar in ga imenoval El,  Izraelov Bog.
20.en: He erected an altar there, and called it El Elohe Israel.

1.sl: Dina, hči, ki jo je Lea rodila Jakobu, je šla gledat hčere dežele.
1.en: Dinah, the daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

2.sl: Videl pa jo je Sihem, sin Hivéjca Hamórja, kneza dežele; zgrabil jo je, legel k njej in ji storil silo.
2.en: Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her. He took her, lay with her, and humbled her.

3.sl: Njegova duša se je navezala na Dino, Jakobovo hčer; vzljubil je dekle in ljubeznivo z njo govoril.
3.en: His soul joined to Dinah, the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the young lady, and spoke kindly to the young lady.

4.sl: Sihem je rekel očetu Hamórju: »Vzemi mi to deklico za ženo!«
4.en: Shechem spoke to his father, Hamor, saying, “Get me this young lady as a wife.”

5.sl: Jakob pa je slišal, da je onečastil njegovo hčer Dino; ker pa so bili njegovi sinovi pri živini na polju, je molčal, dokler se niso vrnili.
5.en: Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah, his daughter; and his sons were with his cattle in the field. Jacob held his peace until they came.

6.sl: Sihemov oče Hamór se je odpravil k Jakobu, da bi se z njim pogovoril.
6.en: Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to talk with him.

7.sl: Ko so Jakobovi sinovi prišli s polja, so slišali, kaj se je zgodilo. Bili so ogorčeni in so se silno raztogotili; kajti Sihem je zagrešil hudodelstvo v Izraelu, ker je bil pri Jakobovi hčeri. Česa takega ne bi smel storiti.
7.en: The sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it. The men were grieved, and they were very angry, because he had done folly in Israel in lying with Jacob’s daughter; which thing ought not to be done.

8.sl: Hamór jim je spregovoril in rekel: »Duša mojega sina Sihema hrepeni po vaši hčeri; dajte mu jo, prosim, za ženo!
8.en: Hamor talked with them, saying, “The soul of my son, Shechem, longs for your daughter. Please give her to him as a wife.

9.sl: Stopite v svaštvo z nami; svoje hčere dajajte nam in si jemljite naše hčere!
9.en: Make marriages with us. Give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves.

10.sl: Prebivajte pri nas in dežela vam bodi na voljo; bivajte v njej, selite se po njej in pridobite si v njej posest.«
10.en: You shall dwell with us: and the land will be before you. Live and trade in it, and get possessions in it.”

11.sl: Sihem pa je rekel njenemu očetu in njenim bratom: »Naj najdem naklonjenost v vaših očeh! Kar koli terjate od mene, bom dal.
11.en: Shechem said to her father and to her brothers, “Let me find favor in your eyes, and whatever you will tell me I will give.

12.sl: Četudi mi naložite veliko odkupnino za nevesto in darila, bom dal, kolikor mi boste rekli. Le dajte mi dekle za ženo!«
12.en: Ask me a great amount for a dowry, and I will give whatever you ask of me, but give me the young lady as a wife.”

13.sl: Jakobovi sinovi so odgovorili Sihemu in njegovemu očetu Hamórju. Govorili pa so zvijačno, ker je onečastil njihovo sestro Dino.
13.en: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with deceit, and spoke, because he had defiled Dinah their sister,

14.sl: Rekli so jima: »Ne moremo storiti tega, da bi dali sestro možu, ki ni obrezan; kajti to velja pri nas za sramoto.
14.en: and said to them, “We can’t do this thing, to give our sister to one who is uncircumcised; for that is a reproach to us.

15.sl: Privolimo pa vam pod pogojem, da postanete kakor mi s tem, da se da med vami obrezati vsak moški.
15.en: Only on this condition will we consent to you. If you will be as we are, that every male of you be circumcised;

16.sl: Potem vam bomo dajali svoje hčere in si jemali vaše hčere in prebivali bomo pri vas ter postali eno ljudstvo.
16.en: then will we give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.

17.sl: Če pa nas nočete poslušati, da bi se dali obrezati, vzamemo svojo hčer in odidemo.«
17.en: But if you will not listen to us, to be circumcised, then we will take our sister,  and we will be gone.”

18.sl: Njihove besede so ugajale Hamórju in njegovemu sinu Sihemu.
18.en: Their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem, Hamor’s son.

19.sl: Mladenič je bil pripravljen stvar opraviti brez omahovanja, saj je bil zaljubljen v Jakobovo hčer. Bil pa je najuglednejši v vsej očetovi hiši.
19.en: The young man didn’t wait to do this thing, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter, and he was honored above all the house of his father.

20.sl: Hamór in njegov sin Sihem sta šla k mestnim vratom in spregovorila možem svojega mesta ter rekla:
20.en: Hamor and Shechem, his son, came to the gate of their city, and talked with the men of their city, saying,

21.sl: »Ti možje so miroljubni z nami; naj živijo v deželi in se selijo po njej. V deželi je zanje na vse strani zadosti prostora. Jemljimo si njihove hčere za žene in dajajmo jim svoje hčere!
21.en: “These men are peaceful with us. Therefore let them live in the land and trade in it. For, behold, the land is large enough for them. Let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.

22.sl: Toda možje so pripravljeni privoliti, da se naselijo med nami in da postanemo eno ljudstvo le s pogojem, da se med nami vsak moški da obrezati, kakor so obrezani oni.
22.en: Only on this condition will the men consent to us to dwell with us, to become one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.

23.sl: Njihove črede, premoženje in vsa živina, ali ne bo vse to naše? Le privolimo, da ostanejo pri nas!«
23.en: Won’t their cattle and their substance and all their animals be ours? Only let us give our consent to them, and they will dwell with us.”

24.sl: Vsi, ki so hodili k vratom njegovega mesta, so poslušali Hamórja in njegovega sina Sihema; vsi moški so se dali obrezati, vsi, ki so hodili k vratom njegovega mesta.
24.en: All who went out of the gate of his city listened to Hamor, and to Shechem his son; and every male was circumcised, all who went out of the gate of his city.

25.sl: Tretji dan pa, ko jih je bolelo, sta dva Jakobova sinova, Simeon in Levi, Dinina brata, vzela vsak svoj meč in napadla brezskrbno mesto ter pobila vse moške.
25.en: It happened on the third day, when they were sore, that two of Jacob’s sons, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brothers, each took his sword, came upon the unsuspecting city, and killed all the males.

26.sl: Tudi Hamórja in njegovega sina Sihema sta umorila z mečem. Nato sta vzela Dino iz Sihemove hiše in odšla.
26.en: They killed Hamor and Shechem, his son, with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.

27.sl: Jakobovi sinovi so planili na pobite in oropali mesto, ker so onečastili njihovo sestro.
27.en: Jacob’s sons came on the dead, and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.

28.sl: Vzeli so njihovo drobnico, govedo, osle, vse, kar je bilo v mestu in na polju.
28.en: They took their flocks, their herds, their donkeys, that which was in the city, that which was in the field;

29.sl: Tudi vse njihovo imetje, vse otroke in žene so odpeljali kot plen in izropali, kar je bilo v hišah.
29.en: and all their wealth. They took captive all their little ones and their wives, and took as plunder everything that was in the house.

30.sl: Tedaj je Jakob rekel Simeonu in Leviju: »Spravila sta me v nesrečo, ker sta me osovražila pri prebivalcih dežele, pri Kánaancih in Perizéjcih. Le malo ljudi imam. Če se zberejo proti meni, me bodo premagali ter pokončali mene in mojo hišo.«
