30.en: Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have troubled me, to make me odious to the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites. I am few in number. They will gather themselves together against me and strike me, and I will be destroyed, I and my house.”

31.sl: Rekla sta: »Ali je smel ravnati z našo sestro kakor z vlačugo?«
31.en: They said, “Should he deal with our sister as with a prostitute?”

1.sl: Bog je rekel Jakobu: »Vstani, pojdi v Betel in ostani tam! Tam postavi oltar Bogu, ki se ti je prikazal, ko si bežal pred bratom Ezavom!«
1.en: God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel, and live there. Make there an altar to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother.”

2.sl: Jakob je rekel svoji hiši in vsem, ki so bili z njim: »Odpravite tuje bogove, ki so med vami! Očistite se in preoblecite se!
2.en: Then Jacob said to his household, and to all who were with him, “Put away the foreign gods that are among you, purify yourselves, change your garments.

3.sl: Potem se vzdignimo in pojdimo v Betel! Tam bom naredil oltar Bogu, ki me je uslišal na dan moje stiske in bil z menoj na poti, po kateri sem hodil.«
3.en: Let us arise, and go up to Bethel. I will make there an altar to God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.”

4.sl: Tedaj so dali Jakobu vse tuje bogove, ki so jih imeli, pa tudi uhane iz svojih ušes, in Jakob jih je zakopal pod hrast blizu Sihema.
4.en: They gave to Jacob all the foreign gods which were in their hands, and the rings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem.

5.sl: Ko so se odpravili, je okoliška mesta zajel strah Božji, tako da niso zasledovali Jakobovih sinov.
5.en: They traveled: and a terror of God was on the cities that were round about them, and they didn’t pursue the sons of Jacob.

6.sl: Jakob je prišel v Luz, ki je v kánaanski deželi, to je Betel, on in vse ljudstvo, ki je hodilo z njim.
6.en: So Jacob came to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan (the same is Bethel), he and all the people who were with him.

7.sl: Tam je postavil oltar in kraj imenoval El  iz Betela, ker se mu je tam Bog razodel, ko je bežal pred bratom.
7.en: He built an altar there, and called the place El Beth El; because there God was revealed to him, when he fled from the face of his brother.

8.sl: Takrat je umrla Rebekina dojilja Debóra. Pokopali so jo za Betelom pod hrastom; zato ga je imenoval hrast jokanja.
8.en: Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and she was buried below Bethel under the oak; and the name of it was called Allon Bacuth.

9.sl: Bog se je Jakobu spet prikazal, ko je ta prišel iz Mezopotamije, in ga blagoslovil.
9.en: God appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Paddan Aram, and blessed him.

10.sl: Rekel mu je: »Jakob ti je ime, a se ne boš več imenoval Jakob, temveč naj ti bo ime Izrael!« Tako ga je imenoval za Izraela.
10.en: God said to him, “Your name is Jacob. Your name shall not be Jacob any more, but your name will be Israel.” He named him Israel.

11.sl: Bog mu je rekel: »Jaz sem Bog Mogočni. Bodi rodoviten in mnôži se! Narod, da, občestvo narodov naj nastane iz tebe in kralji naj prihajajo iz tvojih ledij.
11.en: God said to him, “I am God Almighty. Be fruitful and multiply. A nation and a company of nations will be from you, and kings will come out of your body.

12.sl: Deželo pa, ki sem jo dal Abrahamu in Izaku, dajem tebi; in tvojim potomcem dajem deželo.«
12.en: The land which I gave to Abraham and Isaac, I will give it to you, and to your seed after you will I give the land.”

13.sl: In Bog se je vzdignil izpred njega z mesta, kjer je govoril z njim.
13.en: God went up from him in the place where he spoke with him.

14.sl: Jakob je na kraju, kjer je govoril z njim, postavil spomenik, kamnit spomenik. Izlil je nanj pitno daritev in ga oblil z oljem.
14.en: Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he spoke with him, a pillar of stone. He poured out a drink-offering on it, and poured oil on it.

15.sl: Kraj, kjer je Bog govoril z njim, je Jakob imenoval Betel.
15.en: Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him “Bethel.”

16.sl: Odpravili so se od Betela. Ko so imeli še malo poti, da bi dospeli v Efráto, je Rahela porodila, a je imela pri porodu težave.
16.en: They traveled from Bethel. There was still some distance to come to Ephrath, and Rachel travailed. She had hard labor.

17.sl: Ko je ležala v porodnih bolečinah, ji je rekla babica: »Nikar se ne boj, saj imaš tudi zdaj sina!«
17.en: It happened that, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said to her, “Don’t be afraid, for now you will have another son.”

18.sl: Ko je njena duša že odhajala, kajti umirala je, ga je imenovala Ben Oní.  Njegov oče pa mu je dal ime Benjamin.
18.en: It happened, as her soul was departing (for she died), that she named him Ben-oni,  but his father named him Benjamin.

19.sl: Rahela je umrla in pokopali so jo ob poti v Efráto, to je v Betlehem.
19.en: Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath (the same is Bethlehem).

20.sl: Jakob je postavil spomenik na njenem grobu; to je Rahelin nagrobnik do današnjega dne.
20.en: Jacob set up a pillar on her grave. The same is the Pillar of Rachel’s grave to this day.

21.sl: Izrael se je odpravil dalje in razpel šotor onkraj Migdál Ederja.
21.en: Israel traveled, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Eder.

22.sl:
In ko je prebival v tem kraju, je šel Ruben k Bilhi, stranski ženi svojega očeta, in ležal z njo. Izrael pa je to izvedel.
 Jakobovih sinov je bilo dvanajst.
22.en:
It happened, while Israel lived in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine, and Israel heard of it.
 Now the sons of Jacob were twelve.

23.sl: Leini sinovi: Jakobov prvorojenec Ruben, Simeon, Levi, Juda, Isahár in Zábulon.
23.en: The sons of Leah: Reuben (Jacob’s firstborn), Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

24.sl: Rahelina sinova: Jožef in Benjamin.
24.en: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

25.sl: Sinova Raheline dekle Bilhe: Dan in Neftáli.
25.en: The sons of Bilhah (Rachel’s handmaid): Dan and Naphtali.

26.sl: Sinova Leine dekle Zilpe: Gad in Aser. To so Jakobovi sinovi, ki so se mu rodili v Mezopotamiji.
26.en: The sons of Zilpah (Leah’s handmaid): Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him in Paddan Aram.

27.sl: Jakob je prišel k svojemu očetu Izaku v Mamre, v Kirját Arbo, to je Hebrón, kjer sta Abraham in Izak živela kot tujca.
27.en: Jacob came to Isaac his father, to Mamre, to Kiriath Arba (the same is Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac lived as foreigners.

28.sl: Izakovih dni je bilo sto osemdeset let.
28.en: The days of Isaac were one hundred eighty years.

29.sl: Potem je Izak izdihnil in umrl, star in nasičen z dnevi, in bil je pridružen svojim ljudem. Pokopala sta ga sinova Ezav in Jakob.
29.en: Isaac gave up the spirit, and died, and was gathered to his people, old and full of days. Esau and Jacob, his sons, buried him.

1.sl: To je rodovnik Ezava, ki se imenuje tudi Edóm.
1.en: Now this is the history of the generations of Esau (the same is Edom).

2.sl: Ezav si je vzel žene izmed Kánaanovih hčera: Ado, hčer Hetejca Elóna, Oholibámo, hčer Anája, sina Hivéjca Cibóna,
2.en: Esau took his wives from the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon, the Hittite; and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, the Hivite;

3.sl: in Basemáto, Izmaelovo hčer, Nebajótovo sestro.
3.en: and Basemath, Ishmael’s daughter, sister of Nebaioth.

4.sl: Ada je Ezavu rodila Elifáza, Basemáta je rodila Reguéla,
4.en: Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz. Basemath bore Reuel.

5.sl: Oholibáma pa je rodila Jeúša, Jaláma in Koraha. To so Ezavovi sinovi, ki so se mu rodili v kánaanski deželi.
5.en: Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These are the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.

6.sl: Ezav je vzel svoje žene, sinove in hčere ter vse duše svoje hiše, čredo, vso živino in vse imetje, ki si ga je pridobil v kánaanski deželi, in odšel v deželo proč od brata Jakoba.
6.en: Esau took his wives, his sons, his daughters, and all the members of his household, with his cattle, all his animals, and all his possessions, which he had gathered in the land of Canaan, and went into a land away from his brother Jacob.

7.sl: Kajti njunega premoženja je bilo preveč, da bi mogla živeti skupaj, in zemlja, kjer sta živela kot tujca, ju ni mogla vzdrževati zaradi njunih čred.
7.en: For their substance was too great for them to dwell together, and the land of their travels couldn’t bear them because of their cattle.

8.sl: Tako se je Ezav naselil na pogorju Seír; Ezav, to je Edóm.
8.en: Esau lived in the hill country of Seir. Esau is Edom.

9.sl: To je rodovnik Ezava, očeta Edómcev na pogorju Seír.
9.en: This is the history of the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir:

10.sl: To so imena Ezavovih sinov: Elifáz, sin Ezavove žene Ade, Reguél, sin Ezavove žene Basemáte.
10.en: these are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Adah, the wife of Esau; and Reuel, the son of Basemath, the wife of Esau.

11.sl: Elifázovi sinovi so bili: Temán, Omár, Cefó, Gatám in Kenáz.
11.en: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

12.sl: Timna je bila stranska žena Ezavovega sina Elifáza in je rodila Elifázu Amáleka. To so bili sinovi Ezavove žene Ade.
12.en: Timna was concubine to Eliphaz, Esau’s son; and she bore to Eliphaz Amalek. These are the sons of Adah, Esau’s wife.

13.sl: To pa so Reguélovi sinovi: Nahat, Zerah, Šamá in Mizá. To so bili sinovi Ezavove žene Basemáte.
13.en: These are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These were the sons of Basemath, Esau’s wife.

14.sl: In to so bili sinovi Ezavove žene Oholibáme, hčere Anája, Cibónovega sina; ta je rodila Ezavu Jeúša, Jaláma in Koraha.
14.en: These were the sons of Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, Esau’s wife: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

15.sl: To so poglavarji Ezavovih sinov. Sinovi Ezavovega prvorojenca Elifáza: poglavar Temán, poglavar Omár, poglavar Cefó, poglavar Kenáz,
15.en: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn of Esau: chief Teman, chief Omar, chief Zepho, chief Kenaz,

16.sl: poglavar Korah, poglavar Gatám in poglavar Amálek. To so bili Elifázovi poglavarji v edómski deželi; to so Adini sinovi.
16.en: chief Korah, chief Gatam, chief Amalek: these are the chiefs who came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah.

17.sl: To so sinovi Ezavovega sina Reguéla: poglavar Nahat, poglavar Zerah, poglavar Šamá in poglavar Mizá. To so Reguélovi poglavarji v edómski deželi; to so sinovi Ezavove žene Basemáte.
17.en: These are the sons of Reuel, Esau’s son: chief Nahath, chief Zerah, chief Shammah, chief Mizzah: these are the chiefs who came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Basemath, Esau’s wife.

18.sl: To pa so sinovi Ezavove žene Oholibáme: poglavar Jeúš, poglavar Jalám in poglavar Korah. To so poglavarji Ezavove žene Oholibáme, Anájeve hčere.
18.en: These are the sons of Oholibamah, Esau’s wife: chief Jeush, chief Jalam, chief Korah: these are the chiefs who came of Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau’s wife.

19.sl: To so Ezavovi sinovi in to njihovi poglavarji; to je Edóm.
19.en: These are the sons of Esau, and these are their chiefs. The same is Edom.

20.sl: To so sinovi Horéjca Seírja, prebivalci dežele: Lotán, Šobál, Cibón, Aná,
20.en: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

21.sl: Dišón, Ecer in Dišán. To so poglavarji Horéjcev, Seírjevih sinov v edómski deželi.
21.en: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. These are the chiefs who came of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.

22.sl: Lotánova sinova sta bila Horí in Hemám, Lotánova sestra pa je bila Timna.
22.en: The children of Lotan were Hori and Heman. Lotan’s sister was Timna.

23.sl: To pa so Šobálovi sinovi: Alván, Manáhat, Ebál, Šefí in Onám.
23.en: These are the children of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

24.sl: In to sta Cibónova sinova Ajá in Aná. To je tisti Aná, ki je v puščavi našel izvire,  ko je pasel osle svojega očeta Cibóna.
24.en: These are the children of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. This is Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness, as he fed the donkeys of Zibeon his father.

25.sl: To pa sta Anájeva otroka: Dišón in Oholibáma, Anájeva hči.
25.en: These are the children of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.

26.sl: To pa so Dišónovi sinovi: Hemdán, Ešbán, Jitrán in Kerán.
26.en: These are the children of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

27.sl: To so Ecerjevi sinovi: Bilhán, Zaaván in Akán.
27.en: These are the children of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.

28.sl: To sta Dišánova sinova: Uc in Arán.
28.en: These are the children of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

29.sl: To so poglavarji Horéjcev: poglavar Lotán, poglavar Šobál, poglavar Cibón, poglavar Aná,
29.en: These are the chiefs who came of the Horites: chief Lotan, chief Shobal, chief Zibeon, chief Anah,

30.sl: poglavar Dišón, poglavar Ecer in poglavar Dišán. To so horéjski poglavarji po svojih rodovih  v seírski deželi.
30.en: chief Dishon, chief Ezer, and chief Dishan: these are the chiefs who came of the Horites, according to their chiefs in the land of Seir.

31.sl: To pa so kralji, ki so kraljevali v edómski deželi, preden je kak kralj zavladal Izraelovim sinovom.
31.en: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before any king reigned over the children of Israel.

32.sl: V Edómu je kraljeval Beórjev sin Bela in njegovo mesto se je imenovalo Dinhába.
32.en: Bela, the son of Beor, reigned in Edom. The name of his city was Dinhabah.

33.sl: Ko je Bela umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Jobáb, Zerahov sin iz Bocre.
33.en: Bela died, and Jobab, the son of Zerah of Bozrah, reigned in his place.

34.sl: Ko je Jobáb umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Hušám iz dežele Temáncev.
34.en: Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

35.sl: Ko je Hušám umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Bedádov sin Hadád, ki je pobil Midjánce na moábski planoti; njegovo mesto se je imenovalo Avít.
35.en: Husham died, and Hadad, the son of Bedad, who struck Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place. The name of his city was Avith.

36.sl: Ko je Hadád umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Samlá iz Masréke.
36.en: Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

37.sl: Ko je Samlá umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Šaúl iz Rehobót Nahárja.
37.en: Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the river, reigned in his place.

38.sl: Ko je Šaúl umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Ahbórjev sin Báal Hanán.
38.en: Shaul died, and Baal Hanan, the son of Achbor reigned in his place.

39.sl: Ko je Ahbórjev sin Báal Hanán umrl, je namesto njega postal kralj Hadád;  njegovo mesto se je imenovalo Pagú, njegovi ženi pa je bilo ime Mehetabéla, hči Me Zahábove hčere Matréde.
39.en: Baal Hanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his place. The name of his city was Pau. His wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.

40.sl: To so imena Ezavovih poglavarjev po njihovih rodovih, krajih in imenih: poglavar Timná, poglavar Alvá, poglavar Jetét,
40.en: These are the names of the chiefs who came from Esau, according to their families, after their places, and by their names: chief Timna, chief Alvah, chief Jetheth,

41.sl: poglavar Oholibáma, poglavar Elá, poglavar Pinón,
41.en: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,

42.sl: poglavar Kenáz, poglavar Temán, poglavar Mibcár,
42.en: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,

43.sl: poglavar Magdiél in poglavar Irám. To so edómski poglavarji po svojih bivališčih v deželi, ki so jo posedli. To je Ezav, oče Edómcev.
43.en: chief Magdiel, and chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession. This is Esau, the father of the Edomites.

1.sl: Jakob se je naselil v deželi, kjer je živel njegov oče kot tujec, v kánaanski deželi.
1.en: Jacob lived in the land of his father’s travels, in the land of Canaan.

2.sl:
To je Jakobova zgodba. 
 Ko je bil Jožef star sedemnajst let, torej še mladenič, je z brati pasel drobnico, skupaj s sinovi očetovih žena Bilhe in Zilpe. Jožef je očetu poročal, kar so slabega govorili o njih.
2.en: This is the history of the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brothers. He was a boy with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father’s wives. Joseph brought an evil report of them to their father.

3.sl: Izrael je ljubil Jožefa bolj kakor druge sinove, ker se mu je rodil v starosti. Naredil mu je dolgo haljo.
3.en: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age, and he made him a coat of many colors.

4.sl: Ko so bratje videli, da ga oče ljubi bolj kot njegove brate, so ga zasovražili in niso mogli z njim prijazno govoriti.
4.en: His brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, and they hated him, and couldn’t speak peaceably to him.

5.sl: Jožef je sanjal sanje in jih je povedal svojim bratom; zato so ga še bolj sovražili.
5.en: Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brothers, and they hated him all the more.

6.sl: Rekel jim je: »Poslušajte, prosim, te sanje, ki sem jih sanjal.
6.en: He said to them, “Please hear this dream which I have dreamed:

7.sl: Sredi polja smo vezali snope in glej, moj snop se je vzdignil in stal pokonci, vaši pa so se postavili naokrog in se priklanjali mojemu snopu.«
7.en: for, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and behold, my sheaf arose and also stood upright; and behold, your sheaves came around, and bowed down to my sheaf.”

8.sl: Bratje pa so mu rekli: »Ali bi res rad zakraljeval in zavladal nad nami?« In še bolj so ga sovražili zaradi njegovih sanj in besed.
8.en: His brothers said to him, “Will you indeed reign over us? Or will you indeed have dominion over us?” They hated him all the more for his dreams and for his words.

9.sl: Nato je sanjal še druge sanje in pripovedoval je o njih bratom. Rekel je: »Glej, spet sem sanjal sanje: in glej, sonce, mesec in enajst zvezd se mi je priklanjalo.«
9.en: He dreamed yet another dream, and told it to his brothers, and said, “Behold, I have dreamed yet another dream: and behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars bowed down to me.”

10.sl: Ko je to povedal očetu in bratom, ga je oče pograjal in mu rekel: »Kaj pomeni, kar se ti je sanjalo? Mar naj res pridemo jaz, tvoja mati in tvoji bratje in se ti klanjamo do tal?«
10.en: He told it to his father and to his brothers. His father rebuked him, and said to him, “What is this dream that you have dreamed? Will I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow ourselves down to you to the earth?”

11.sl: Njegovi bratje so mu bili zato nevoščljivi, oče pa si je stvar zapomnil.
11.en: His brothers envied him; but his father kept this saying in mind.

12.sl: Ko so bratje odšli past drobnico svojega očeta proti Sihemu,
12.en: His brothers went to feed their father’s flock in Shechem.

13.sl: je Izrael rekel Jožefu: »Ali ne pasejo tvoji bratje pri Sihemu? Pojdi, pošiljam te k njim!« Jožef mu je rekel: »Tukaj sem.«
13.en: Israel said to Joseph, “Aren’t your brothers feeding the flock in Shechem? Come, and I will send you to them.” He said to him, “Here I am.”

14.sl: In rekel mu je: »Pojdi torej, poglej, ali se dobro godi tvojim bratom in ali se dobro godi drobnici, in mi sporôči!« Tako ga je poslal iz hebrónske doline in Jožef je prišel do Sihema.
14.en: He said to him, “Go now, see whether it is well with your brothers, and well with the flock; and bring me word again.” So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

15.sl: Ko je blodil po polju, ga je našel neki mož. Vprašal ga je in rekel: »Kaj iščeš?«
15.en: A certain man found him, and behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, “What are you looking for?”

16.sl: Rekel je: »Brate iščem. Povej mi, prosim, kje pasejo!«
16.en: He said, “I am looking for my brothers. Tell me, please, where they are feeding the flock.”

17.sl: Mož je rekel: »Odšli so od tod, slišal pa sem jih, ko so govorili: ›Pojdimo v Dotán!‹« Jožef je torej šel za brati in jih našel pri Dotánu.
17.en:
The man said, “They have left here, for I heard them say, ‘Let us go to Dothan.’”
 Joseph went after his brothers, and found them in Dothan.

18.sl: Zagledali so ga od daleč, in še preden se jim je približal, so se odločili, da ga usmrtijo.
18.en: They saw him afar off, and before he came near to them, they conspired against him to kill him.

19.sl: Govorili so drug drugemu: »Glejte, tam prihaja sanjač!
19.en: They said one to another, “Behold, this dreamer comes.

20.sl: Dajmo, ubijmo ga in ga vrzimo v kak vodnjak! Potem porečemo: ›Divja zver ga je požrla.‹ Bomo videli, kaj bo iz njegovih sanj!«
20.en: Come now therefore, and let’s kill him, and cast him into one of the pits, and we will say, ‘An evil animal has devoured him.’ We will see what will become of his dreams.”

21.sl: Ko je to slišal Ruben, ga je hotel rešiti iz njihovih rok. Rekel je: »Ne vzemimo mu življenja!«
21.en: Reuben heard it, and delivered him out of their hand, and said, “Let’s not take his life.”

22.sl: In Ruben jim je rekel: »Ne prelivajte krvi! Vrzite ga v tale vodnjak tukaj v pustinji, rok pa ne polagajte nanj!« Tako ga je hotel rešiti iz njihovih rok in ga vrniti očetu.
22.en: Reuben said to them, “Shed no blood. Throw him into this pit that is in the wilderness, but lay no hand on him”-- that he might deliver him out of their hand, to restore him to his father.

23.sl: Ko je torej Jožef prišel k bratom, so mu slekli haljo, dolgo haljo,  ki jo je nosil.
23.en: It happened, when Joseph came to his brothers, that they stripped Joseph of his coat, the coat of many colors that was on him;

24.sl: Nato so ga zgrabili in vrgli v vodnjak. Vodnjak pa je bil prazen, ni bilo vode v njem.
24.en: and they took him, and threw him into the pit. The pit was empty. There was no water in it.

25.sl:
Nato so sedli in jedli kruh.
 Ko so povzdignili oči, so zagledali karavano Izmaelcev, ki je prihajala z Gileáda. Njihove kamele so nosile kozlinec, mastiko in ládan. Potovali so, da bi to spravili v Egipt.
25.en: They sat down to eat bread, and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and saw a caravan of Ishmaelites was coming from Gilead, with their camels bearing spices and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt.

26.sl: Tedaj je Juda rekel bratom: »Kaj imamo od tega, če ubijemo brata in skrijemo njegovo kri?
26.en: Judah said to his brothers, “What profit is it if we kill our brother and conceal his blood?

27.sl: Dajmo, prodajmo ga Izmaelcem, naša roka pa naj se ga ne dotakne, saj je naš brat, naše meso.« Bratje so ga ubogali.
27.en: Come, and let’s sell him to the Ishmaelites, and not let our hand be on him; for he is our brother, our flesh.” His brothers listened to him.

28.sl: Ko so tedaj šli mimo midjánski trgovci, so Jožefa potegnili in spravili iz vodnjaka. Potem so ga prodali za dvajset srebrnikov Izmaelcem in ti so ga odpeljali v Egipt.
28.en: Midianites who were merchants passed by, and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver. They brought Joseph into Egypt.

29.sl: Ruben pa se je vrnil k vodnjaku in odkril, da Jožefa ni več v njem. Pretrgal je svoja oblačila,
29.en: Reuben returned to the pit; and saw that Joseph wasn’t in the pit; and he tore his clothes.

30.sl: se vrnil k bratom in rekel: »Dečka ni več tu! In jaz, kam naj grem?«
30.en: He returned to his brothers, and said, “The child is no more; and I, where will I go?”

31.sl: Vzeli so Jožefovo haljo, zaklali kozla in pomočili haljo v kri.
31.en: They took Joseph’s coat, and killed a male goat, and dipped the coat in the blood.

32.sl: Potem so poslali dolgo haljo  očetu in rekli: »To smo našli. Poglej, ali je to halja tvojega sina ali ne!«
32.en: They took the coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father, and said, “We have found this. Examine it, now, whether it is your son’s coat or not.”

33.sl: Ko jo je pogledal, je rekel: »To je halja mojega sina! Divja zver ga je požrla. Raztrgan, raztrgan je Jožef!«
33.en: He recognized it, and said, “It is my son’s coat. An evil animal has devoured him. Joseph is without doubt torn in pieces.”

34.sl: In Jakob je pretrgal svoja oblačila, si ogrnil ledja z raševino in dolge dneve žaloval za sinom.
34.en: Jacob tore his clothes, and put sackcloth on his waist, and mourned for his son many days.

35.sl: Vzdignili so se vsi njegovi sinovi in vse njegove hčere, da bi ga tolažili, pa se ni dal potolažiti. Rekel je: »Zares, žalujoč pojdem k sinu pod zemljo.« Tako ga je oče objokoval.
35.en: All his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted. He said, “For I will go down to Sheol  to my son mourning.” His father wept for him.

36.sl: Midjánci pa so Jožefa prodali v Egipt Potifárju, faraonovemu dvorjanu, načelniku telesne straže.
36.en: The Midianites sold him into Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh’s, the captain of the guard.

1.sl: Tisti čas se je Juda ločil od bratov in razpel šotor pri nekem Adulámcu, ki mu je bilo ime Hirá.
1.en: It happened at that time, that Judah went down from his brothers, and visited a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.

2.sl: Tam je Juda videl hčer Kánaanca, ki se je imenoval Šua. Vzel jo je za ženo in šel k njej.
2.en: Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua. He took her, and went in to her.

3.sl: Spočela je in rodila sina in dal mu je ime Er.
3.en: She conceived, and bore a son; and he named him Er.

4.sl: Spet je spočela in rodila sina ter ga imenovala Onán.
4.en: She conceived again, and bore a son; and she named him Onan.

5.sl: In še enkrat je rodila sina in mu dala ime Šelá. Bil pa je v Kezíbu, ko ga je rodila.
5.en: She yet again bore a son, and named him Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bore him.

6.sl: Juda je vzel za prvorojenca Era ženo, ki ji je bilo ime Tamara.
6.en: Judah took a wife for Er, his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.

7.sl: Toda Judov prvorojenec Er je bil hudoben v Gospodovih očeh, zato ga je Gospod usmrtil.
7.en: Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of Yahweh. Yahweh killed him.

8.sl: Tedaj je Juda rekel Onánu: »Pojdi k ženi svojega brata in stôri svaško dolžnost do nje, da bratu obudiš potomstvo!«
8.en: Judah said to Onan, “Go in to your brother’s wife, and perform the duty of a husband’s brother to her, and raise up seed to your brother.”

9.sl: Ker pa je Onán vedel, da potomci ne bodo njegovi, je vsakokrat, ko je šel k bratovi ženi, spustil seme na tla, da bratu ne bi dal potomstva.
9.en: Onan knew that the seed wouldn’t be his; and it happened, when he went in to his brother’s wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest he should give seed to his brother.

10.sl: V Gospodovih očeh je bilo hudobno, kar je delal, zato je tudi njega usmrtil.
10.en: The thing which he did was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and he killed him also.

11.sl: Nato je Juda rekel snahi Tamari: »Prebivaj kot vdova v očetovi hiši, dokler ne doraste moj sin Šelá!« Rekel je namreč: »Da še ta ne umre kakor njegova brata!« Tamara je šla in prebivala v očetovi hiši.
11.en: Then Judah said to Tamar, his daughter-in-law, “Remain a widow in your father’s house, until Shelah, my son, is grown up;” for he said, “Lest he also die, like his brothers.” Tamar went and lived in her father’s house.

12.sl: Preteklo je veliko dni in Judova žena, Šuova hči, je umrla. Ko se je Juda potolažil, je šel s prijateljem Hirájem iz Aduláma v Timno, kjer so strigli njegovo drobnico.
12.en: After many days, Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died. Judah was comforted, and went up to his sheep-shearers to Timnah, he and his friend Hirah, the Adullamite.

13.sl: Tamari so povedali in rekli: »Tvoj tast gre v Timno strič drobnico.«
13.en: It was told Tamar, saying, “Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep.”

14.sl: Tedaj je odložila vdovska oblačila, se pokrila s tančico, se zagrnila in sedla pri vhodu v Enájim ob poti v Timno. Spoznala je namreč, da je Šelá dorastel, pa mu je niso dali za ženo.
14.en: She took off of her the garments of her widowhood, and covered herself with her veil, and wrapped herself, and sat in the gate of Enaim, which is by the way to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, and she wasn’t given to him as a wife.

15.sl: Ko jo je Juda zagledal, jo je imel za vlačugo, ker si je zakrila obraz.
15.en: When Judah saw her, he thought that she was a prostitute, for she had covered her face.

16.sl: Obrnil se je s poti k njej in ji rekel: »Pusti, naj grem k tebi!« Ni namreč vedel, da je njegova snaha. Rekla je: »Kaj mi boš dal za to, da prideš k meni?«
16.en:
He turned to her by the way, and said, “Please come, let me come in to you:” for he didn’t know that she was his daughter-in-law.
 She said, “What will you give me, that you may come in to me?”

17.sl: Rekel je: »Poslal ti bom kozlička od svoje drobnice.« Nato je rekla: »Le če daš kaj v zastavo, dokler ga ne pošlješ.«
17.en:
He said, “I will send you a kid of the goats from the flock.”
 She said, “Will you give me a pledge, until you send it?”

18.sl: Rekel je: »Kakšno zastavo naj ti dam?« Pa je rekla: »Pečatni prstan, trak in palico, ki jo imaš v roki.« Dal ji je to in šel k njej. In spočela je z njim.
18.en:
He said, “What pledge will I give you?”
 She said, “Your signet and your cord, and your staff that is in your hand.”
 He gave them to her, and came in to her, and she conceived by him.

19.sl: Nato je vstala in šla, odložila tančico ter oblekla vdovska oblačila.
19.en: She arose, and went away, and put off her veil from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.

20.sl: Juda je po svojem adulámskem prijatelju poslal kozlička, da bi od ženske dobil zastavo; pa je ni našel.
20.en: Judah sent the kid of the goats by the hand of his friend, the Adullamite, to receive the pledge from the woman’s hand, but he didn’t find her.

21.sl: Vprašal je domačine in rekel: »Kje je posvečena vlačuga, ki je bila v Enájimu ob poti?« Rekli so: »Tu ni bilo nobene posvečene vlačuge.«
21.en:
Then he asked the men of her place, saying, “Where is the prostitute, that was at Enaim by the road?”
 They said, “There has been no prostitute here.”

22.sl: Vrnil se je k Judu in mu rekel: »Nisem je našel, pa tudi domačini so rekli, da tam ni bilo nobene posvečene vlačuge.«
22.en: He returned to Judah, and said, “I haven’t found her; and also the men of the place said, ‘There has been no prostitute here.’”

23.sl: Juda je rekel: »Naj jo ima! Da le ne bova v zasmeh! Glej, poslal sem tega kozlička, ti pa je nisi našel.«
23.en: Judah said, “Let her keep it, lest we be shamed. Behold, I sent this kid, and you haven’t found her.”

24.sl: Ko so pretekli približno trije meseci, so Judu povedali in rekli: »Tvoja snaha Tamara je nečistovala in tudi spočela je iz nečistovanja.« Juda je rekel: »Peljite jo ven in naj jo sežgejo!«
24.en:
It happened about three months later, that it was told Judah, saying, “Tamar, your daughter-in-law, has played the prostitute; and moreover, behold, she is with child by prostitution.”
 Judah said, “Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.”

25.sl: Ko so jo peljali ven, je poslala tastu sporočilo: »Spočela sem od moža, čigar last so te stvari.« Rekla je še: »Le poglej, čigavi so ta pečatni prstan, ta trak in ta palica!«
25.en: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, “By the man, whose these are, I am with child.” She also said, “Please discern whose are these-- the signet, and the cords, and the staff.”

26.sl: Juda si je to ogledal in rekel: »Pravičnejša je od mene, ker je nisem dal sinu Šeláju.« Potem pa je ni več spoznal.
26.en:
Judah acknowledged them, and said, “She is more righteous than I, because I didn’t give her to Shelah, my son.”
 He knew her again no more.

27.sl: Ko je prišel čas njenega poroda, sta bila v njenem telesu dvojčka.
27.en: It happened in the time of her travail, that behold, twins were in her womb.

28.sl: Ko je rodila, je eden pomolil roko. Babica je vzela rdečo nit, jo privezala na roko in rekla: »Ta pride najprej na svet.«
28.en: It happened, when she travailed, that one put out a hand: and the midwife took and tied a scarlet thread on his hand, saying, “This came out first.”

29.sl: Toda ta je potegnil roko nazaj in ven je prišel njegov brat. Rekla je: »Kaj si naredil prodor?« Zato so mu dali ime Perec.
29.en: It happened, as he drew back his hand, that behold, his brother came out, and she said, “Why have you made a breach for yourself?” Therefore his name was called Perez.

30.sl: Potem je prišel na svet njegov brat, ki je imel na roki rdečo nit. Dali so mu ime Zerah.
30.en: Afterward his brother came out, that had the scarlet thread on his hand, and his name was called Zerah.

1.sl: Jožefa so pripeljali v Egipt in kupil ga je faraonov dvorjan Potifár, poveljnik telesne straže, Egipčan, iz rok Izmaelcev, ki so ga pripeljali tja.
1.en: Joseph was brought down to Egypt. Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh’s, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him from the hand of the Ishmaelites that had brought him down there.

2.sl:
Gospod pa je bil z Jožefom, zato je bil uspešen človek.
 Bival je v hiši svojega gospodarja Egipčana.
2.en: Yahweh was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man. He was in the house of his master the Egyptian.

3.sl: Gospodar je videl, da je Gospod z njim in da mu Gospod daje, da v njegovih rokah uspeva vse, česar koli se loti.
3.en: His master saw that Yahweh was with him, and that Yahweh made all that he did prosper in his hand.

4.sl: Zato je Jožef našel naklonjenost v njegovih očeh in mu je smel streči. Postavil ga je za oskrbnika svoje hiše in mu dal v roke vse, kar je imel.
4.en: Joseph found favor in his sight. He ministered to him, and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.

5.sl: Odkar ga je postavil za oskrbnika svoje hiše in vsega, kar je imel, je Gospod blagoslavljal Egipčanovo hišo zaradi Jožefa; Gospodov blagoslov je bil pri vsem, kar je imel, doma in na polju.
5.en: It happened from the time that he made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that Yahweh blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake; and the blessing of Yahweh was on all that he had, in the house and in the field.

6.sl:
Zato je prepustil vse, kar je imel, Jožefovim rokam in se ob njem ni menil za nič drugega kakor za kruh, ki ga je jedel.
 Jožef pa je bil lepe postave in zalega obraza.
6.en:
He left all that he had in Joseph’s hand. He didn’t concern himself with anything, except for the food which he ate.
 Joseph was well-built and handsome.

7.sl: Po teh dogodkih je žena njegovega gospodarja vrgla oči nanj in rekla: »Lezi z menoj!«
7.en: It happened after these things, that his master’s wife cast her eyes on Joseph; and she said, “Lie with me.”

8.sl: Pa ni hotel; rekel je ženi svojega gospodarja: »Glej, moj gospodar se ne meni ob meni za nič v hiši, in vse, kar ima, je dal meni v roke.
8.en: But he refused, and said to his master’s wife, “Behold, my master doesn’t know what is with me in the house, and he has put all that he has into my hand.

9.sl: Sam ni večji od mene v tej hiši in ničesar mi ni odrekel razen tebe, ker si njegova žena. Kako naj torej storim tako veliko hudobijo in se pregrešim zoper Boga?«
9.en: He isn’t greater in this house than I, neither has he kept back anything from me but you, because you are his wife. How then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?”

10.sl: In čeprav ga je dan na dan nagovarjala, je vendar ni poslušal, da bi legel k njej in bil pri njej.
10.en: It happened that as she spoke to Joseph day by day, that he didn’t listen to her, to lie by her, or to be with her.

11.sl: Ko je nekega dne prišel, da bi opravil svoje delo, v hiši pa ni bilo nobenega služabnika,
11.en: It happened about this time, that he went into the house to do his work, and there were none of the men of the house inside.

12.sl: ga je zgrabila za obleko in rekla: »Lezi z menoj!« On pa je pustil svojo obleko v njeni roki in zbežal ter odšel ven.
12.en:
She caught him by his garment, saying, “Lie with me!”
 He left his garment in her hand, and ran outside.

13.sl: Ko je videla, da ji je pustil obleko v roki in zbežal ven,
13.en: It happened, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and had run outside,

14.sl: je sklicala služabnike in jim rekla: »Glejte, pripeljal nam je Hebrejca, da bi se zabaval z nami. Prišel je k meni, da bi ležal z menoj, pa sem na ves glas zavpila.
14.en: that she called to the men of her house, and spoke to them, saying, “Behold, he has brought in a Hebrew to us to mock us. He came in to me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice.

15.sl: Ko je slišal, da sem povzdignila glas in zavpila, je pustil svojo obleko ob meni in zbežal ter odšel ven.«
15.en: It happened, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and ran outside.”

16.sl: Pustila je njegovo obleko poleg sebe, dokler ni prišel gospodar domov.
16.en: She laid up his garment by her, until his master came home.

17.sl: Tedaj mu je govorila z istimi besedami in rekla: »K meni je prišel hebrejski suženj, ki si nam ga pripeljal, da bi se zabaval z menoj.
17.en: She spoke to him according to these words, saying, “The Hebrew servant, whom you have brought to us, came in to me to mock me,

18.sl: Ko pa sem povzdignila glas in zavpila, je pustil obleko ob meni in zbežal ven.«
18.en: and it happened, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and ran outside.”

19.sl: Ko je Jožefov gospodar slišal ženine besede, ko mu je govorila: »Tako mi je storil tvoj suženj«, se je silno razjezil.
19.en: It happened, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke to him, saying, “This is what your servant did to me,” that his wrath was kindled.

20.sl: Dal ga je prijeti in vreči v ječo, v kraj, kjer so bili zaprti kraljevi jetniki. Tam je bil torej v ječi.
20.en: Joseph’s master took him, and put him into the prison, the place where the king’s prisoners were bound, and he was there in custody.

21.sl: Gospod pa je bil z Jožefom in mu je izkazoval dobroto. Dal mu je naklonjenost v očeh načelnika ječe.
21.en: But Yahweh was with Joseph, and showed kindness to him, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.

22.sl: In ta je izročil Jožefu vse jetnike, ki so bili v ječi; kar koli se je tam naredilo, je bilo njegovo delo.
22.en: The keeper of the prison committed to Joseph’s hand all the prisoners who were in the prison. Whatever they did there, he was the doer of it.

23.sl: Načelnik ječe se ni menil za tisto, kar je izročil Jožefu. Gospod je bil namreč z njim in Gospod mu je dajal uspeh v vsem, česar koli se je lotil.
23.en: The keeper of the prison didn’t look after anything that was under his hand, because Yahweh was with him; and that which he did, Yahweh made it prosper.

1.sl: Po teh dogodkih sta se točaj in pek egiptovskega kralja pregrešila zoper svojega gospoda, egiptovskega kralja.
1.en: It happened after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker offended their lord, the king of Egypt.

2.sl: Faraon se je razjezil na dvorjana, na vélikega točaja in vélikega peka.
2.en: Pharaoh was angry with his two officers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker.

3.sl: Dal ju je zapreti v hišo načelnika telesne straže, v ječo, kjer je bil zaprt Jožef.
3.en: He put them in custody in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.

4.sl:
Načelnik telesne straže jima je postavil Jožefa za strežaja.
 Ko pa sta bila že nekaj časa v ječi,
4.en: The captain of the guard assigned them to Joseph, and he took care of them. They stayed in prison many days.

5.sl: se je isto noč sanjalo obema, točaju in peku egiptovskega kralja, ki sta bila zaprta v ječi. Vsakemu se je sanjalo, kar je imelo zanj poseben pomen.
5.en: They both dreamed a dream, each man his dream, in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were bound in the prison.

6.sl: Zjutraj je prišel k njima Jožef in videl, da sta slabe volje.
6.en: Joseph came in to them in the morning, and saw them, and saw that they were sad.

7.sl: Vprašal je faraonova dvorjana, ki sta bila zaprta z njim v gospodarjevi hiši, in rekel: »Zakaj sta danes vajina obraza čemerna?«
7.en: He asked Pharaoh’s officers who were with him in custody in his master’s house, saying, “Why do you look so sad today?”

8.sl: Rekla sta mu: »Imela sva sanje, pa ni nikogar, ki bi nama jih razložil.« Jožef pa jima je rekel: »Ali niso razlage od Boga? Povejta mi jih, prosim!«
8.en:
They said to him, “We have dreamed a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it.”
 Joseph said to them, “Don’t interpretations belong to God? Please tell it to me.”

9.sl: Véliki točaj mu je tedaj razodel svoje sanje in mu rekel: »V sanjah je bila pred menoj vinska trta
9.en: The chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, “In my dream, behold, a vine was in front of me,

10.sl: in na trti tri mladike. Vzbrstela je in pognala cvet in že so zorele jagode njenih grozdov.
10.en: and in the vine were three branches. It was as though it budded, its blossoms shot forth, and the clusters of it brought forth ripe grapes.

11.sl: V roki sem imel faraonovo čašo in utrgal grozdje, ga stisnil v faraonovo čašo, čašo pa podal faraonu v roko.«
11.en: Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand; and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.”

12.sl: Jožef mu je rekel: »To je razlaga: tri mladike so trije dnevi.
12.en: Joseph said to him, “This is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days.

13.sl: Še tri dni in faraon bo povzdignil tvojo glavo in te postavil nazaj v tvojo službo; podajal mu boš čašo v roko, kakor je bila navada prej, ko si bil njegov točaj.
13.en: Within three more days, Pharaoh will lift up your head, and restore you to your office. You will give Pharaoh’s cup into his hand, the way you did when you were his cupbearer.

14.sl: Toda spomni se me, ko se ti bo dobro godilo, in izkaži mi dobroto; priporoči me faraonu in me spravi iz te hiše!
14.en: But remember me when it will be well with you, and show kindness, please, to me, and make mention of me to Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house.

15.sl: Kajti zares sem bil ukraden iz hebrejske dežele in tudi tukaj nisem storil nič takega, da bi me morali vreči v ječo.«
15.en: For indeed, I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews, and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.”

16.sl: Véliki pek je videl, da je sanje ugodno razložil, zato je rekel Jožefu: »Tudi meni se je sanjalo in v sanjah sem imel na glavi tri košare belega peciva.
16.en: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, “I also was in my dream, and, behold, three baskets of white bread were on my head.

17.sl: V vrhnji košari so bili vsakovrstni pekovski izdelki, ki jih uživa faraon; a ptice so jih jedle iz košare na moji glavi.«
17.en: In the uppermost basket there was all kinds of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head.”

18.sl: Jožef je odgovoril: »To je razlaga: tri košare so trije dnevi.
18.en: Joseph answered, “This is the interpretation of it. The three baskets are three days.

19.sl: Še tri dni in faraon bo povzdignil tvojo glavo s tebe in te obesil na drevo in ptice bodo jedle tvoje meso.«
19.en: Within three more days, Pharaoh will lift up your head from off you, and will hang you on a tree; and the birds will eat your flesh from off you.”

20.sl: Tretji dan je faraon na svoj rojstni dan napravil pojedino vsem svojim služabnikom. Tedaj je sredi svojih služabnikov povzdignil glavo vélikega točaja in glavo vélikega peka.
20.en: It happened the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, that he made a feast for all his servants, and he lifted up the head of the chief cupbearer and the head of the chief baker among his servants.

21.sl: Vélikega točaja je postavil nazaj v njegovo točajsko službo, da je podajal čašo faraonu v roko.
21.en: He restored the chief cupbearer to his position again, and he gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand;

22.sl: Vélikega peka pa je dal obesiti, kakor jima je razložil Jožef.
22.en: but he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them.

23.sl: Toda véliki točaj se ni spomnil na Jožefa, temveč ga je pozabil.
23.en: Yet the chief cupbearer didn’t remember Joseph, but forgot him.

1.sl: Ko sta pretekli dve leti, se je faraonu sanjalo: stal je ob Nilu
1.en: It happened at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.

2.sl: in glej, iz Nila je stopilo sedem lepih in rejenih krav in so se pasle v ločju.
2.en: Behold, there came up out of the river seven cattle, well-favored and fat-fleshed, and they fed in the reed-grass.

3.sl: In glej, drugih sedem krav je stopilo iz Nila za njimi. Bile so grde in mršave in postavile so se poleg onih krav na bregu Nila.
3.en: Behold, seven other cattle came up after them out of the river, ill-favored and lean-fleshed, and stood by the other cattle on the brink of the river.

4.sl: Potem so grde in mršave krave požrle sedem lepih in rejenih krav. In faraon se je prebudil.
4.en: The ill-favored and lean-fleshed cattle ate up the seven well-favored and fat cattle. So Pharaoh awoke.

5.sl: Ko je spet zaspal, se mu je sanjalo drugič. In glej, na enem steblu je rastlo sedem debelih in lepih klasov.
5.en: He slept and dreamed a second time: and, behold, seven heads of grain came up on one stalk, healthy and good.

6.sl: In glej, za njimi je poganjalo sedem drobnih klasov, ki jih je osmodil vzhodni veter.
6.en: Behold, seven heads of grain, thin and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them.

7.sl: Drobni klasi so pogoltnili sedem debelih in polnih klasov. Tedaj se je faraon prebudil in glej, bile so sanje.
7.en: The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven healthy and full ears. Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.

8.sl: Zjutraj je bil njegov duh vznemirjen. Zato je dal poklicati vse egiptovske čarovnike in modrijane. In faraon jim je povedal sanje, a nobeden mu jih ni znal razložiti.
8.en: It happened in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men of it. Pharaoh told them his dream, but there was no one who could interpret them to Pharaoh.

9.sl: Tedaj je véliki točaj spregovoril faraonu in rekel: »Danes sem se spomnil svojih grehov.
9.en: Then the chief cupbearer spoke to Pharaoh, saying, “I remember my faults today.

10.sl: Faraon se je razjezil na svoja služabnika in ju dal zapreti v hišo načelnika telesne straže, mene in vélikega peka.
10.en: Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and put me in custody in the house of the captain of the guard, me and the chief baker.

11.sl: Sanjalo pa se je isto noč meni in njemu; vsak je imel svoje sanje, ki so imele zanj poseben pomen.
11.en: We dreamed a dream in one night, I and he. We dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.

12.sl: Bil pa je tam z nama hebrejski mladenič, suženj načelnika telesne straže. Povedala sva mu sanje in razložil nama jih je; vsakemu je razložil njegove sanje.
12.en: There was with us there a young man, a Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard, and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams. To each man according to his dream he interpreted.

13.sl: In kakor nama je razložil, tako se je zgodilo: jaz sem bil spet postavljen v svojo službo, oni pa je bil obešen.«
13.en: It happened, as he interpreted to us, so it was: he restored me to my office, and he hanged him.”

14.sl: Faraon je dal poklicati Jožefa. Hitro so ga pripeljali iz ječe. Obril se je, se preoblekel in prišel k faraonu.
14.en: Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon. He shaved himself, changed his clothing, and came in to Pharaoh.

15.sl: In faraon je rekel Jožefu: »Imel sem sanje in ni ga, ki bi mi jih razložil. Slišal pa sem o tebi, da kadar slišiš sanje, jih tudi razložiš.«
15.en: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have dreamed a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it. I have heard it said of you, that when you hear a dream you can interpret it.”

16.sl: Jožef mu je odgovoril in rekel: »Ne jaz, Bog bo odgovoril faraonu, kar mu je v blagor.«
16.en: Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “It isn’t in me. God will give Pharaoh an answer of peace.”

17.sl: Potem je faraon govoril Jožefu: »V svojih sanjah, glej, sem stal na bregu Nila.
17.en: Pharaoh spoke to Joseph, “In my dream, behold, I stood on the brink of the river:

18.sl: In glej, iz Nila je stopilo sedem rejenih in lepih krav in se paslo v ločju.
18.en: and, behold, there came up out of the river seven cattle, fat-fleshed and well-favored. They fed in the reed-grass,

19.sl: In glej, za njimi je stopilo iz Nila še sedem drugih, zelo mršavih, zelo grdih in kilavih krav. V vsej egiptovski deželi nisem videl tako grdih krav.
19.en: and, behold, seven other cattle came up after them, poor and very ill-favored and lean-fleshed, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for ugliness.

20.sl: In te kilave in grde krave so požrle sedem rejenih krav.
20.en: The lean and ill-favored cattle ate up the first seven fat cattle,

21.sl: Tako so jih požrle, a se jim ni poznalo, da bi jim prišle v trebuh; videti so bile grde kakor prej. Nato sem se prebudil.
21.en: and when they had eaten them up, it couldn’t be known that they had eaten them, but they were still ill-favored, as at the beginning. So I awoke.

22.sl: In spet sem videl v sanjah: glej, sedem polnih in lepih klasov je rastlo na enem steblu.
22.en: I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven heads of grain came up on one stalk, full and good:

23.sl: In glej, za njimi je poganjalo sedem drugih, suhih, drobnih, ki jih je osmodil vzhodni veter.
23.en: and, behold, seven heads of grain, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them.

24.sl: In drobni klasi so pogoltnili sedem lepih klasov. To sem povedal čarovnikom, a ni bilo nobenega, ki bi mi znal to razložiti.«
24.en: The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven good heads of grain. I told it to the magicians; but there was no one who could explain it to me.”

25.sl: Jožef je tedaj rekel faraonu: »Faraonove sanje so le ene. Bog je faraonu naznanil, kaj hoče storiti.
25.en: Joseph said to Pharaoh, “The dream of Pharaoh is one. What God is about to do he has declared to Pharaoh.

26.sl: Sedem lepih krav je sedem let in sedem lepih klasov je sedem let; sanje so le ene.
26.en: The seven good cattle are seven years; and the seven good heads of grain are seven years. The dream is one.

27.sl: Sedem mršavih in grdih krav, ki so stopale za njimi, je sedem let, in sedem drobnih klasov, ki jih je osmodil vzhodni veter, je sedem let lakote.
27.en: The seven lean and ill-favored cattle that came up after them are seven years, and also the seven empty heads of grain blasted with the east wind; they will be seven years of famine.

28.sl: To je tisto, kar sem rekel faraonu: Bog je faraonu pokazal, kaj hoče storiti.
28.en: That is the thing which I spoke to Pharaoh. What God is about to do he has shown to Pharaoh.

29.sl: Prišlo bo sedem let velikega obilja po vsej egiptovski deželi.
29.en: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt.

30.sl: Za njimi pa nastopi sedem let lakote in pozabljeno bo vse obilje v egiptovski deželi in lakota bo izčrpala deželo.
30.en: There will arise after them seven years of famine, and all the plenty will be forgotten in the land of Egypt. The famine will consume the land,

31.sl: Deželi se obilje ne bo poznalo zaradi lakote, ki bo prišla potem; kajti zelo bo pritiskala.
31.en: and the plenty will not be known in the land by reason of that famine which follows; for it will be very grievous.

32.sl: Da so se sanje faraonu ponovile, pomeni, da je to Bog trdno sklenil in bo to prav kmalu tudi storil.
32.en: The dream was doubled to Pharaoh, because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.

33.sl: Torej naj faraon zdaj poskrbi za razumnega in modrega moža in naj ga postavi nad egiptovsko deželo.
33.en: Now therefore let Pharaoh look for a discreet and wise man, and set him over the land of Egypt.

34.sl: Postavi naj oskrbnike po deželi, da bodo v sedmih letih obilja pobirali petino v egiptovski deželi.
34.en: Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint overseers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt’s produce in the seven plenteous years.

35.sl: Naj zberejo ves živež teh dobrih let, ki pridejo, in naj spravijo žito pod faraonovo oblastjo kot živež po mestih in ga shranijo.
35.en: Let them gather all the food of these good years that come, and lay up grain under the hand of Pharaoh for food in the cities, and let them keep it.

36.sl: Ta živež bo zaloga za deželo za sedem let lakote, ki bo vladala v egiptovski deželi. Tako dežela zaradi lakote ne bo propadla.«
36.en: The food will be for a store to the land against the seven years of famine, which will be in the land of Egypt; that the land not perish through the famine.”

37.sl: Ta beseda je ugajala faraonu in vsem njegovim služabnikom.
37.en: The thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.

38.sl: Faraon je rekel služabnikom: »Mar bomo našli moža, kakor je ta, ki je v njem Božji duh?«
38.en: Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a one as this, a man in whom is the Spirit of God?”

39.sl: Jožefu pa je faraon rekel: »Potem ko ti je Bog vse to razodel, ni nikogar, ki bi bil tako razumen in moder kakor ti.
39.en: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Because God has shown you all of this, there is none so discreet and wise as you.

40.sl: Ti bodi oskrbnik moje hiše in po tvojem ukazu naj se ravna vse moje ljudstvo; samo za prestol bom večji od tebe.«
40.en: You shall be over my house, and according to your word will all my people be ruled. Only in the throne I will be greater than you.”

41.sl: Faraon je še rekel Jožefu: »Glej, postavljam te nad vso egiptovsko deželo.«
41.en: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Behold, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.”

42.sl: Snel je pečatni prstan in ga dal Jožefu na prst. Oblekel ga je v oblačila iz tankega platna in mu obesil zlato ogrlico okoli vratu.
42.en: Pharaoh took off his signet ring from his hand, and put it on Joseph’s hand, and arrayed him in robes of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck,

43.sl: Potem ga je dal peljati na svojem drugem vozu in pred njim so klicali: »Priklonite se!«  Tako ga je postavil nad vso egiptovsko deželo.
43.en: and he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had. They cried before him, “Bow the knee!” He set him over all the land of Egypt.

44.sl: In faraon je rekel Jožefu: »Jaz sem faraon, a brez tebe naj nihče ne vzdigne ne roke ne noge po vsej egiptovski deželi.«
44.en: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh, and without you shall no man lift up his hand or his foot in all the land of Egypt.”

45.sl: In faraon je dal Jožefu ime Cafenát Panéah in mu dal za ženo Asenáto, hčer Potifêra, duhovnika v Onu. Potem je Jožef odšel po egiptovski deželi.
45.en: Pharaoh called Joseph’s name Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave him Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On as a wife. Joseph went out over the land of Egypt.

46.sl: Ko je Jožef stopil pred egiptovskega kralja faraona, je imel trideset let. In Jožef je odšel izpred faraonovega obličja in prehodil vso egiptovsko deželo.
46.en: Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.

47.sl: Zemlja je v sedmih letih obilja bogato rodila.
47.en: In the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth abundantly.

48.sl: Zbral je ves živež sedmih let, ki so nastopila v egiptovski deželi, in ga naložil po mestih; živež s polja okoli vsakega mesta je spravil vanj.
48.en: He gathered up all the food of the seven years which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every city, he laid up in the same.

49.sl: Zbral je žita kakor peska ob morju, silno veliko, tako da je nehal meriti, ker se ni več dalo meriti.
49.en: Joseph laid up grain as the sand of the sea, very much, until he stopped counting, for it was without number.

50.sl: Preden je prišlo leto lakote, sta se Jožefu rodila dva sinova, ki mu ju je rodila Asenáta, hči Potifêra, duhovnika v Onu.
50.en: To Joseph were born two sons before the year of famine came, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On, bore to him.

51.sl: Jožef je dal prvorojencu ime Manáse, češ: »Bog mi je dal pozabiti  vse moje trpljenje in vso hišo mojega očeta.«
51.en: Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh,  “For,” he said, “God has made me forget all my toil, and all my father’s house.”

52.sl: Drugemu je dal ime Efrájim, češ: »Bog me je storil rodovitnega  v deželi moje stiske.«
52.en: The name of the second, he called Ephraim : “For God has made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.”

53.sl: V egiptovski deželi je preteklo sedem let obilja.
53.en: The seven years of plenty, that was in the land of Egypt, came to an end.

54.sl: In začelo je prihajati sedem let lakote, kakor je napovedal Jožef. Lakota je nastala po vseh deželah, po vsej egiptovski deželi pa je bilo dovolj kruha.
54.en: The seven years of famine began to come, just as Joseph had said. There was famine in all lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.

55.sl: Ko je tudi vsa egiptovska dežela trpela lakoto, je ljudstvo vpilo k faraonu za kruh. Faraon pa je rekel vsem Egipčanom: »Pojdite k Jožefu; kar vam poreče, to storite!«
55.en: When all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread, and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph. What he says to you, do.”

56.sl: Ko je po vsej deželi nastopila lakota, je Jožef odprl vse žitnice in prodajal žito Egipčanom. Lakota pa je vedno huje pritiskala po egiptovski deželi.
56.en: The famine was over all the surface of the earth. Joseph opened all the store-houses, and sold to the Egyptians. The famine was severe in the land of Egypt.

57.sl: Ves svet je hodil v Egipt k Jožefu kupovat žito; kajti lakota je hudo pritiskala po vsej zemlji.
57.en: All countries came into Egypt, to Joseph, to buy grain, because the famine was severe in all the earth.

1.sl: Ko je Jakob izvedel, da imajo v Egiptu žito, je rekel svojim sinovom: »Kaj se spogledujete?«
1.en: Now Jacob saw that there was grain in Egypt, and Jacob said to his sons, “Why do you look at one another?”

2.sl: In je rekel: »Slišal sem, da je žito v Egiptu. Pojdite tja in kupite nam žita, da ostanemo pri življenju in ne umremo!«
2.en: He said, “Behold, I have heard that there is grain in Egypt. Go down there, and buy for us from there, so that we may live, and not die.”

3.sl: Tedaj je odšlo deset Jožefovih bratov, da bi nakupili žita v Egiptu.
3.en: Joseph’s ten brothers went down to buy grain from Egypt.

4.sl: Jožefovega brata Benjamina pa Jakob ni poslal z njegovimi brati; rekel si je: »Da se mu ne pripeti kaka nesreča!«
4.en: But Jacob didn’t send Benjamin, Joseph’s brother, with his brothers; for he said, “Lest perhaps harm happen to him.”

5.sl: Med drugimi, ki so prihajali kupovat žito, so prišli tudi Izraelovi sinovi, kajti lakota je bila v kánaanski deželi.
5.en: The sons of Israel came to buy among those who came, for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

6.sl: Jožef je bil oblastnik v deželi in je prodajal žito vsemu ljudstvu. Jožefovi bratje so prišli in se priklonili pred njim z obrazom do tal.
6.en: Joseph was the governor over the land. It was he who sold to all the people of the land. Joseph’s brothers came, and bowed themselves down to him with their faces to the earth.

7.sl: Ko jih je Jožef videl, jih je spoznal, a se je delal tujca pred njimi in trdo govoril z njimi. Rekel jim je: »Od kod ste prišli?« Rekli so: »Iz kánaanske dežele kupovat živež.«
7.en:
Joseph saw his brothers, and he recognized them, but acted like a stranger to them, and spoke roughly with them. He said to them, “Where did you come from?”
 They said, “From the land of Canaan to buy food.”

8.sl: Jožef je brate spoznal, oni pa ga niso spoznali.
8.en: Joseph recognized his brothers, but they didn’t recognize him.

9.sl: Tedaj se je Jožef spomnil sanj, ki jih je imel o njih, in jim je rekel: »Ogleduhi ste! Prišli ste ogledovat nezavarovane kraje v deželi.«
9.en: Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed about them, and said to them, “You are spies! You have come to see the nakedness of the land.”

10.sl: Rekli so mu: »Ne, moj gospod, tvoji služabniki so prišli nakupit živež.
10.en: They said to him, “No, my lord, but your servants have come to buy food.

11.sl: Vsi smo sinovi enega moža; pošteni smo, tvoji služabniki niso ogleduhi.«
11.en: We are all one man’s sons; we are honest men. Your servants are not spies.”

12.sl: »Ne,« jim je rekel, »zares ste prišli ogledovat nezavarovane kraje v deželi.«
12.en: He said to them, “No, but you have come to see the nakedness of the land.”

13.sl: Rekli so: »Dvanajst je bilo tvojih služabnikov, bratje smo, sinovi enega moža v kánaanski deželi; najmlajši je zdaj pri našem očetu, enega pa ni več.«
13.en: They said, “We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is no more.”

14.sl: Jožef pa jim je rekel: »Tako je, kakor sem vam govoril in rekel: ogleduhi ste!
14.en: Joseph said to them, “It is like I told you, saying, ‘You are spies.’

15.sl: Takole vas bomo preizkusili: kakor živi faraon, ne boste šli od tod, dokler ne pride sem vaš najmlajši brat.
15.en: Hereby you shall be tested. By the life of Pharaoh you shall not go forth from here, unless your youngest brother come here.

16.sl: Pošljite enega izmed sebe, da pripelje vašega brata! Vi pa ostanete ujeti. Tako preizkusimo vaše besede, ali je resnica v njih. Če je ni, kakor živi faraon, ste ogleduhi.«
16.en: Send one of you, and let him get your brother, and you shall be bound, that your words may be tested, whether there is truth in you, or else by the life of Pharaoh surely you are spies.”

17.sl: Potem jih je dal skupaj zapreti za tri dni.
17.en: He put them all together into custody three days.

18.sl: Tretji dan jim je rekel: »To morate storiti, če hočete ostati živi. Bojim se Boga.
18.en: Joseph said to them the third day, “Do this, and live, for I fear God.

19.sl: Če ste pošteni, naj ostane eden izmed vas ujetnik v hiši, kjer ste bili zaprti. Vi pa pojdite in nesite žito za svoje sestradane hiše;
19.en: If you are honest men, then let one of your brothers be bound in your prison-house; but you go, carry grain for the famine of your houses.

20.sl: potem pripeljite svojega najmlajšega brata k meni! Tako se bodo vaše besede izkazale za resnične in ne boste umrli.« In storili so tako.
20.en:
Bring your youngest brother to me; so will your words be verified, and you won’t die.”
 They did so.

21.sl: Govorili so med seboj: »Resnično, pregrešili smo se nad svojim bratom, saj smo videli stisko njegove duše, ko nas je prosil usmiljenja, pa nismo poslušali; zato je prišla ta stiska nad nas.«
21.en: They said one to another, “We are most assuredly guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul, when he begged us, and we wouldn’t listen. Therefore this distress has come on us.”

22.sl: Ruben jim je odgovoril in rekel: »Ali vam nisem rekel: ›Ne pregrešite se nad otrokom!‹ Pa niste hoteli poslušati. Zdaj se od nas terja njegova kri.«
22.en: Reuben answered them, saying, “Didn’t I tell you, saying, ‘Don’t sin against the child,’ and you wouldn’t listen? Therefore also, behold, his blood is required.”

23.sl: Niso pa vedeli, da Jožef razume, ker je z njimi govoril po tolmaču.
23.en: They didn’t know that Joseph understood them; for there was an interpreter between them.

24.sl:
Obrnil se je proč od njih in se razjokal. Potem se je vrnil k njim in jim govoril.
 Vzel je izmed njih Simeona in ga dal zvezati pred njihovimi očmi.
24.en: He turned himself about from them, and wept, and he returned to them, and spoke to them, and took Simeon from among them, and bound him before their eyes.

25.sl: Potem je ukazal, naj jim napolnijo posode z žitom in jim vrnejo njihov denar, vsakemu v njegovo vrečo, ter jim dajo hrane za na pot. In storili so jim tako.
25.en: Then Joseph commanded to fill their bags with grain, and to restore every man’s money into his sack, and to give them food for the way. So it done to them.

26.sl: Naložili so žito na osle in odšli.
26.en: They loaded their donkeys with their grain, and departed from there.

27.sl: Na počivališču je eden razvezal svojo vrečo, da bi nakrmil osla. Pa je zagledal svoj denar. Bil je v žitni vreči na vrhu.
27.en: As one of them opened his sack to give his donkey food in the lodging-place, he saw his money. Behold, it was in the mouth of his sack.

28.sl: Rekel je bratom: »Denar mi je bil vrnjen. Tu je, glejte, v moji vreči!« Srce jim je zastalo in trepetajoč so se obračali drug k drugemu ter rekli: »Kaj nam je Bog to storil?«
28.en: He said to his brothers, “My money is restored! Behold, it is even in my sack.” Their hearts failed them, and they turned trembling one to another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”

29.sl: Potem so prišli k svojemu očetu Jakobu v kánaansko deželo, mu povedali vse, kar se jim je pripetilo, in rekli:
29.en: They came to Jacob their father to the land of Canaan, and told him all that had happened to them, saying,

30.sl: »Mož, ki je gospodar dežele, je trdo govoril z nami. Imel nas je za ogleduhe dežele.
30.en: “The man, the lord of the land, spoke roughly with us, and took us for spies of the country.

31.sl: Rekli smo mu: ›Pošteni smo, nismo ogleduhi.
31.en: We said to him, ‘We are honest men. We are no spies.

32.sl: Bilo nas je dvanajst bratov, sinov enega očeta; enega ni več, najmlajši pa je zdaj pri očetu v kánaanski deželi.‹
32.en: We are twelve brothers, sons of our father; one is no more, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.’

33.sl: Pa nam je mož, ki je gospodar dežele, rekel: ›Po tem bom spoznal, da ste pošteni: enega svojih bratov pustite pri meni, potem vzemite, kar potrebujete za svoje sestradane hiše in odidite!
33.en: The man, the lord of the land, said to us, ‘Hereby will I know that you are honest men. Leave one of your brothers with me, and take grain for the famine of your houses, and go your way.

34.sl: Pripeljite k meni svojega najmlajšega brata in videl bom, da niste ogleduhi, temveč poštenjaki! Vašega brata vam potem vrnem in smeli boste hoditi po deželi.‹«
34.en: Bring your youngest brother to me. Then I will know that you are not spies, but that you are honest men. So I will deliver your brother to you, and you shall trade in the land.’”

35.sl: Ko so praznili vreče, je vsak našel v svoji vreči mošnjo s svojim denarjem. Ko so sami in njihov oče videli te mošnje, so se prestrašili.
35.en: It happened as they emptied their sacks, that behold, every man’s bundle of money was in his sack. When they and their father saw their bundles of money, they were afraid.

36.sl: Oče Jakob jim je rekel: »Otroke mi jemljete; Jožefa ni več, Simeona ni več in še Benjamina mi jemljete! Vse prihaja nadme!«
36.en: Jacob, their father, said to them, “You have bereaved me of my children! Joseph is no more, Simeon is no more, and you want to take Benjamin away. All these things are against me.”

37.sl: Ruben je rekel očetu: »Moja sinova usmŕti, če ti ga ne pripeljem nazaj! Zaupaj ga moji roki in vrnil ti ga bom!«
37.en: Reuben spoke to his father, saying, “Kill my two sons, if I don’t bring him to you. Deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to you again.”

38.sl: Pa je rekel: »Moj sin ne pojde z vami. Kajti njegov brat je mrtev in ta je ostal sam. Če bi ga na poti, na katero boste odšli, zadela nesreča, bi spravili moje sive lase z žalostjo v podzemlje.«
38.en: He said, “My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he only is left. If harm happens to him by the way in which you go, then you will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.”

1.sl: Lakota je hudo pestila deželo.
1.en: The famine was severe in the land.

2.sl: Ko so pojedli vse žito, ki so ga prinesli iz Egipta, jim je oče rekel: »Pojdite in nam spet kupite nekaj živeža!«
2.en: It happened, when they had eaten up the grain which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again, buy us a little more food.”

3.sl: Juda mu je rekel: »Tisti mož nam je ostro zabičal in rekel: ›Ne boste videli mojega obličja, če ne pripeljete s seboj svojega brata.‹
3.en: Judah spoke to him, saying, “The man solemnly warned us, saying, ‘You shall not see my face, unless your brother is with you.’

4.sl: Če se odločiš, da pošlješ našega brata z nami, pojdemo in ti kupimo živeža.
4.en: If you will send our brother with us, we will go down and buy you food,

5.sl: Če ga pa nočeš poslati, ne gremo; kajti mož nam je rekel: ›Ne boste videli mojega obličja, če ne bo vašega brata z vami.‹«
5.en: but if you will not send him, we will not go down, for the man said to us, ‘You shall not see my face, unless your brother is with you.’”

6.sl: Izrael je rekel: »Zakaj ste mi storili to húdo, da ste možu povedali, da imate še enega brata?«
6.en: Israel said, “Why did you treat me so badly, telling the man that you had another brother?”

7.sl: Rekli so: »Mož nas je natančno spraševal o nas in o naši rodbini: ›Ali vaš oče še živi?‹ je rekel. ›Imate še kakega brata?‹ Morali smo mu odgovoriti na ta vprašanja. Kako bi mogli vedeti, da poreče: ›Pripeljite svojega brata.‹«
7.en: They said, “The man asked directly concerning ourselves, and concerning our relatives, saying, ‘Is your father still alive? Have you another brother?’ We just answered his questions. Is there any way we could know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother down?’”

8.sl: Juda pa je rekel očetu Izraelu: »Pošlji mladeniča z menoj, da se vzdignemo in odidemo, si ohranimo življenje in ne umremo ne ti ne mi ne naši otroci!
8.en: Judah said to Israel, his father, “Send the boy with me, and we will arise and go, so that we may live, and not die, both we, and you, and also our little ones.

9.sl: Jaz sem porok zanj. Iz mojih rok ga terjaj! Če ga ne pripeljem nazaj k tebi in ga ne postavim pred tvoje obličje, bom kriv pred teboj vse dni.
9.en: I will be collateral for him. From my hand will you require him. If I don’t bring him to you, and set him before you, then let me bear the blame forever,

10.sl: Kajti če ne bi odlašali, bi se zdaj že dvakrat vrnili.«
10.en: for unless we had lingered, surely we would have returned a second time by now.”

11.sl: Nato jim je oče Izrael rekel: »Če je tako, storite tole: denite najboljše pridelke dežele v svoje posode in nesite možu darilo: nekaj mastike in nekaj medu, kozlinca in ládana, pistacij in mandeljnov!
11.en: Their father, Israel, said to them, “If it be so now, do this. Take from the choice fruits of the land in your bags, and carry down a present for the man, a little balm, a little honey, spices and myrrh, nuts, and almonds;

12.sl: Vzemite s seboj dvakratno vsoto denarja; kajti denar, ki je bil vrnjen na vrhu vaših žitnih vreč, morate nesti nazaj in ga izročiti; nemara se je kdo zmotil.
12.en: and take double money in your hand, with the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks carry again in your hand. Perhaps it was an oversight.

13.sl: Tudi svojega brata vzemite, odpravite se in se vrnite k tistemu možu!
13.en: Take also your brother, and arise, go again to the man.

14.sl: Bog Mogočni pa naj vam nakloni usmiljenje tistega moža, da vam izpusti drugega vašega brata in Benjamina. Jaz pa, kakor sem bil brez otrok, sem spet brez njih!«
14.en: May God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may release to you your other brother and Benjamin. If I am bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.”

15.sl: Tedaj so možje vzeli to darilo, tudi dvakratno vsoto denarja so vzeli in Benjamina. Odpravili so se in odšli v Egipt ter stopili pred Jožefa.
15.en: The men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.

16.sl: Ko je Jožef videl pri njih Benjamina, je velel oskrbniku svoje hiše: »Pelji te može v hišo, zakolji žival in pripravi obed! Kajti ti možje bodo opoldne jedli z menoj.«
16.en: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the steward of his house, “Bring the men into the house, and butcher an animal, and make ready; for the men will dine with me at noon.”

17.sl: Mož je storil, kakor mu je Jožef naročil, in je peljal može v njegovo hišo.
17.en: The man did as Joseph commanded, and the man brought the men to Joseph’s house.

18.sl: Možje pa so se bali, ker so jih pripeljali v Jožefovo hišo, in so rekli: »Zaradi denarja, ki je bil zadnjič vrnjen v naše žitne vreče, nas vodijo noter. Hočejo nas obdolžiti, planiti na nas in nas vzeti za sužnje z našimi osli vred.«
18.en: The men were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph’s house; and they said, “Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall on us, and take us for bondservants, along with our donkeys.”

19.sl: Zato so stopili k oskrbniku Jožefove hiše in ga pred hišnimi vrati nagovorili.
19.en: They came near to the steward of Joseph’s house, and they spoke to him at the door of the house,

20.sl: Rekli so: »Prosimo, gospod! Zadnjič smo prišli sem, da kupimo živeža.
20.en: and said, “Oh, my lord, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:

21.sl: Ko pa smo prišli do počivališča in razvezali žitne vreče, je bil denar vsakega izmed nas na vrhu njegove vreče, naš denar v svoji polni teži; zato smo ga prinesli nazaj.
21.en: and it happened, when we came to the lodging-place, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man’s money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight. We have brought it again in our hand.

22.sl: Pa tudi drug denar smo prinesli s seboj, da kupimo živeža. Ne vemo, kdo je položil naš denar v žitne vreče.«
22.en: We have brought down other money in our hand to buy food. We don’t know who put our money in our sacks.”

23.sl: In oskrbnik je rekel: »Pomirite se, nikar se ne bojte! Vaš Bog in Bog vašega očeta vam je dal zaklad v žitne vreče; vaš denar je prišel do mene.« Potem je pripeljal k njim Simeona.
23.en: He said, “Peace be to you. Don’t be afraid. Your God, and the God of your father, has given you treasure in your sacks. I received your money.” He brought Simeon out to them.

24.sl: Nato je mož popeljal može v Jožefovo hišo in jim dal vode, da so si umili noge, in klaje njihovim oslom.
24.en: The man brought the men into Joseph’s house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet. He gave their donkeys fodder.

25.sl: Pripravili so darilo, preden bi opoldne prišel Jožef. Izvedeli so namreč, da bodo tam obedovali.
25.en: They made ready the present for Joseph’s coming at noon, for they heard that they should eat bread there.

26.sl: Ko je Jožef prišel v hišo, so mu izročili darilo, ki so ga imeli pri sebi v hiši, in so se mu priklonili do tal.
26.en: When Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed down themselves to him to the earth.

27.sl: Vprašal jih je, kako se jim godi, in rekel: »Ali se vašemu staremu očetu, o katerem ste govorili, dobro godi? Ali še živi?«
27.en: He asked them of their welfare, and said, “Is your father well, the old man of whom you spoke? Is he yet alive?”

28.sl: Rekli so: »Dobro se godi tvojemu služabniku, našemu očetu; še živi.« Pokleknili so in se priklonili.
28.en: They said, “Your servant, our father, is well. He is still alive.” They bowed the head, and did homage.

29.sl: Ko je vzdignil oči, je zagledal brata Benjamina, sina svoje matere, in rekel: »Ali je to vaš najmlajši brat, o katerem ste mi govorili?« In je rekel: »Bog ti bodi milostljiv, moj sin!«
29.en: He lifted up his eyes, and saw Benjamin, his brother, his mother’s son, and said, “Is this your youngest brother, of whom you spoke to me?” He said, “God be gracious to you, my son.”

30.sl: Potem je hitro odšel, kajti milo se mu je storilo pred bratom in bil je na tem, da zajoka. Šel je v sobo in se tam razjokal.
30.en: Joseph made haste; for his heart yearned over his brother: and he sought a place to weep; and he entered into his room, and wept there.

31.sl: Potem si je umil obraz in prišel ven. Ko se je obvladal, je rekel: »Prinesite jedi!«
31.en: He washed his face, and came out. He controlled himself, and said, “Serve the meal.”

32.sl: Prinesli so posebej njemu, posebej njim in posebej Egipčanom, ki so jedli z njim; kajti Egipčani ne smejo jesti skupaj s Hebrejci, ker je Egipčanom to gnusoba.
32.en: They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians, that ate with him, by themselves, because the Egyptians don’t eat bread with the Hebrews, for that is an abomination to the Egyptians.

33.sl: Sedeli pa so pred njim razvrščeni po starosti, od prvorojenega do najmlajšega. Začudeno so se spogledovali.
33.en: They sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth, and the men marveled one with another.

34.sl: Dal jim je nositi jedila izpred sebe. Benjaminov delež pa je bil petkrat večji kakor deleži vseh drugih. Pili so z njim in postali dobre volje.
34.en: He sent portions to them from before him, but Benjamin’s portion was five times as much as any of theirs. They drank, and were merry with him.

1.sl: Jožef je zapovedal oskrbniku svoje hiše in rekel: »Napolni žitne vreče teh mož z živežem, kolikor bodo mogli nesti, in položi vsakemu njegov denar na vrh vreče!
1.en: He commanded the steward of his house, saying, “Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.
