2.sl: Mojo čašo pa, srebrno čašo, deni na vrh žitne vreče najmlajšega skupaj z denarjem za žito!« In ta je storil, kakor mu je naročil Jožef.
2.en: Put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the youngest, with his grain money.” He did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.

3.sl: Ob jutranji svetlobi so odpustili može in njihove osle.
3.en: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their donkeys.

4.sl: Šli so iz mesta in še niso bili daleč, ko je Jožef ukazal oskrbniku svoje hiše: »Vzdigni se, hiti za možmi in ko jih dohitiš, jim reci: Zakaj ste dobro povrnili s hudim?
4.en: When they had gone out of the city, and were not yet far off, Joseph said to his steward, “Up, follow after the men. When you overtake them, ask them, ‘Why have you rewarded evil for good?

5.sl: Ali ni to tisto, iz česar moj gospod pije in s čimer vedežuje? Hudo ste ravnali, ko ste to storili.«
5.en: Isn’t this that from which my lord drinks, and by which he indeed divines? You have done evil in so doing.’”

6.sl: Ko jih je oskrbnik dohitel, jim je izrekel te besede.
6.en: He overtook them, and he spoke to them these words.

7.sl: Rekli so mu: »Kako more moj gospod reči kaj takega? Daleč naj bo od tvojih služabnikov, da bi storili kaj takega!
7.en: They said to him, “Why does my lord speak such words as these? Far be it from your servants that they should do such a thing!

8.sl: Glej, denar, ki smo ga našli na vrhu svojih žitnih vreč, smo prinesli nazaj k tebi iz kánaanske dežele. Kako bi torej mogli ukrasti iz hiše tvojega gospoda srebro ali zlato?
8.en: Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought again to you out of the land of Canaan. How then should we steal silver or gold out of your lord’s house?

9.sl: Če se predmet najde pri katerem izmed tvojih služabnikov, naj ta umre, mi pa bomo sužnji mojemu gospodu.«
9.en: With whoever of your servants it be found, let him die, and we also will be my lord’s bondservants.”

10.sl: »Prav,« je rekel, »naj bo, kakor pravite: tisti, pri katerem se najde, mi bo suženj, vi pa boste prosti krivde.«
10.en: He said, “Now also let it be according to your words: he with whom it is found will be my bondservant; and you will be blameless.”

11.sl: Hitro je postavil vsak svojo žitno vrečo na tla in jo razvezal.
11.en: Then they hurried, and took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.

12.sl: In oskrbnik je preiskoval: začel je pri najstarejšem, končal pa pri najmlajšem. Čašo je našel v Benjaminovi žitni vreči.
12.en: He searched, beginning with the eldest, and ending at the youngest. The cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.

13.sl: Tedaj so pretrgali oblačila, otovorili vsak svojega osla in se vrnili v mesto.
13.en: Then they tore their clothes, and loaded every man his donkey, and returned to the city.

14.sl: Tako so prišli Juda in njegovi bratje v Jožefovo hišo, ko je bil ta še tam. Vrgli so se pred njim na tla.
14.en: Judah and his brothers came to Joseph’s house, and he was still there. They fell on the ground before him.

15.sl: Jožef jim je rekel: »Kaj ste vendar storili! Ali ne veste, da zna mož, kakršen sem jaz, vedeževati?«
15.en: Joseph said to them, “What deed is this that you have done? Don’t you know that such a man as I can indeed divine?”

16.sl: Juda je rekel: »Kaj naj rečemo mojemu gospodu? Kaj naj govorimo in s čim naj se opravičimo? Bog je našel krivdo na tvojih služabnikih. Zdaj smo sužnji mojega gospoda, tako mi kakor ta, pri katerem se je našla čaša.«
16.en: Judah said, “What will we tell my lord? What will we speak? Or how will we clear ourselves? God has found out the iniquity of your servants. Behold, we are my lord’s bondservants, both we, and he also in whose hand the cup is found.”

17.sl: Jožef pa je rekel: »Daleč naj bo od mene, da bi to storil! Mož, pri katerem se je našla čaša, mi bo suženj, vi pa pojdite v miru k svojemu očetu!«
17.en: He said, “Far be it from me that I should do so. The man in whose hand the cup is found, he will be my bondservant; but as for you, go up in peace to your father.”

18.sl: Tedaj je Juda stopil k njemu in rekel: »Prosim, moj gospod, naj sme tvoj služabnik mojemu gospodu spregovoriti v ušesa besedo. Naj se ne vname tvoja jeza zoper tvojega služabnika! Saj si kakor faraon.
18.en: Then Judah came near to him, and said, “Oh, my lord, please let your servant speak a word in my lord’s ears, and don’t let your anger burn against your servant; for you are even as Pharaoh.

19.sl: Moj gospod je vprašal svoje služabnike in rekel: ›Ali imate še očeta ali brata?‹
19.en: My lord asked his servants, saying, ‘Have you a father, or a brother?’

20.sl: Mi pa smo rekli mojemu gospodu: ›Imamo še starega očeta in dečka, ki se mu je rodil v starosti. Njegov brat je umrl. Tako je ostal sam od svoje matere in oče ga ljubi.‹
20.en: We said to my lord, ‘We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother; and his father loves him.’

21.sl: Ti pa si rekel svojim služabnikom: ›Pripeljite ga k meni, da ga vidim s svojimi očmi!‹
21.en: You said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set my eyes on him.’

22.sl: Rekli smo mojemu gospodu: ›Mladenič ne more zapustiti očeta; če bi zapustil očeta, bi ta umrl.‹
22.en: We said to my lord, ‘The boy can’t leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.’

23.sl: Potem si rekel svojim služabnikom: ›Če ne pride z vami vaš najmlajši brat, ne boste več videli mojega obličja.‹
23.en: You said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you will see my face no more.’

24.sl: Ko pa smo prišli k svojemu očetu, tvojemu služabniku, smo mu sporočili besede mojega gospoda.
24.en: It happened when we came up to your servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.

25.sl: Naš oče je rekel: ›Vrnite se in nam kupite nekaj živeža!‹
25.en: Our father said, ‘Go again, buy us a little food.’

26.sl: Pa smo mu rekli: ›Ne moremo iti; le če bo naš najmlajši brat z nami, pojdemo; kajti ne smemo videti moževega obličja, če ni z nami našega najmlajšega brata.‹
26.en: We said, ‘We can’t go down. If our youngest brother is with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man’s face, unless our youngest brother is with us.’

27.sl: Moj oče, tvoj služabnik, nam je rekel: ›Veste, da mi je žena rodila dva sinova.
27.en: Your servant, my father, said to us, ‘You know that my wife bore me two sons:

28.sl: Eden je odšel od mene in sem rekel: Zares, raztrgan je, raztrgan! Do danes ga nisem več videl.
28.en: and the one went out from me, and I said, “Surely he is torn in pieces;” and I haven’t seen him since.

29.sl: Če vzamete še tega izpred mojega obličja in ga zadene nesreča, spravite moje sive lase od hudega v podzemlje.‹
29.en: If you take this one also from me, and harm happens to him, you will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.’

30.sl: Ko bi torej jaz zdaj prišel k svojemu očetu, tvojemu služabniku, in bi ne bilo mladeniča, na čigar dušo je navezana njegova duša,
30.en: Now therefore when I come to your servant my father, and the boy is not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the boy’s life;

31.sl: bi oče  umrl, ko bi videl, da ni mladeniča. Tako bi tvoji služabniki res spravili sive lase svojega očeta, tvojega služabnika, z žalostjo v podzemlje.
31.en: it will happen, when he sees that the boy is no more, that he will die. Your servants will bring down the gray hairs of your servant, our father, with sorrow to Sheol.

32.sl: Kajti tvoj služabnik je zastavil sebe za mladeniča pri svojem očetu, ko je rekel: ›Če ga ne pripeljem k tebi, bom jaz kriv pred očetom vse dni.‹
32.en: For your servant became collateral for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I don’t bring him to you, then I will bear the blame to my father forever.’

33.sl: Naj torej zdaj, prosim, tvoj služabnik ostane namesto mladeniča za sužnja mojemu gospodu; mladenič pa naj gre z brati!
33.en: Now therefore, please let your servant stay instead of the boy, a bondservant to my lord; and let the boy go up with his brothers.

34.sl: Kako naj namreč grem brez mladeniča k očetu? Ne bi mogel gledati bridkosti, ki bi zadela mojega očeta.«
34.en: For how will I go up to my father, if the boy isn’t with me? Lest I see the evil that will come on my father.”

1.sl: Tedaj se Jožef ni mogel več premagovati vpričo vseh, ki so stali pri njem. Zaklical je: »Pošljite ven vse moje ljudi!« Tako ni bilo nikogar pri Jožefu, ko se je dal spoznati bratom.
1.en: Then Joseph couldn’t control himself before all those who stood before him, and he cried, “Cause every man to go out from me!” There stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known to his brothers.

2.sl: Potem je glasno zajokal, tako da so slišali Egipčani in slišala je faraonova hiša.
2.en: He wept aloud. The Egyptians heard, and the house of Pharaoh heard.

3.sl: Jožef je rekel bratom: »Jaz sem Jožef! Ali moj oče še živi?« Bratje pa mu niso mogli odgovoriti; tako so osupnili pred njim.
3.en:
Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph! Does my father still live?”
 His brothers couldn’t answer him; for they were terrified at his presence.

4.sl: Potem je Jožef rekel svojim bratom: »Stopite bliže k meni!« In ko so se mu približali, je rekel: »Jaz sem Jožef, vaš brat, ki ste ga prodali v Egipt.
4.en:
Joseph said to his brothers, “Come near to me, please.”
 They came near. “He said, I am Joseph, your brother, whom you sold into Egypt.

5.sl: Toda zdaj se nikar ne žalostite in si ne očitajte, da ste me prodali sem! Kajti Bog me je poslal pred vami, da vas ohrani pri življenju.
5.en: Now don’t be grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that you sold me here, for God sent me before you to preserve life.

6.sl: Že dve leti vlada lakota v notranjosti dežele in bo še pet let, ko ne bodo ne orali ne želi.
6.en: For these two years the famine has been in the land, and there are yet five years, in which there will be neither plowing nor harvest.

7.sl: Zato me je Bog poslal pred vami, da vam zagotovi ostanek v deželi, da vas ohrani pri življenju za veliko rešitev.
7.en: God sent me before you to preserve you a remnant in the earth, and to save you alive by a great deliverance.

8.sl: Tako me torej niste vi poslali sem, temveč Bog, ki me je postavil faraonu za očeta in za gospodarja vsej njegovi hiši ter za vladarja vse egiptovske dežele.
8.en: So now it wasn’t you who sent me here, but God, and he has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of all his house, and ruler over all the land of Egypt.

9.sl: Pojdite hitro k mojemu očetu in mu recite: ›Tako govori tvoj sin Jožef: Bog me je postavil za gospodarja vsemu Egiptu; pridi k meni, nikar se ne múdi!
9.en: Hurry, and go up to my father, and tell him, ‘This is what your son Joseph says, “God has made me lord of all Egypt. Come down to me. Don’t wait.

10.sl: Prebival boš v gošenski deželi in boš blizu mene, ti in tvoji sinovi in sinovi tvojih sinov, tvoja drobnica in tvoje govedo in vse, kar imaš.
10.en: You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you will be near to me, you, your children, your children’s children, your flocks, your herds, and all that you have.

11.sl: Tam bom poskrbel zate, kajti še pet let bo lakota, da ne obubožaš ti, tvoja hiša in vsi tvoji.‹
11.en: There I will nourish you; for there are yet five years of famine; lest you come to poverty, you, and your household, and all that you have.”’

12.sl: Glejte, vaše oči in oči mojega brata Benjamina vidijo, da moja usta govorijo z vami.
12.en: Behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaks to you.

13.sl: Naznanite torej mojemu očetu vse moje dostojanstvo v Egiptu in vse, kar ste videli, ter mojega očeta hitro pripeljite sem!«
13.en: You shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that you have seen. You shall hurry and bring my father down here.”

14.sl: Potem se je oklenil brata Benjamina okoli vratu in jokal; tudi Benjamin je jokal ob njegovem vratu.
14.en: He fell on his brother Benjamin’s neck, and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.

15.sl: Nato je poljubil vse brate in jokal pri njih. Potem so njegovi bratje govorili z njim.
15.en: He kissed all his brothers, and wept on them. After that his brothers talked with him.

16.sl: V faraonovi hiši se je zaslišal glas in so rekli: »Jožefovi bratje so prišli!« To je bilo faraonu in njegovim služabnikom všeč.
16.en: The report of it was heard in Pharaoh’s house, saying, “Joseph’s brothers have come.” It pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.

17.sl: Faraon je rekel Jožefu: »Reci svojim bratom: ›Tole storite! Otovorite svojo živino in pojdite hitro v kánaansko deželo!
17.en: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Tell your brothers, ‘Do this. Load your animals, and go, travel to the land of Canaan.

18.sl: Vzemite očeta in svoje družine in pridite k meni! Dal vam bom, kar je najboljšega v egiptovski deželi; uživali boste obilje  dežele.‹
18.en: Take your father and your households, and come to me, and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.’

19.sl: Ti pa jim narôči: ›Tole storite: vzemite si iz egiptovske dežele vozove za svoje otroke in žene; posadite tudi očeta na voz in pridite!
19.en: Now you are commanded: do this. Take wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.

20.sl: Vašemu očesu naj ne bo žal zaradi vaše opreme, saj bo vaše vse, kar je v vsej egiptovski deželi najboljšega.‹«
20.en: Also, don’t concern yourselves about your belongings, for the good of all of the land of Egypt is yours.”

21.sl: Izraelovi sinovi so storili tako. Jožef jim je dal vozove po faraonovem naročilu; dal jim je tudi živeža na pot.
21.en: The sons of Israel did so. Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.

22.sl: Vsakemu od njih je dal praznično oblačilo, Benjaminu pa tristo srebrnikov in pet prazničnih oblačil.
22.en: To all of them he gave each man changes of clothing, but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and five changes of clothing.

23.sl: Očetu je poslal deset oslov, obloženih z najboljšimi rečmi iz Egipta, in deset oslic, obloženih z žitom, kruhom in živili, očetu za pot.
23.en: To his father, he sent after this manner: ten donkeys loaded with the good things of Egypt, and ten female donkeys loaded with grain and bread and provision for his father by the way.

24.sl: Potem je brate odslovil. Ko so odhajali, jim je rekel: »Ne prepirajte se  med potjo!«
24.en: So he sent his brothers away, and they departed. He said to them, “See that you don’t quarrel on the way.”

25.sl: Tako so odšli iz Egipta in prišli v kánaansko deželo k svojemu očetu Jakobu.
25.en: They went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan, to Jacob their father.

26.sl: Povedali so mu in rekli: »Jožef še živi in je celó vladar nad vso egiptovsko deželo!« A njegovo srce je ostalo hladno, ker jim ni verjel.
26.en: They told him, saying, “Joseph is still alive, and he is ruler over all the land of Egypt.” His heart fainted, for he didn’t believe them.

27.sl: Tedaj so mu ponovili vse besede, ki jim jih je rekel Jožef. In ko je videl vozove, ki jih je Jožef poslal, da bi ga odpeljali, je oživel duh njihovega očeta Jakoba.
27.en: They told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said to them. When he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob, their father, revived.

28.sl: Izrael je rekel: »Zadosti! Moj sin Jožef še živi! Pojdem, da ga vidim, preden umrem.«
28.en: Israel said, “It is enough. Joseph my son is still alive. I will go and see him before I die.”

1.sl: Izrael se je odpravil z vsem, kar je imel. Ko je prišel do Beeršébe, je Bogu svojega očeta Izaka daroval klavne daritve.
1.en: Israel traveled with all that he had, and came to Beersheba, and offered sacrifices to the God of his father, Isaac.

2.sl: Bog je rekel Izraelu v nočnih prikaznih: »Jakob, Jakob!« In ta je rekel: »Tukaj sem.«
2.en:
God spoke to Israel in the visions of the night, and said, “Jacob, Jacob!”
 He said, “Here I am.”

3.sl: Rekel je: »Jaz sem Bog, Bog tvojega očeta. Ne boj se iti v Egipt, kajti tam bom iz tebe naredil velik narod.
3.en: He said, “I am God, the God of your father. Don’t be afraid to go down into Egypt; for there I will make of you a great nation.

4.sl: S teboj pojdem v Egipt in te gotovo tudi popeljem nazaj. Jožef ti bo s svojo roko zatisnil oči.«
4.en: I will go down with you into Egypt. I will also surely bring you up again. Joseph will close your eyes.”

5.sl: Jakob se je vzdignil iz Beeršébe. Izraelovi sinovi so posadili očeta Jakoba, svoje otroke in žene na vozove, ki jih je poslal faraon, da bi ga odpeljali.
5.en: Jacob rose up from Beersheba, and the sons of Israel carried Jacob, their father, their little ones, and their wives, in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.

6.sl: Vzeli so tudi živino in imetje, ki so ga pridobili v kánaanski deželi. Tako so Jakob in z njim vsi njegovi potomci prišli v Egipt,
6.en: They took their cattle, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt-- Jacob, and all his seed with him,

7.sl: njegovi sinovi in sinovi njegovih sinov, njegove hčere in hčere njegovih sinov. Vse svoje potomstvo je pripeljal s seboj v Egipt.
7.en: his sons, and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters, and his sons’ daughters, and he brought all his seed with him into Egypt.

8.sl: In to so imena Izraelovih sinov, ki so prišli v Egipt: Jakob in njegovi sinovi: Jakobov prvorojenec Ruben.
8.en: These are the names of the children of Israel, who came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons: Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn.

9.sl: Rubenovi sinovi: Henoh, Palú, Hecrón in Karmí.
9.en: The sons of Reuben: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

10.sl: Simeonovi sinovi: Jemuél, Jamín, Ohad, Jahín, Cohar in Šaúl, sin Kánaanke.
10.en: The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman.

11.sl: Levijevi sinovi: Geršón, Kehát in Merarí.
11.en: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

12.sl: Judovi sinovi: Er, Onán, Šelá, Perec in Zerah. Er in Onán sta umrla v kánaanski deželi, Perecova sinova pa sta bila Hecrón in Hamúl.
12.en: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

13.sl: Isahárjevi sinovi: Tolá, Puvá, Job  in Šimrón.
13.en: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puvah, Iob, and Shimron.

14.sl: Zábulonovi sinovi: Sered, Elón in Jahleél.
14.en: The sons of Zebulun: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

15.sl: To so Leini sinovi, ki jih je rodila Jakobu v Mezopotamiji kakor tudi hčer Dino. Njegovih sinov in hčera je bilo skupaj triintrideset duš.
15.en: These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Paddan Aram, with his daughter Dinah. All the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty-three.

16.sl: Gadovi sinovi: Cifjón, Hagí, Šuní, Ecbón, Erí, Aród in Arelí.
16.en: The sons of Gad: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

17.sl: Aserjevi sinovi: Jimná, Jišvá, Jišví, Berijá in njihova sestra Sêraha. Berijájeva sinova pa sta Heber in Malkiél.
17.en: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and Serah their sister. The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.

18.sl: To so sinovi Zilpe, ki jo je Labán dal svoji hčeri Lei; te je rodila Jakobu: šestnajst duš.
18.en: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah, his daughter, and these she bore to Jacob, even sixteen souls.

19.sl: Sinova Jakobove žene Rahele: Jožef in Benjamin.
19.en: The sons of Rachel, Jacob’s wife: Joseph and Benjamin.

20.sl: Jožefu sta se rodila v egiptovski deželi Manáse in Efrájim, ki mu jih je rodila Asenáta, hči Potifêra, duhovnika v Onu.
20.en: To Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, bore to him.

21.sl: Benjaminovi sinovi: Bela, Beher, Ašbél, Gerá, Naamán, Ehí, Roš, Mupím, Hupím in Ard.
21.en: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.

22.sl: To so Rahelini sinovi, ki so se rodili Jakobu, skupaj štirinajst duš.
22.en: These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.

23.sl: Danov sin: Huším.
23.en: The son of Dan: Hushim.

24.sl: Neftálijevi sinovi: Jahceél, Guní, Jecer in Šilém.
24.en: The sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

25.sl: To so sinovi Bilhe, ki jo je Labán dal svoji hčeri Raheli; te je rodila Jakobu, skupaj sedem duš.
25.en: These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to Rachel, his daughter, and these she bore to Jacob: all the souls were seven.

26.sl: Vseh duš, ki so prišle z Jakobom v Egipt, tistih, ki so izšli iz njega, brez žen Jakobovih sinov, je bilo skupaj šestinšestdeset duš.
26.en: All the souls who came with Jacob into Egypt, who were his direct descendants, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives, all the souls were sixty-six.

27.sl: Jožefova sinova, ki sta se mu rodila v Egiptu: dve duši. Vseh duš Jakobove hiše, ki so prišli v Egipt, je bilo sedemdeset.
27.en: The sons of Joseph, who were born to him in Egypt, were two souls. All the souls of the house of Jacob, who came into Egypt, were seventy.

28.sl: Poslal je Juda pred seboj k Jožefu, naj pride pred njim v Gošen. Tako so prišli v deželo Gošen.
28.en: He sent Judah before him to Joseph, to show the way before him to Goshen, and they came into the land of Goshen.

29.sl: Tedaj je Jožef napregel svoj voz in šel očetu naproti v Gošen. Ko ga je ta zagledal, se ga je oklenil okoli vratu in dolgo jokal ob njegovem vratu.
29.en: Joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to meet Israel, his father, in Goshen. He presented himself to him, and fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.

30.sl: Izrael je rekel Jožefu: »Zdaj rad umrem, ko sem videl tvoje obličje, da še živiš!«
30.en: Israel said to Joseph, “Now let me die, since I have seen your face, that you are still alive.”

31.sl: Potem je Jožef rekel bratom in očetovi hiši: »Pojdem poročat faraonu in mu rečem: ›Moji bratje in hiša mojega očeta, ki so bili v kánaanski deželi, so prišli k meni.
31.en: Joseph said to his brothers, and to his father’s house, “I will go up, and speak with Pharaoh, and will tell him, ‘My brothers, and my father’s house, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.

32.sl: Ti možje so pastirji drobnice; kajti živinorejci so bili in so pripeljali svojo drobnico in govedo in vse, kar imajo.‹
32.en: These men are shepherds, for they have been keepers of cattle, and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.’

33.sl: Če vas torej faraon pokliče in vpraša, kaj je vaš poklic,
33.en: It will happen, when Pharaoh summons you, and will say, ‘What is your occupation?’

34.sl: recite: ›Živinorejci so bili tvoji služabniki od mladosti do zdaj, mi in naši očetje.‹ Tako boste smeli prebivati v gošenski deželi, kajti Egipčanom je zoprn vsak pastir drobnice.«
34.en: that you shall say, ‘Your servants have been keepers of cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and our fathers:’ that you may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination to the Egyptians.”

1.sl: Jožef je tedaj šel in povedal faraonu ter rekel: »Moj oče in moji bratje so prišli iz kánaanske dežele s svojo drobnico in govedom in z vsem, kar imajo; in glej, so v gošenski deželi.«
1.en: Then Joseph went in and told Pharaoh, and said, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks, their herds, and all that they own, have come out of the land of Canaan; and, behold, they are in the land of Goshen.”

2.sl: Od vseh bratov jih je vzel pet in jih postavil pred faraona.
2.en: From among his brothers he took five men, and presented them to Pharaoh.

3.sl: Faraon je rekel njegovim bratom: »Kaj je vaš poklic?« Rekli so faraonu: »Pastirji drobnice so tvoji služabniki, mi in naši očetje.«
3.en:
Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?”
 They said to Pharaoh, “Your servants are shepherds, both we, and our fathers.”

4.sl: Potem so rekli: »Prišli smo, da bi kot tujci prebivali v tej deželi; kajti ni paše za našo drobnico, ki jo imajo tvoji služabniki, ker lakota pritiska v kánaanski deželi. Zdaj pa prosimo, da bi smeli tvoji služabniki bivati v gošenski deželi.«
4.en: They said to Pharaoh, “We have come to live as foreigners in the land, for there is no pasture for your servants’ flocks. For the famine is severe in the land of Canaan. Now therefore, please let your servants dwell in the land of Goshen.”

5.sl: Faraon je tedaj rekel Jožefu: »Tvoj oče in tvoji bratje so prišli k tebi.
5.en: Pharaoh spoke to Joseph, saying, “Your father and your brothers have come to you.

6.sl: Egiptovska dežela je pred teboj. V najboljšem delu dežele nasêli očeta in brate! Naj prebivajo v gošenski deželi! In če veš, da so med njimi zmožni možje, jih postavi za nadzornike moje živine!«
6.en: The land of Egypt is before you. Make your father and your brothers dwell in the best of the land. Let them dwell in the land of Goshen. If you know any able men among them, then put them in charge of my cattle.”

7.sl: Potem je Jožef pripeljal očeta Jakoba in ga predstavil faraonu. Jakob je blagoslovil faraona.
7.en: Joseph brought in Jacob, his father, and set him before Pharaoh, and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

8.sl: In faraon je rekel Jakobu: »Koliko let je tvojega življenja?«
8.en: Pharaoh said to Jacob, “How many are the days of the years of your life?”

9.sl: Jakob je rekel faraonu: »Dni mojega popotovanja je sto trideset let; malo jih je in huda so bila leta mojega življenja in ne dosegajo let življenja mojih očetov v dnevih njihovega popotovanja.«
9.en: Jacob said to Pharaoh, “The days of the years of my pilgrimage are one hundred thirty years. Few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, and they have not attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.”

10.sl: Potem je Jakob blagoslovil faraona in odšel izpred faraonovega obličja.
10.en: Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from the presence of Pharaoh.

11.sl: Jožef je naselil očeta in brate in jim dal posest v egiptovski deželi, v najboljšem delu dežele, v Ramesésovi pokrajini, kakor je zapovedal faraon.
11.en: Joseph placed his father and his brothers, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.

12.sl: In Jožef je preskrboval očeta in brate in vso očetovo hišo z živežem po številu otrok.
12.en: Joseph nourished his father, his brothers, and all of his father’s household, with bread, according to their families.

13.sl: V vsej deželi ni bilo kruha, kajti lakota je hudo pritiskala. Egiptovska in kánaanska dežela sta bili izčrpani od lakote.
13.en: There was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very severe, so that the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan fainted by reason of the famine.

14.sl: Jožef je pobral ves denar, ki se je našel v egiptovski in v kánaanski deželi, za žito, ki so ga kupovali; in ta denar je spravil v faraonovo hišo.
14.en: Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, for the grain which they bought: and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s house.

15.sl: Ko je pošel ves denar v egiptovski in v kánaanski deželi, so prihajali vsi Egipčani k Jožefu in govorili: »Daj nam kruha! Zakaj bi umirali pred teboj, ker je zmanjkalo denarja?«
15.en: When the money was all spent in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph, and said, “Give us bread, for why should we die in your presence? For our money fails.”

16.sl: Jožef je rekel: »Pripeljite svojo živino in dam vam ga v zameno zanjo, če je zmanjkalo denarja.«
16.en: Joseph said, “Give your cattle; and I will give you food for your cattle, if money fails.”

17.sl: Ko so pripeljali svojo živino k Jožefu, jim je dal živeža v zameno za konje, drobnico, govedo in osle. Tako jih je preskrbel za to leto z živežem v zameno za njihovo živino.
17.en: They brought their cattle to Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses, and for the flocks, and for the herds, and for the donkeys: and he fed them with bread in exchange for all their cattle for that year.

18.sl: Ko je preteklo to leto, so tudi drugo leto prišli k njemu in mu rekli: »Ne moremo ti prikrivati, moj gospod, da je denar pošel in da je naša živina prešla v last mojega gospoda. Nič drugega ne ostaja pred mojim gospodom kakor naša telesa in naša zemlja.
18.en: When that year was ended, they came to him the second year, and said to him, “We will not hide from my lord how our money is all spent, and the herds of cattle are my lord’s. There is nothing left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies, and our lands.

19.sl: Zakaj bi umirali pred tvojimi očmi s svojo zemljo vred? Kupi nas in našo zemljo za živež, pa bomo mi in naša zemlja zasužnjeni faraonu. Daj semena, da ostanemo pri življenju in ne umremo in da zemlja ne bo opustošena!«
19.en: Why should we die before your eyes, both we and our land? Buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh. Give us seed, that we may live, and not die, and that the land won’t be desolate.”

20.sl: Tako je Jožef kupil vso egiptovsko deželo za faraona, kajti vsak Egipčan je prodal svoje polje, ker jih je stiskala lakota; in dežela je postala faraonova lastnina.
20.en: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh, for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine was severe on them, and the land became Pharaoh’s.

21.sl: Ljudstvo pa je preselil v mesta  od enega do drugega konca egiptovske pokrajine.
21.en: As for the people, he moved them to the cities from one end of the border of Egypt even to the other end of it.

22.sl: Le zemlje duhovnikov ni pokupil, kajti duhovniki so imeli od faraona določen dohodek in so živeli od tega dohodka, ki jim ga je dal faraon; zato jim ni bilo treba prodati zemlje.
22.en: Only he didn’t buy the land of the priests, for the priests had a portion from Pharaoh, and ate their portion which Pharaoh gave them. That is why they didn’t sell their land.

23.sl: Tedaj je Jožef rekel ljudstvu: »Glejte, danes sem kupil vas in vašo zemljo za faraona. Tu imate seme, da posejete zemljo.
23.en: Then Joseph said to the people, “Behold, I have bought you and your land today for Pharaoh. Behold, here is seed for you, and you shall sow the land.

24.sl: Od pridelkov boste dali eno petino faraonu, štiri petine pa boste imeli kot seme za polje in kot hrano zase, za tiste, ki živijo v vaših hišah, in za hrano svojih otrok.«
24.en: It will happen at the harvests, that you shall give a fifth to Pharaoh, and four parts will be your own, for seed of the field, for your food, for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.”

25.sl: Rekli so: »Ohranil si nam življenje. Da bi le našli naklonjenost v tvojih očeh, moj gospod, pa bomo radi za sužnje faraonu!«
25.en: They said, “You have saved our lives! Let us find favor in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.”

26.sl: Tako je Jožef naredil zakon o egiptovski zemlji, ki velja še danes, da gre petina faraonu. Samo zemlja duhovnikov ni postala faraonova.
26.en: Joseph made it a statute concerning the land of Egypt to this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth. Only the land of the priests alone didn’t become Pharaoh’s.

27.sl: Izrael se je naselil v egiptovski deželi v gošenski pokrajini. Dobili so jo v last, bili so rodovitni in so se silno namnožili.
27.en: Israel lived in the land of Egypt, in the land of Goshen; and they got themselves possessions therein, and were fruitful, and multiplied exceedingly.

28.sl: Jakob pa je živel v egiptovski deželi sedemnajst let in vseh Jakobovih dni, let njegovega življenja, je bilo sto sedeminštirideset let.
28.en: Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years. So the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were one hundred forty-seven years.

29.sl: Ko so se Izraelu približali dnevi njegove smrti, je poklical sina Jožefa in mu rekel: »Če sem našel naklonjenost v tvojih očeh, položi, prosim, svojo roko pod moja ledja in izkaži mi dobroto in zvestobo; nikar me ne pokoplji v Egiptu!
29.en: The time drew near that Israel must die, and he called his son Joseph, and said to him, “If now I have found favor in your sight, please put your hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me. Please don’t bury me in Egypt,

30.sl: Pri svojih očetih bi rad počival; pelji me nazaj iz Egipta in me pokoplji v njihovem grobišču!« Rekel je: »Storil bom po tvoji besedi.«
30.en:
but when I sleep with my fathers, you shall carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their burying place.”
 He said, “I will do as you have said.”

31.sl: Ko je rekel: »Prisezi mi!« mu je prisegel. In Izrael se je priklonil proti vzglavju svoje postelje.
31.en:
He said, “Swear to me,”
 and he swore to him. Israel bowed himself on the bed’s head.

1.sl: Po teh dogodkih so sporočili Jožefu: »Tvoj oče je bolan.« Vzel je s seboj svoja sinova: Manáseja in Efrájima.
1.en: It happened after these things, that someone said to Joseph, “Behold, your father is sick.” He took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.

2.sl: Jakobu so povedali: »Tvoj sin Jožef prihaja k tebi.« Izrael je tedaj zbral moči in se usedel na postelji.
2.en: Someone told Jacob, and said, “Behold, your son Joseph comes to you,” and Israel strengthened himself, and sat on the bed.

3.sl: Jakob je rekel Jožefu: »Bog Mogočni se mi je prikazal v Luzu v kánaanski deželi in me blagoslovil
3.en: Jacob said to Joseph, “God Almighty appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,

4.sl: ter mi rekel: ›Naredil te bom rodovitnega in te namnožil in naredil bom iz tebe občestvo ljudstev. To deželo dajem tvojemu potomstvu za teboj v večno last.
4.en: and said to me, ‘Behold, I will make you fruitful, and multiply you, and I will make of you a company of peoples, and will give this land to your seed after you for an everlasting possession.’

5.sl: In tvoja sinova, ki sta se ti rodila v egiptovski deželi, preden sem prišel k tebi v Egipt, naj bosta moja: Efrájim in Manáse naj bosta moja kakor Ruben in Simeon.
5.en: Now your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you into Egypt, are mine; Ephraim and Manasseh, even as Reuben and Simeon, will be mine.

6.sl: Toda tvoji otroci, rojeni za njima, naj bodo tvoji; po imenu svojih bratov naj se imenujejo pri svoji dediščini!‹
6.en: Your issue, who you become the father of after them, will be yours. They will be called after the name of their brothers in their inheritance.

7.sl: Ko sem prišel iz Mezopotamije, mi je v kánaanski deželi na poti umrla Rahela, ko je bilo še kos poti do Efráte. Tam sem jo pokopal, ob poti v Efráto, to je Betlehem.«
7.en: As for me, when I came from Paddan, Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan in the way, when there was still some distance to come to Ephrath, and I buried her there in the way to Ephrath (the same is Bethlehem).”

8.sl: Ko je Izrael videl Jožefova sinova, je rekel: »Kdo sta ta dva?«
8.en: Israel saw Joseph’s sons, and said, “Who are these?”

9.sl: Jožef je rekel očetu: »Moja sinova sta, ki mi ju je tukaj dal Bog.« Rekel je: »Pripelji ju, prosim, k meni, da ju blagoslovim!«
9.en:
Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.”
 He said, “Please bring them to me, and I will bless them.”

10.sl: Izraelove oči so zaradi starosti postale motne, da ni mogel prav videti. Jožef ju je pripeljal bliže in Izrael ju je poljubil in objel.
10.en: Now the eyes of Israel were dim for age, so that he couldn’t see. He brought them near to him; and he kissed them, and embraced them.

11.sl: Potem je Izrael rekel Jožefu: »Nisem mislil, da bom še videl tvoje obličje, a glej, Bog mi je dal videti tudi tvoja potomca.«
11.en: Israel said to Joseph, “I didn’t think I would see your face, and, behold, God has let me see your seed also.”

12.sl: Nato ju je Jožef odmaknil od njegovih kolen in se priklonil z obrazom do tal.
12.en: Joseph brought them out from between his knees, and he bowed himself with his face to the earth.

13.sl: Jožef je vzel oba, Efrájima s svojo desnico na Izraelovo levico in Manáseja s svojo levico na Izraelovo desnico ter ju primaknil blizu k njemu.
13.en: Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel’s left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel’s right hand, and brought them near to him.

14.sl: Izrael je iztegnil desnico in jo položil na Efrájimovo glavo, čeprav je bil mlajši, levico pa na Manásejevo glavo. Tako je prekrižal roki; ker je bil Manáse prvorojenec.
14.en: Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it on Ephraim’s head, who was the younger, and his left hand on Manasseh’s head, guiding his hands knowingly, for Manasseh was the firstborn.

15.sl:
Potem je blagoslovil Jožefa, rekoč:
 »Bog, pred čigar obličjem sta hodila moja očeta Abraham in Izak,
 Bog, ki mi je bil pastir, odkar živim, do tega dne,
15.en: He blessed Joseph, and said, “The God before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk, the God who has fed me all my life long to this day,

16.sl:
angel, ki me je rešil vsega hudega: naj blagoslovi ta mladeniča!
 Naj se po njiju kliče moje ime in ime mojih očetov Abrahama in Izaka!
 In razrasteta naj se v množico sredi dežele!«
16.en: the angel who has redeemed me from all evil, bless the lads, and let my name be named on them, and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac. Let them grow into a multitude in the midst of the earth.”

17.sl: Jožef je videl, da je njegov oče položil desnico na Efrájimovo glavo, to pa mu ni bilo všeč. Zato je prijel očetovo roko, da bi jo preložil z Efrájimove na Manásejevo glavo.
17.en: When Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand on the head of Ephraim, it displeased him. He held up his father’s hand, to remove it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s head.

18.sl: Rekel je očetu: »Ne tako, oče! Kajti ta je prvorojenec; polôži desnico na njegovo glavo!«
18.en: Joseph said to his father, “Not so, my father; for this is the firstborn; put your right hand on his head.”

19.sl: Oče pa ni hotel in je rekel: »Vem, moj sin, vem. Tudi iz njega bo nastalo ljudstvo in tudi on bo velik; toda njegov mlajši brat bo večji od njega in iz njegovih potomcev bo nastala polnost narodov.«
19.en: His father refused, and said, “I know, my son, I know. He also will become a people, and he also will be great. However, his younger brother will be greater than he, and his seed will become a multitude of nations.”

20.sl:
Blagoslovil ju je torej tisti dan in rekel:
 »S teboj bo Izrael blagoslavljal, govoreč:
 ›Stôri te Bog kakor Efrájima in kakor Manáseja!‹«
 Tako je postavil Efrájima pred Manáseja.
20.en: He blessed them that day, saying, “In you will Israel bless, saying, ‘God make you as Ephraim and as Manasseh’” He set Ephraim before Manasseh.

21.sl: Izrael je rekel Jožefu: »Umrl bom, a Bog bo z vami in vas bo pripeljal nazaj v deželo vaših očetov.
21.en: Israel said to Joseph, “Behold, I am dying, but God will be with you, and bring you again to the land of your fathers.

22.sl: Tebi dam en gorski hrbet več kakor tvojim bratom. Vzel sem ga iz rok Amoréjcev s svojim mečem in lokom.«
22.en: Moreover I have given to you one portion above your brothers, which I took out of the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow.”

1.sl: Jakob je poklical svoje sinove in rekel: »Zberite se, da vam naznanim, kaj se vam bo zgodilo v prihodnjih dnevih!
1.en: Jacob called to his sons, and said: “Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you that which will happen to you in the days to come.

2.sl:
Zberite se in poslušajte, sinovi Jakobovi;
 prisluhnite Izraelu, svojemu očetu!
2.en:
Assemble yourselves, and hear, you sons of Jacob;
 Listen to Israel, your father.

3.sl:
Ruben, moj prvorojenec si,
 moja moč in prvina moje moške moči,
 preponosen in premočan.
3.en:
“Reuben, you are my firstborn, my might, and the beginning of my strength;
 The pre-eminence of dignity, and the pre-eminence of power.

5.sl:
Simeon in Levi sta brata;
 njuna meča sta orodje nasilja.
5.en:
“Simeon and Levi are brothers;
 Weapons of violence are their swords.

6.sl:
Moja duša naj ne hodi v njuno družbo,
 naj se moja čast ne druži z njunim občestvom;
 kajti v jezi sta pobila može,
 podivjana pohabila bike.

7.sl:
Prekleta bodi njuna jeza, ker je silna,
 in njuna togota, ker je okrutna!
 Razdelil ju bom v Jakobu
 in ju razkropil v Izraelu.
7.en:
Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce;
 And their wrath, for it was cruel.
 I will divide them in Jacob,
 Scatter them in Israel.

8.sl:
Juda, tebe bodo hvalili tvoji bratje.
 Tvoja roka bo na tilniku sovražnikov,
 priklanjali se ti bodo sinovi tvojega očeta.

9.sl:
Juda je mlad lev;
 od plena, moj sin, si se vzdignil.
 Sklonil se je, se ulegel kakor lev
 in kakor levinja; kdo si ga drzne dražiti?
9.en:
Judah is a lion’s cub.
 From the prey, my son, you have gone up.
 He stooped down, he crouched as a lion,
 As a lioness.
 Who will rouse him up?

10.sl:
Ne bo se umaknilo žezlo od Juda,
 ne vladarska palica izmed njegovih nog,
 dokler ne pride tisti, ki mu pripada, 
 in njemu bodo ljudstva pokorna.
10.en:
The scepter will not depart from Judah,
 Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet,
 Until he comes to whom it belongs.
 To him will the obedience of the peoples be.

11.sl:
Za trto bo privezoval oslička
 in za žlahten trs mladiča oslice;
 v vinu bo pral svojo obleko,
 v grozdni krvi svoje oblačilo.
11.en:
Binding his foal to the vine,
 His donkey’s colt to the choice vine;
 He has washed his garments in wine,
 His robes in the blood of grapes:

12.sl:
Iskré se mu oči od vina
 in zobje so mu beli od mleka.
12.en:
His eyes will be red with wine,
 His teeth white with milk.

13.sl:
Zábulon prebiva ob morskem bregu,
 tam na obrežju ladij,
 na Sidón se s hrbtom naslanja.
13.en:
“Zebulun will dwell at the haven of the sea.
 He will be for a haven of ships.
 His border will be on Sidon.

14.sl:
Isahár je koščen osel,
 ki leži med ograjami.
14.en:
“Issachar is a strong donkey,
 Lying down between the saddlebags.

15.sl:
Videl je, da je počivališče dobro
 in da je dežela prijetna;
 zato je pripognil pleča za breme,
 se udinjal za suženjsko delo.
15.en:
He saw a resting-place, that it was good,
 The land, that it was pleasant;
 He bows his shoulder to the burden,
 And becomes a servant doing forced labor.

16.sl:
Dan  bo sodil svoje ljudstvo
 kakor eden od Izraelovih rodov.
16.en:
“Dan will judge his people,
 As one of the tribes of Israel.

17.sl:
Dan bo kakor kača ob poti,
 gad bo ob stezi,
 ki piči konja v kopita,
 da pade jezdec vznak.
17.en:
Dan will be a serpent in the way,
 An adder in the path,
 That bites the horse’s heels,
 So that his rider falls backward.

18.sl: Tvojo rešitev pričakujem, Gospod!
18.en: I have waited for your salvation, Yahweh.

19.sl:
Gad, bojne čete pritiskajo nanj,
 a on jim pritiska na pete.
19.en:
“Gad, a troop will press on him;
 But he will press on their heel.

20.sl:
Aser ima hrane v obilju,
 on daje kraljevske slaščice.
20.en:
Out of Asher his bread will be fat,
 He will yield royal dainties.

21.sl:
Neftáli je spuščena košuta,
 lepe jelenčke koti.
21.en:
“Naphtali is a doe set free,
 Who bears beautiful fawns.

22.sl:
Rodovitna mladika je Jožef,
 rodovitna mladika ob studencu,
 ki se vzpenja po zidu.

23.sl:
Dražijo ga in obstreljujejo,
 lokostrelci ga preganjajo.
23.en:
The archers have sorely grieved him,
 Shot at him, and persecute him:

24.sl:
Toda trden ostaja njegov lok
 in gibčne njegove lakti in roke.
 To ima od Močnega Jakobovega,
 od tam prihaja Pastir, Izraelova Skala.
24.en:
But his bow abode in strength,
 The arms of his hands were made strong,
 By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob,
 (From there is the shepherd, the stone of Israel),

25.sl:
Bog tvojega očeta naj ti pomaga,
 Bog Mogočni naj te blagoslavlja
 z blagoslovi neba od zgoraj,
 z blagoslovi brezna od spodaj,
 z blagoslovi prsi in materinega naročja.
25.en:
Even by the God of your father, who will help you,
 By the Almighty, who will bless you,
 With blessings of heaven above,
 Blessings of the deep that lies below,
 Blessings of the breasts, and of the womb.

26.sl:
Blagoslóvi tvojega očeta
 so presegli blagoslove večnih gorá,
 meje  večnih gričev.
 Naj pridejo na Jožefovo glavo,
 na tême posvečenega med brati!
26.en:
The blessings of your father
 Have prevailed above the blessings of the ancient mountains,
 Above the bounty of the age-old hills.
 They will be on the head of Joseph,
 On the crown of the head of him who is separated from his brothers.

27.en:
“Benjamin is a ravenous wolf.
 In the morning he will devour the prey.
 At evening he will divide the spoil.”

28.sl: Vsi ti so Izraelovi dvanajsteri rodovi in to jim je govoril njihov oče, ko jih je blagoslavljal. Vsakega je blagoslovil s posebnim blagoslovom.
28.en: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father spoke to them and blessed them. He blessed everyone according to his blessing.

29.sl: Potem jim je zapovedal in rekel: »Pridružen bom svojim ljudem; pokopljite me pri mojih očetih v votlini na polju Hetejca Efróna,
29.en: He charged them, and said to them, “I am to be gathered to my people. Bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,

30.sl: v votlini, ki je na polju Mahpéli nasproti Mamreju v kánaanski deželi! Polje je kupil Abraham od Hetejca Efróna za grobišče.
30.en: in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite as a burial place.

31.sl: Tam so pokopali Abrahama in njegovo ženo Saro, tam so pokopali Izaka in njegovo ženo Rebeko in tam sem pokopal Leo.
31.en: There they buried Abraham and Sarah, his wife. There they buried Isaac and Rebekah, his wife, and there I buried Leah:

32.sl: Polje in votlina na njem sta bila kupljena od Hetovih sinov.«
32.en: the field and the cave that is therein, which was purchased from the children of Heth.”

33.sl: Ko je Jakob nehal zapovedovati sinovom, je potegnil noge nazaj na posteljo. Potem je izdihnil in bil pridružen svojim ljudem.
33.en: When Jacob made an end of charging his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the spirit, and was gathered to his people.

1.sl: Tedaj se je Jožef vrgel na obličje svojega očeta, jokal nad njim in ga poljubljal.
1.en: Joseph fell on his father’s face, wept on him, and kissed him.

2.sl: Potem je zapovedal svojim služabnikom zdravnikom, naj njegovega očeta balzamirajo. In zdravniki so balzamirali Izraela.
2.en: Joseph commanded his servants, the physicians, to embalm his father; and the physicians embalmed Israel.

3.sl: To je trajalo štirideset dni, kajti toliko dni je potrebnih za balzamiranje. Egipčani pa so ga objokovali sedemdeset dni.
3.en: Forty days were fulfilled for him, for that is how many the days it takes to embalm. The Egyptians wept for him for seventy days.

4.sl: Ko so pretekli dnevi njegovega objokovanja, je Jožef spregovoril faraonovi hiši in rekel: »Če sem našel naklonjenost v vaših očeh, govorite, prosim, faraonu in recite:
4.en: When the days of weeping for him were past, Joseph spoke to the house of Pharaoh, saying, “If now I have found favor in your eyes, please speak in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,

5.sl: Moj oče me je zaprisegel in rekel: ›Glej, umiram; v grobu, ki sem si ga izkopal v kánaanski deželi, me pokoplji!‹ Zdaj bi torej rad odšel, da pokopljem očeta; potem se vrnem.«
5.en: ‘My father made me swear, saying, “Behold, I am dying. Bury me in my grave which I have dug for myself in the land of Canaan.” Now therefore, please let me go up and bury my father, and I will come again.’”

6.sl: Faraon je rekel: »Pojdi in pokoplji očeta, kakor te je zaprisegel!«
6.en: Pharaoh said, “Go up, and bury your father, just like he made you swear.”

7.sl: In Jožef je šel, da pokoplje očeta. Z njim so šli vsi faraonovi služabniki, starešine njegove hiše in vsi starešine egiptovske dežele,
7.en: Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, all the elders of the land of Egypt,

8.sl: vsa Jožefova hiša, njegovi bratje in hiša njegovega očeta. Le otroke, drobnico in govedo so pustili v gošenski deželi.
8.en: all the house of Joseph, his brothers, and his father’s house. Only their little ones, their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.

9.sl: Tudi vozovi in konjeniki so šli z njim, tako da je bil sprevod zelo mogočen.
9.en: There went up with him both chariots and horsemen. It was a very great company.

10.sl: Ko so prišli do Goren Atáda, ki leži onkraj Jordana, so imeli veliko žalno slovesnost. Priredil je svojemu očetu sedemdnevno žalovanje.
10.en: They came to the threshing floor of Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, and there they lamented with a very great and sore lamentation. He mourned for his father seven days.

11.sl: Ko so Kánaanci, prebivalci dežele, videli žalovanje v Goren Atádu, so rekli: »To je slovesno žalovanje Egipčanov!« Zato so ta kraj, ki je onkraj Jordana, imenovali Abél Micrájim.
11.en: When the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, “This is a grievous mourning by the Egyptians.” Therefore, the name of it was called Abel Mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.

12.sl: Sinovi so Jakobu storili, kakor jim je bil zapovedal.
12.en: His sons did to him just as he commanded them,

13.sl: Odnesli so ga v kánaansko deželo in ga pokopali v votlini na polju Mahpéle, na polju, ki ga je bil Abraham kupil od Hetejca Efróna za grobišče nasproti Mamreju.
13.en: for his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field, for a possession of a burying-place, from Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.

14.sl: Potem ko je Jožef pokopal svojega očeta, se je vrnil v Egipt, on, njegovi bratje in vsi, ki so šli z njim pokopavat očeta.
14.en: Joseph returned into Egypt—he, and his brothers, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.

15.sl: Ko so Jožefovi bratje videli, da je oče umrl, so rekli: »Kaj, če nas bo Jožef sovražil in nam hotel povrniti vse húdo, ki smo mu ga prizadeli!«
15.en: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “It may be that Joseph will hate us, and will fully pay us back for all of the evil which we did to him.

16.sl: Pristopili so k  Jožefu in rekli: »Tvoj oče je pred smrtjo zapovedal in rekel:
16.en: They sent a message to Joseph, saying, “Your father commanded before he died, saying,

17.sl: ›Tako recite Jožefu: Oh, odpusti vendar hudodelstvo svojih bratov in njihov greh!‹ Res so ti prizadeli húdo, a odpusti vendar zdaj hudodelstvo služabnikov Boga tvojega očeta!« Ko so mu to govorili, se je Jožef zjokal.
17.en: “So you shall tell Joseph, ‘Now please forgive the disobedience of your brothers, and their sin, because they did evil to you.’ Now, please forgive the disobedience of the servants of the God of your father.” Joseph wept when they spoke to him.

18.sl: Tedaj so prišli tudi njegovi bratje, se vrgli predenj in rekli: »Glej, tvoji sužnji smo!«
18.en: His brothers also went and fell down before his face; and they said, “Behold, we are your servants.”

19.sl: Jožef jim je rekel: »Ne bojte se! Sem mar jaz namesto Boga?
19.en: Joseph said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for am I in the place of God?

20.sl: Hoteli ste mi sicer storiti húdo, Bog pa je to obrnil na dobro, da naredi to, kar je očitno danes: da ohrani pri življenju številno ljudstvo.
20.en: As for you, you meant evil against me, but God meant it for good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save many people alive.

21.sl: Ne bojte se torej! Poskrbel bom za vas in za vaše otroke.« Tako jih je tolažil in jim govoril na srce.
21.en: Now therefore don’t be afraid. I will nourish you and your little ones.” He comforted them, and spoke kindly to them.

22.sl: Jožef je prebival v Egiptu, on in hiša njegovega očeta. Živel pa je sto deset let
22.en: Joseph lived in Egypt, he, and his father’s house. Joseph lived one hundred ten years.

23.sl: in videl tretji rod Efrájimovih sinov. Tudi sinovi Manásejevega sina Mahírja so se rodili Jožefu na kolenih.
23.en: Joseph saw Ephraim’s children to the third generation. The children also of Machir, the son of Manasseh, were born on Joseph’s knees.

24.sl: Potem je Jožef rekel bratom: »Umrl bom. Bog pa vas bo gotovo obiskal in vas popeljal iz te dežele v deželo, ki jo je s prisego obljubil Abrahamu, Izaku in Jakobu.«
24.en: Joseph said to his brothers, “I am dying, but God will surely visit you, and bring you up out of this land to the land which he swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”

25.sl: Jožef je zaprisegel Izraelove sinove in rekel: »Gotovo vas bo Bog obiskal; takrat odnesite moje kosti od tod!«
25.en: Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, “God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones from here.”

26.sl: Jožef je umrl star sto deset let. Balzamirali so ga in položili v krsto v Egiptu.
26.en: So Joseph died, being one hundred ten years old, and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
